8wvmQtME5ScEr7JO1dRsTQ.text: I really wish I could give them five stars because I really do like this restaurant. Our first visit was excellent and we decided to visit a second time. On our second visit, our server, who was very nice, was rarely at our table. I think he must have had tables on the opposite side of the restaurant as he only showed up to take orders, drop off drinks and food, and close with desserts. It took almost 10 minutes for our drinks- one Old Fashioned and a beer.   I was so looking forward to the Scotch Beef but when it came it was extremely dry with barely any sauce to be found. As our server was constantly absent, I ate what I could with water and gave up halfway through. Bummer.   Other than that- it was a decent evening. We ended dinner with the salted chocolate volcano cake which I thought was absolutely horrid but my husband loved it.   I think we will consider returning at another time- but I might give other restaurants a try until the memory of choking on dry pot roast fades. :)

ZgIljDw8spJp6eoOA7Uscg.text: This place is superb. Worth every dollar spent.   Went on Christmas Eve and it was packed. Waited about 10 minutes after our reservation time.   Ordered a bottle of wine which they were out of and the waiter suggests  a CHEAPER wine that he thought was just as good. Who does that? That is to be commended! Well, it was very good and a great way to start the meal.  Apps were mussels and about the best beef carpaccio ever. Sauce for the mussels was perfect and they gave us plenty of bread to mop it all up.  Main courses of Steak with Pepper; Scallops and the winner.....Ribbon pasta with chicken sausage. That dish has great flavor and balance.   Dessert is a must. About the best cheesecake I can remember having. It is not your traditional NY style. It is a tall cylinder of extremely light cheese cake with a caramel sauce.   Hope to get to Scottsdale again so I can return for another meal.

BU0I5bxhO2ddRjnZvf0hYg.text: Great for ambiance and all that but I had to send the first dish back because it was advertised as a "chowder" which I assumed would be creamy but when it came to the table it looked like corn succotash with celery and a few hunks of bland fish in it.  GROSS. I HATE sending food back but is was inedible. Just got the scallops hence the 2 stars.  Blehh.

kSPGwsh-XV225uS8gGT1Uw.text: Always love coming here. Excellent food, atmosphere and service for any occasion. Consistent create and innovative. I would only hope for a bit more of that in changing up the menu in the creation of the vegetarian options.

r6MdBwYUrZ7npNxQ5e-KmA.text: Maybe it was just me but the food just didn't do it for me last night.  First the positives--the place is just the right combination of chic and casual at the same time.  Our waiter couldn't have been nicer or more helpful.  I remember loving this place a few years ago but I just didn't think the cuisine was very good this time and I know it has an excellent reputation.  My daughter had the popcorn shrimp but the sauce was a tad pasty.  I had the burrata and tomatoes but the burrata was just too runny.  I know burrata is supposed to be a bit runny but this was too mushy as were the tomatoes.  The biggest disappointment for me was the sole and the NY Strip.  The meat was tough and not flavorful and the fish tasted more like sea bass than sole.  I know this is a harsh review but there is no way to I could put this cuisine in the same category as The Mission, Elements, Roka Akor or Cafe Monarch.  This is not a contemptuous restaurant but I just wish I had loved the food more.

t3-oPW9ihkAwogPsw_GynA.text: I always try to go to a different restaurant every weekend so I decided to try Tarbells since I always pass it on my way to work. I was not pleased. The grilled salmon is really fishy and the bed of potato is crispy like a tostado, doesn't even taste like potato. The ribbon pasta is very hard to eat., portion is really small

qe4Sc5VxTdyqIEEZwY-r5w.text: Amazing decor with a modern and intimate feel. We were in town and decided to try a nice place for wine and dessert, had a glass of red zinfandel (fruitful and easy to drink) and my boyfriend had the vanilla porter (thick body and True to it's name) and a glass of Malbec ( tasty and extremely smooth, definitely suggested).   As we were trying to decide what to have for dessert, the manager came by and introduced himself, very friendly staff, and soon after we had a rosemary caramel cheesecake on the house! The rosemary caramel sauce was thick and tasty but not overwhelmingly sweet at all, the cheesecake itself was thick and creamy, and the crust was perfectly baked, we LOVED it.   since the dessert was so good, we figured why not try out their steak. We shared a steak medium rare which came out split for us without even having to request it to be split. There's a glaze around the steak that we couldn't figure out what it was exactly, but complimented the steak perfectly. Very tender and perfectly cooked. Side of mashed potatoes were well mashed and not runny at all, gravy is by request and has a charred, oak taste to it, delicious.   Overall, we loved it! Will definitely be back next time we pass by Phoenix AZ

wbVZlUedHVkTjLuGRdPUlw.text: This is a lovely little restaurant. It is on a busy corner with a small parking lot but once you are inside the ambiance is charming. There is an intimate dining area and a bar area so you can choose what you are in the mood for.  We were greeted and seated immediately in the dining area.  Our server, Audrey,  was fantastic. I noticed they have a nice wine selection, although I did not have a glass. They offer poutine and we could not turn down the temptation, so we had to start with that.  It was delicious! I wasn't thrilled when I saw how skinny the fries were but the taste was excellent. The menu offers an inviting selection of items and they offer daily specials.  We chose the salmon and the chicken.  The salmon had a sweet sauce which I liked and it was served on a bed of lettuce. The chicken was done perfectly and came with a side of creamy mashed potatoes that will make you want to have them every day.  Refills on waters were prompt and plates were cleared right away. My only regrets are not trying the scotch beef and not being hungry enough for what looked like some fabulous desserts. Guess we have to go back.

WKry-tI7nGh1042jFG8gKg.text: I have four words for this place: Yum, yum, yum and yummy!  I have lived around that restaurant for years and years and finally decided to try it.  The food was to DIE for!  I had the Scotch beef which was amazing.  So tender, juicy, just yummy!  Mashed potatoes were delish and so were the brussel sprouts.  The service was excellent.  Wednesday was our server and she rocked it.  I will be taking my clients/friends there a soon as possible.    P.S.  Did I say that the food was yummy?   That is an understatement!

_1AXy5fjPAUxDuT7lIWbmg.text: My husband and I eat here frequently and I never take it for granted. I never know what wonderful dining adventure will await me. Tonight I had the halibut with mussels in a wonderful broth with vegetables. The halibut was cooked to perfection and the broth and vegetables complimented it exquisitely. I have never had anything but the best food here, creatively prepared, and served with excellent service. Yay for Mark Tarbell.

Dhvi3MgZeal7Wo6C0R3XjQ.text: This is truly one of the best, most consistent high-end restaurants in Phoenix. Reservations can be challenging even though its been around for years, has no view, parking is tight and is located in a strip mall. It's that good. The food is fresh, and perfectly prepared -- every time. Service is attentive. Mr. Tarbell may stop by your table and help with menu suggestions. The ribbon pasta is a signature dish with house made pasta. The strip steak is fabulous. The fish of the moment is always great. The "beyond prime" beef carpaccio  is exotic, rich and tasty as an appetizer. The wine list is off the charts with bottles ranging from about $50 to $5,000. I was there once as a guest on an expense account dinner and the $2,500 bottles were poured. It was fun to watch and Tarbell's is a place that knows how to handle big spenders. For dessert, the creme brulee is my favorite. I probably go there once a month and have never been disappointed.

GDJrq-F28gY7yxToqqflvA.text: Unfortunately, I can only give 3 stars. The meal started off great. The mussels were very good! The wine tasted as though it had been open for a bit too long. Either that or they poured cheap wine in place of the menu advertisements. Ordered the Special...Sole. Honestly Sole is not a five star restaurant fish but figured I'd give it a try...bust. The hubby ordered scallops and they were very unimpressive as well.

3qxpj_KISoyeHsSZ7iPwwQ.text: Fabulously lively ambiance and deliciously satiating cuisine. Love the team of waiters and busboys and that Mark Tarbell is often around, saying hello and checking in with his patrons. Even the hostesses are friendly. Just a wonderful restaurant on so many different levels.

P41fdbi0j9YD0deALIPsZQ.text: Food.....FIVE stars Service..FIVE STARS Ambiance..FIVE STARS VALUE.....Five stars  All in all...one of the BEST restaurants in the area...and in my world of dining out.  A double great evening.  Thank you, Keith (Stanley Tucci), for the superlative service.  You rock.

4CUQjAHZ2iiWFXKf5EroTw.text: Hubby and I came here for Valentines Day, which happens to be his birthday.  We are in our early 30's and let's just say we brought down the average age by about 15 years.  The food and service were excellent.  Cocktails - delish and on point!    Definitely an older demographic.  Doesn't bother me for date night, but I probably wouldn't do a group dinner here for that reason.

Kd9UAwRLGUpLCEgleZjQKw.text: There are so many great restaurants in Central Phoenix, that I expect good food when I go to a place like Tarbell's!  This was our first time there and we were celebrating our 24th anniversary with another couple. We definitely made the right choice for our celebration.  We had a couple of cocktails before we came to the restaurant, and we were in a festive mood. Our waiter, Nathan, picked up on the vibe right away, and was a great sport, as well as a great server. We were in the mood to try different items, and he was very accommodating. We started with the Candied Bacon, and we all split a Beet salad (they split it and it came out beautifully presented).  Dinner was more of the same. We each had an entree, and it was hard to decide what to order. Nathan actually brought two sample bowls of food we didn't order, just for us to try, since we had struggled in choosing. The mussels and the scallops were crazy good! The mussels were the creamiest I may have ever eaten, and a terrific size! The squid ink pasta and gnocchi were both made in house and were terrific!  The spaghetti and meatballs should be labeled, "huge delicious meatball (1) and spaghetti."  Again, it was awesome. The meatball was made from multiple meats, was fresh from the oven, and had a taste that was terrific.  The wine list is plentiful and provides a great deal of variety, but doesn't feel overwhelming.  We chose a couple of mid priced blends, that they priced at reasonable restaurant rates.  The food, along with Nathan's great service made this a night to remember.

mFfnPlM7zVQrcvvOB-QNPQ.text: One word- AMAZING!  Everything from the drink to the desert was great.  The veggie dish they says is made with love- they are not kidding! Best veggie dish I have ever eaten. Everything that my friends had was great too. Except for the meatball which they said they did not like very much.  But hey- that's why i stick to veggies!

WgXnYJdqEWX-xFOHNTiaXQ.text: TRULY a 5 star place! The food, the wine, the staff, the ambiance...all of us from out-of-town (different cosmopolitan areas) and ALL of us agreed, best of best!  'We'll be back!!"

KTpi5HYUEQWmsKFhbV1wkg.text: I had really high expectations for Tarbell's. We'd heard (and read) really good things. We went on a Saturday night, and the restaurant was full.   The positives---the staff was really exceptional. They were super friendly and attentive. I also loved the roasted (deep fried?) chick peas that were on the table as a starter. They were super delicious. Also, our main proteins (husband had steak, I had the scallops) were cooked technically well and the presentation was very nice. My scallop plate was probably the prettiest plate of food I've been served.   However, the flavors were just not that great. My entree lacked salt/savory flavors, and the root vegetables on my plate were not cooked long enough, so they were quite tough. My husband said his steak was cooked a perfect medium rare, but the flavor just wasn't special or memorable. He ordered a side of brussels sprouts, which was actually his favorite part of the dinner. Overall, the food was just OK. I had expected the food to be 5 stars, but in reality, I've eaten at many many better restaurants.  Nothing about Tarbell's was memorable. The decor and the vibe was not cool or unique. The majority of the patrons were elderly. We definitely would not go back there.  P.S. I ate at Tarbell's Tavern (next door, more of a bar menu) a couple weeks ago, and I liked their food and atmosphere better than Tarbell's.

7HEkOBIamFAgLo7cr5jGrg.text: Was taken here for my birthday. I didn't pick it, had never been here and will never return.  Service was abysmal and slow. Other tables were served before us and my water glass or those of my dining companions were not refilled once during our time here.  Food was ok but for the price and reputation, we expected much better. There was sand and grit on my scallops. Risotto was salty and gummy.   We skipped dessert.  Words can't begin to describe how horrible this experience was.

H97Ca1PaVtdVwCHEKotuCw.text: This has been a favorite of ours for 16 years. Countless birthdays, anniversaries and date nights were celebrated here. We had a reservation to celebrate a birthday and were treated like a couple of high school kids out for prom who couldn't afford to split a pizza at this place. To say it was clear they needed to turn our table was an understatement. When they screwed up our dessert order while delivering a dessert complete with candles to the next table (apparently also celebrating a birthday) it was the last straw. We won't be be back

kh-CHpauTsT099g9KmiX1g.text: We had dinner here the other night.  Wonderful, very good service, great suggestions, they gave us a really good seat.  The mozzarella is amazing and the chicken sausage pasta was done perfectly... enough for two to share.  A great experience with very good prices, you are paying for the high quality food and not the location.  Loved it!

rmd00DxOxJXo7V9pK2VIDQ.text: I will start off by saying that my wife likes this place much more than I do.  The ambiance is nice.  Has the feel of an upscale restaurant.  Drinks are very good.  Nice wine selection and cocktails are well made.  The service seems to be hit and miss.  I have been there twice and the first time, the service was great.  The second time it was very poor.  The food is a bit of an anomaly to me.  It is very flavorful and presented well.  However, all the dishes I have tried have been so rich and heavy, that I have regretted eating them afterwards.  I felt full and uncomfortable for hours after going to Tarbell's.  Maybe this is just a personal preference, but I have been to France, where rich food is a staple and this seems even more over the top than any of the places I have tried there.  The handmade pasta was swimming in a pool of butter and the red wine gravy for the scotch beef nearly coagulated because there was so much butter and sugar in it.  I'm all for good taste, but I am not a fan.

5lB0F_lEB069SYkdZpj-DQ.text: Went to Tarbell's for our first anniversary dinner. We had a reservation at 8, showed up 10 minutes early and were seated immediately. The wine list is extensive and they carry several unique beers, which is always a bonus. We started with mac and cheese - divine. The cheese was sharp and the noodles were firm. We had oysters as well, extremely fresh and cold, perfect. Our server was very friendly and helpful. I really wanted a NY strip, but it's served with creamed spinach, which I don't care for. Our waiter suggested subbing the sides from the chicken dish. I know that seems simple but some places don't substitute - I guess some chefs know better than the guests. Husband had scallops and said they were fabulous. We ordered dessert, which came out with Happy Anniversary written on the plate, which I thought was ultra cool since I only made a reference to that on the online reservation - we never told anyone personally. How thoughtful! Husband said the cheesecake was creamy and thick, exactly right (not a cheesecake fan so I'll trust him). I am, however, a bread pudding fan. Their bread pudding was ok. I found it to be too dry, not enough custard. The flavor was quite nice though. Overall, this was a romantic and delicious dinner, thank you to everyone at Tarbell's!

8U1dK99FlAlgZog_wMNicA.text: We missed what the fuss is all about.  Had heard about the place forever, finally went and had just ok experience.  Wedge salad for $11 bucks?  Sorry, you lost me there...esp when I ordered it without the famous blue cheese and got charged the same anyway.   Nothing fatal about this place, but with all the other great restaurants around Scottsdale, I would go elsewhere.

WKWQE7IWk9Lc_rNBtktU8A.text: This is my favorite restaurant!.  They do everything right.  The food is amazing the service is amazing and the overall customer service can't be touched.  This establishment is the whole package.  A few of my favorite dishes are the scotch beef and the chicken sausage pasta.  The cheese pizza is divine as well.  No wonder Mark beat Cat Cora on Iron Chef America.  Try this place you will not be dissappointed!

f427iBGSRweoHJTkCnwL_A.text: Tarbell's has good food, good service and a comfortable ambiance. I had the beet salad and it was amazing! The halibut had a nice broth and the pea leaves were a nice touch! My only complaint is that the stringy part of the pea leaves (the shoot) should've been removed (not edible). In Chinese cooking, a lot of labor goes into removing this stringy portion of the shoot. The beef dish with the buttermilk mashed potatoes were melt in your mouth delish! The ice cream cream puff dessert was good, but not to die for. My friend and I stopped by after going to a kids soccer game and we were a bit underdressed. The wait staff was friendly and it wasn't  problem.

c1Hc-s1xlOD3rc8DZi6img.text: This place is 5 stars.  a pillar of Phoenix eating

mcM614sXfg8dC5QUEzwUAQ.text: Really great food and service, and it worked out just fine for my two kids, ages 7 and 10. (Meatball pizza was a hit for the younger one; the older one shared sausage pizza and mussels.) The food came very quickly. We had all small plates and pizza, not entrees: kale chips, fried chickpeas, peppers, mozzarella salad. Dessert was great. The mousse was first rate, and the parsnip creme brulee was delicious (though we couldn't taste any parsnip; it just tasted like excellent, flavorful creme brulee). One of the best meals we had in Arizona. And we also really liked the decor. Simple, elegant, and also fun/creative. Not sure why anyone would ding them for that. Also, the portion sizes were just fine. We all left full but not feeling gross. We're from MA, and were unaware of the chef's celebrity. I wonder if some of the griping here is just celebrity bashing, or a reaction against some sort of hype? I'm outside that loop, but it just struck us as an excellent and fun place with great food and no pretension. Just thorough competence. Note: It's a nice walk from the Arizona Biltmore Hotel. Under 2 miles.

StZ8afIULJJ_mV_p3METOg.text: Good food and good service.  The Olive oil they used was really flavorfull.  Felt the prices were higher than the quality and quantity of food given or would have gave a 5.

qeio5rPWQIMoD-VLTurXcw.text: I have eaten here four or five times.  We always get the mussels to start, and they are always delicious and cooked just right.  The broth is great for dipping the bread in, although I could probably just use a straw.  The fish of the day was halibut.  It was very flavorful, but maybe just a tad overcooked.  The scallops were wonderful.  Great wine selection.  This place a lively atmosphere.  Not too noisy to hear across the table, but a good vibe.  The service was excellent.

5Ew5CW47D4AFX6-6oh_wAg.text: The only bad thing here, the acoustics...and waiting for a table even though we made reservations a week ahead of time for my birthday. (Waiting when you have a reservation and then having he staff expect you to spend money at the bar is just a pet peeve of mine) The food isn't overly fancy. Its just very fresh, made well with great ingredients. The scotch beef was fab as was the chocolate cake. The service was decent even though they were busy. It was hard because the tables are so close to each other, but it worked out ok. Def worth a try, but I would warn them that there are a few things they could work on, food isn't one of them. The portions are perfect and everything is cooked perfectly. AND my mom is a chef and she was with us and agreed:)

t3FtTmfNo0I7uZADO753RA.text: In our family, we have two birthdays around the holidays, so I had the chance to review two restaurants in two days, both for fine meals. On my son's birthday, the three of us went to Southern Rail, and the next night, to celebrate my wife's birthday we went to Tarbell's. Both were good in the food department. I'm giving Tarbell's a lower rating because of the terrible service we had that night -- and because it compared so terribly with the service we had at Southern Rail the night before. The food was not bad -- in fact, when the owner came by we were enjoying a terrific appetizer of roasted beets and it seemed to indicate a great meal was coming up. But then, things began to deteriorate as the night went on. We had an early reservation (6:30) and things were fine till our waiter had larger tables on either side of us. While this guy was taking care of his larger checks, we were neglected to the point that we never received a birthday treat for my wife (which was absolutely huge at Southern Rail), and to the point where we actually had to get up and flag the guy down to get our bill. Really, just quite poor service. It appears after our Tarbell's experience that any restaurant, even one with good fare, needs to review how the wait staff deals with smaller tables when those guests are sandwiched in between larger groups. [Hey, Mark -- I spent $150, aren't I entitled to a waiter when I need one?] For my money, I'll take Southern Rail. While the environment is not as sophisticated, the large plates of delicious food were simply outstanding and our waiter cared a great deal about ensuring our satisfaction. We hope that on our next visit to Tarbell's we'll receive a bit more attention.

2hUlINT1RFAaWBd72TNgyQ.text: Had an early Valentine's Day dinner on Sunday.  This is our favorite place in town and the food was wonderful as always, but soup came room-temperature.  They quickly replaced it with steaming-hot bowls, so no harm no foul.   My only real problem is that the service was rushed.  The waiter was friendly, but not very attentive and food came too quickly. (Yes, that is possible for a romantic dinner out!)  Maybe they have spoiled me, but I expect a bit more from this place.

30hPsHW8D4OGe2r1ymwG6w.text: I hadn't been to Tarbell's in while and I always enjoy the food there, so the Beautiful Carin and I went for dinner a couple of nights ago. As always the food was first rate.  Carin and split a Caesar salad (I think that's becoming a theme with us, but the Caeser here is pretty good, with anchovies on request). I had the salmon, which I hadn't had before, and it was good (I don't usually get seafood in Phoenix...even Salt Cellar, Wildlfish, Ocean Club, etc., don't really measure up to Portland, Seattle and SFO, where I spent so much of my misspent youth). Carin had the pan-roasted chicken, which is also quite good. On previous visits I have had the mustard Pork Chop (which I can also recommend) and the Cheese burger (which isn't as good as others in the area. Add a couple of glasses of Syrah and it was a very pleasant dinner.  The service was good (attentive but not intrusive or rushed) and while not cheap at $100 for 2, it's not the priciest by a good big margin, and well worth it! I think of Tarbells when I want something that's comfortable but upscale and a little bit different (not just another steak or grilled Chilean Sea Bass with some kind of glaze). Mark Tarbell has thought this place out pretty well, and it's a very appealing spot.

gbagkcUOZHcVFaTONe3MnA.text: Add this spot to your bucket list. I'm a totally spoiled food snob and LOVE Tarbell's. The food is AMAZING as is the service with lovely ambiance. They really know how to balance flavors, cook everything to perfection, and use the freshest ingredients. Don't even get me started on the mac and cheese.

rp9D3kCtjVGXMLsFYrQ7oA.text: This was my 2nd time here.  If you order the mussels for a starter, be prepared...  they bring enough to feed 4 people.  The wine sauce with the mussels was the best I've had. My only complaint, there was no bucket.  You have to shell on your appetizer plate.  I had a beef dish that was marinated in brandy or some liquor.  Delicious.  My wife had Mahi and she loved it.  The service is 5-star.  Wine list is insane and they have a lot of wines by glass.  They also have a great selection of rare drinks like buddhahand vodka.  Lastly, I'm always a big fan of complimentary valet parking.

cJ0P_xlebvm8aFi23V6D6g.text: Every March my brother, father and I go out to Arizona for Spring Training and my father's bday. This year my brother, who's a vegan, was not able to make it.  Therefore, I was looking for a place we could get a hearty cut of meat. I found Tarbell's on Yelp and saw the photos of that huge pork chop.  The photo, along with the favorable reviews led me to my decision to make reservations.  However, I was very disappointed that they no longer have the pork chop on the menu.  We had reservations at 8:30, but got there around 7:45 to have a drink and watch the Cal Poly basketball game. The bartender was very nice and knowledgeable on their wines. He provided us with a sample of a Cab, which my dad later got with his meal.  While having a drink, the couple next to us was brought a beautiful dish of 5 huge diver scallops. My father and I decided that we would get an order of the scallops and a meat dish to split. We started with a salad that had uncooked butternut squash and fried parsnips. The butternut squash was surprisingly good. It was cut thin so it was not overly crunchy, as I had assumed uncooked butternut would be. The salad had a homemade parsnip vinagerette that was light refreshing and wonderful. The scallops were to die for, by far the best I have ever had. They came on top of mushroom risotto that was also excellent. Unfortunately though the Tar's Scotch Beef was pretty bland. The meat was under seasoned and not very good unless mixed with the mashed potatoes and red wine gravy to make it flavorful. All in all a very good meal...I still wish I could've had the pork chop though.

d8oAJ3S4e9DBNU6NUur2yw.text: Hands Down. The best food I have ever eaten. I've always watched the Food Channel and wondering what critics were saying when "flavors marry each other" or "food melts in your mouth". Well, I'm not a professional critic. But now I know exactly what they  were talking about. I ordered appetizer, salad, main course and dessert and had a food orgasm in my mouth!

OQjAA5oEmyfmjrh_9uqRbg.text: Food is excellent. I had the ribbon pasta with a spicy fennel chicken sausage.  Party of 6, and whether it was fish, steak, or pasta, superior plate presentation, food quality, taste, and temp. Outstanding meal. Terrific wines.  A big however, the ventilation of the kitchen is poor. Throughout the evening, the smelly smoke from the kitchen flowed into the whole restaurant, which clung onto our clothing after departure. In addition, the waiter service was excellent and formal, however initial time to take our order was 10 mins.

K9QrEpzfU_oqggb9f3rdQw.text: I have to say that overall I was disappointed with my first visit to Tarbell's. When we made our reservation we made sure to let them know it was our anniversary and to please accommodate us with an out of the way table. When we arrived we were informed that they were running late and it would be 20 minutes until they could seat us. We sat at the bar and the bar staff was great. They were super busy but we got quick service and good cocktails. After about 20 minutes the hostess came to seat us but they didn't have any tables in the dinner room and she sat us in the bar and right next to the door.   It was super packed and loud, which would have been fine for hanging out at happy hour but not so much for what was supposed to be a romantic anniversary dinner.  We ordered muscles and oddly some tasted very minerally and others very creamy and mushy.  There was nothing wrong with the scallops but also nothing very memorable. We also had the Bolognese which sounded like it was going to be amazing but the spice they put in it really drowns out the other flavors. The pasta with it was cooked perfectly.   The support staff was great. Every person who delivered food to us was able to knowledgeably answer questions about the dishes and wine pairings  I might consider coming back here for a drink at the bar but I wouldn't eat here again.

14pvLblqxG06fwWsGBmjsQ.text: This is a really Cheffy place to go. Tarbell is like one of the Iron Chef masters I see on the Food Network. Oh wait-- he actually is an Iron Chef winner and I really did see him on the Food Network ...  The restaurant is beautiful, from the moment you walk in. It isn't too big so there is generally a lot of intimacy at your table. An amazing wine selection, some affordable and some extremely expensive and high-quality.  Every employee from the manager to the hostess to the server is clean and articulate and knowledgeable about the menu.   They have interesting things on the menu that I just don't see that often. I haven't necessarily liked every single thing I've had (duck sausage) but I have tried a lot of new things by eating here that are not even available elsewhere. I mean... When was last time you saw duck sausage on a menu?  Some of my favorites on the menu include their prime rib, New York strip, risotto, the salmon, the beet salad, and the seasonal vegetable plate. Their menu, at least part of it, changes with the seasons so everything you get is fresh and tasty.  So, it is Cheffy and upscale, and maybe not a place you would go to every week or even every month. But you'll have a great experience and it won't break the bank even if it will be a little bit pricey.

XmqGbQExQKbmUOQ0kdWAdQ.text: This place is fantastic in terms of food and service. Wait staff is what you would expect of a place like this and the menu, while expensive, is fairly priced in my opinion. The mussels appetizer ($18) was on point and the remaining broth made for great dipping with the bread. I had the halibut special ($36) which including a surprising good portion of fish. My girlfriend had the braised beef dish ($32) which was also very good, but very rich. Next time I would like to try the lobster and gnocchi.  Wine is the most expensive drink on the menu with $12/glass being the floor. Cocktails are between $10 and $13 while the beer selection is strong and fairly priced. I had a $6 Stone IPA.

8H4sJj7gJDA63eYoMyB1zg.text: Not the place to eat or have an adult beverage.  My vodka on the rocks was WATERED, the wine was weak.  Dinner was mediocre say a C.  Avoid the expense an disappointment go to jack n the  box

ryWx36nCsxZdQmhhJjVDJQ.text: I'm not sure why all the negativity on the other reviews. The decor is not dated, it just doesnt follow the same industrial hipster look almost everywhere else has these days. As for the food, the carpaccio was good (although would benefit from some pecorino added to the Parmesan for a nice salty kick) the scotch beef was great, and the seasonal scallop dish was absolutely fantastic. The mushroom risotto was probably the best of the dishes. I also appreciated that the wine list gave some love to non-pinot/cab reds and was not overpriced any more  than expected. I also popped for the Chateau d'Yquem Sauternes, which I cannot recommend strongly enough, despite the absurd price.

IgKwKnC-lN1sVUAeVCt4BQ.text: It pains me to write this kind of review.  I've been to Tarbells several times over the years. Now that we live closer, I've been twice in the past 4 months. The first time was excellent and last night was a real miss.  First of all, the service is excellent and the wine list is terrific. I have no complaints about either.   However, every member of our party thought the food just average. The dishes worthy of change include: - the salmon. I had it and it was way below average. Essentially, it's a piece of salmon with a nice sweet glaze, with some greens sitting on a bed of over-fried hash browns. The hash brown thing was just odd. - the beet salad - roasted beets in a sauce with arugula. Nothing delicate about this dish - a large quantity of beets chopped in a nondescript sauce.  - The steak - a hunk of beef with some greens/chard and a scallop potato cake. Our guest declared it good.  Overall, quite disappointing. Restaurant was full, service was excellent. I've been when it was better.

gdXw4z-OMJZeCX_Lbr4Wxg.text: Things started in a typical way...after never quite getting there, let's finally make a reservation at Tarbell's for our anniversary dinner. We've heard so much about this place, seen Chef Tarbell at various events and on tv, heard all the acclaim from friends, but we never quite got there. So finally, four years ago, we made it, and there is no looking back. For us, Tarbell's has gone from this "special event" destination restaurant, to "hey it's mid-week and were nearby so let's grab a quick dinner". Sure it still is a special place (we went for date night last weekend) but it's so very accessible, friendly, and welcoming that it's hard not to want to come here any day of the week. The bar staff is uber talented with very solid spins on classics, excellent back bar particularly the brown spirit selections, the wine list has hidden affordable gems (like the Wind Gap chard we had last weekend) and its share of rare bottles as well, the wait staff is always knowledgeable and friendly, no pretension here, and the food is top-notch. I don't know of any kitchen in PHX that is doing sauces as good as this place. Proteins are always cooked just so, and the accompaniments always compliment. Love this place.

ZW6rDZjUE-V9PWLWJIHElA.text: Tarbell's is ok. The food isn't that good. And the wait staff is fantastic. Tonight, we ordered the best escargot I've ever had. Then our waiter misheard my girlfriend when taking our orders. She and I are both servers, so we were alright with it. I know I've misheard my customers before. The waiter came back with the correct dish. But sadly, it wasn't very good. My halibut was fairly average, but I finished it with no complaints. When we were done we had the brussel sprouts boxed, but not my girlfriend's plate. Seeing this, the server had our ENTIRE meal comped! I never asked for that gesture! Their customer service goes above and beyond!!!

6niTRxKv_h_bBh93SNp2fg.text: This has been my favorite restaurant for the last ten years - I've had many dinners and even a few special events there.  Mark Tarbell is a great guy and he often hangs around the restaurant on weekends (and keeps the staff on their toes!).  If I had to pick the best items on the menu, I would recommend the Beef Carpaccio and the Spaghetti and Meatballs.

YRkMkQdkx_wV21w9M0Ozvw.text: Tarbell's exceeded my high expectations! ...warm greeting...attention to detail (remembered to greet tha bf Happy Birthday from the phone message I had left for our rsvp the day prior)...our steaks cooked to perfection (I had medium rare, and he had medium)...flavorful and GENEROUS portions of sides THAT CAME ALONG WITH THE MEAL (creamed spinach AND YUMMY potatoes au grautin). All the pinky up restaurants that we've been frequenting make ya order the sides separately, so this was a welcomed, awesome surprise! They even presented tha bf with a complimentary creme brulee bday prez. We shall be back!

jBDBSQ5Zjo8ujXxO5ifTag.text: We went last night for a birthday dinner. I e-mailed the restaurant night before asking that I knew Mark is busy but if he could sign Happy Birthday on anything for my babe that would be awesome. Not only did he sign a menu, but he personalized it with what we ate (warm bacon candy). Of course the food was excellent, The Meatball & Spaghetti, NY strip. Such a great night on this special occasion!

photos.caption: Photo of Tarbell's - Phoenix, AZ, United States

tjM4Jm8wQw-K8bD5yS5_yw.text: My wife and I had dinner at Tarbell's at 7:15pm on July 21st.  My first impression was that it was noisy; it was a Saturday night and they were busy.  I had expected something a little more laid back and romantic.  This was definitely not the time nor the day for the quiet romantic dinner. We started with the Tuna Tartar appetizer which was delicious.  I had the Tenderloin with Lump Crab which came on a bed of mashed potatoes accompanied by grilled and carmelized carrots.  The Tenderloin was cooked perfectly (extremely rare) and had great flavor; a very nice piece of meat.  The Lump Crab was very good also, but I felt it was over-kill and really didn't accompany the Tenderloin well.  My wife had the Lobster Gnocci which she said was excellent.  We didn't have dessert, even though I was tempted by the peach crisp.  Tarbell's is an excellent restaurant; when we return, it will be at an early hour and during the week.

vcOCAvRoF35F9he3uNHkFA.text: Went in because I heard it had a nice bourbon selection.  We were not disappointed.   I politely greeted by the hosted who answered all our questions then got a seat at the bar.    The bartender was very good, attentive and made a fantastic Old Fashioned.     After a drink we were asked to be seated at a table for dinner.  Our waiter (Drew) was friendly, knowledgeable of the menu and did a good job making the specials sound very appetizing.   My wife enjoyed the Halibut (Special of the day) it was large portion, beautifully presented and perfectly cooked.  I had the Scotch Steak which was an upscale Pot Roast but it was excellent.   The Manager, Seth, stopped by to see how everything was and we talked bourbon for a bit.   I was very impressed with the Tarbell's Elijah Craig private barrel.   Desserts of Chocolate Cake with Pistachio Gelato and Ganache and The Beloved Chocolate Mousse with Fair-Trade Chocolate were well presented and topped off a wonderful night.   Overall we were impressed with the staff and food and look forward to returning.

rgBXpHKAp-LmOpUTlQNqhA.text: Always reliable excellent food. Most recent Visit had the swordfish special and seafood chowder and side of spinach. Fish perfectly cooked, chowder excellent seasoning.

wULbRz2ePEoECVnCrA2gcw.text: Have not been back here in a long time. Was just marvelous. I had the swordfish special with all kinds of delicious surprises. My husband had the salmon. Not only beautifully presented but great flavors. We had started out with the calamari appetizer which our wonderful waiter split for us without being asked to. Impressive! Allan our waiter was just wonderful and saw to all our needs. The calamari was tender and not over breaded or fried. Just perfect and melted in your mouth. Will return soon even though for us it's a 30-40 minute drive.

ttkWXJbmtql9UrLU5wd_Kg.text: Always solid. Go see Mikey and Nicole at the bar. Great cocktail selections and stellar wine list. Service is always prompt and professional. The Tavern next door is great too for a more casual choice.

GijLpUgf3yALxVM7woDOSQ.text: We've been before.  Last visit on 12/17 a disappointment.  A meager portion of over cooked calamari.   The shishito peppers didn't have the expected char and if they used any seasoning you wouldn't know it.  First two selections from wine list list were out of stock.  Maybe it is Scottsdale but a shockingly small selection of wine under $100 and most from the Cabernets were not well known.   Pardon me but a wedge salad is a wedge of iceberg not other lettuce  piled  up which this was. The candied bacon was so hard as to be inedible.    There two paper thin slices of tomato.  All in all not just overpriced but a poor value with mediocre food at best

lK8giBuIpUbQuAoSsYoUgg.text: There are a lot of restaurants in the Phoenix area, but then there's Tarbell's . None better for great service & wonderful food. My wife & I have been going there since they opened in 1994. No matter what you order, be it a cocktail, a glass or bottle of wine it's top notch. Mark Tarbell is a gentleman from the old days & we are lucky to have him here in the Phoenix area.  Treat yourself and your companion to a meal. You won't be sorry.

pmvaVfQfbaKPFNxe0REd1Q.text: Always a great meal. Variety on the menu, including seasonal features. Get the Scotch Beef or the Meatball or the fresh fish. Very good targeted wine list. If you're by yourself the bar is a great place to sit and eat.   The beat part is that the profiteroles are back on the menu!  Thanks Mark!

C41qHsAXQTxoknMciSl-JQ.text: Sis and b-I-l were passing through town on a short vacation. Searched Yelp for a great place for food and conversation. Tarbell's was the right choice.  We started off sharing a bacon soft boiled egg appetizer which was quickly devoured. Three of our party chose to order scallops and I was the odd person out and ordered Mr Fish of the day. I was served a delicious portion of halibut. All dinners were served with a corn couscous and mixed vegetables. Hubby declared his dish the best scallops he has ever eaten. For a man who thinks "it was okay" is high praise saying the best ever is momentous. I expected the heavens to open up or the earth to shake!  We each ordered a different dessert: vanilla cheesecake with rosemary caramel sauce, chocolate molten cake with salted caramel sauce, creme brulee, and chocolate mousse. No one shared their dessert. They were that good!  We arrived just as the restaurant opened. Our server, Nathan, greeted us and we knew he was going to be a "good fit" with our party. He was as attentive to our table as he was personable. Nathan wasn't afraid to give recommendations and he was spot on. There were two young gentlemen assisting Nathan who were cheery and helpful. A great server is a key part of a great experience and Tarbell's knocked out of the park with these three.  All in all we were the table that enjoyed their food, appreciated their server, and probably laughed a little too often and a little too loud.  Our tab for appetizer, two rounds of drinks, entrees and dessert came to $290 with tax and before tip.   A great dining experience that I recommend you try.

IbfYUSImgsJbGscdxRuT6Q.text: They do a great job even if sitting at the bar. Solid and stable menu and super consistent. My last meal before death penalty would be pepper steak and bread pudding. Awesome

Fsrd9iEYUhPJ75zaD0vbtA.text: I cannot wait to come back here. It was our 3rd anniversary and decided to try something new. We've driven by this place a few times and after reading the Yelp reviews, we decided we had to try it. I am so glad we did! We arrived around 7pm on a Tuesday evening. They asked if we had a reservation and we didn't, but luckily one table was open and we were sat immediately. Our server, Jillian I think, arrived promptly and boy was she energetic! Super friendly and helpful. She gave us some time to ponder the menu and while we did, fresh bread and olive oil arrived. For starters, we ordered the Brussels sprouts. For our main entrees, I ordered the house-made ribbon pasta and my husband ordered Tar's scotch beef. Jillian commented on our 'good choices' and placed the order. It arrived super quickly and OMG. Taste explosion! My pasta's sauce was to die for. I had to use a spoon to scoop every bite up. The chicken sausage and tomatoes were delicious as well. My husband's beef was like a pot roast and tasty as well. For dessert, we split the pecan pie. I'd skip this the next time and definitely try something different. Overall, this place was delicious. Super fast and friendly service and fantastic food. We'll definitely be back!

mUj5FprDZcNfkjp1L_YSAQ.text: I have been coming to Tarbell's for some years now.  It first started with "the place" the hubs & I would come to celebrate an event....anniversary, birthday, mother's day, etc.  Now it's the place we go for a wonderful night together or to bring out of town guests or even those who've never experienced this gem!  Not once in all the years we've dined here, did we ever leave disappointed.  Mark & his staff knows how to treat people here, like they are part of his family.  They are always willing to  customize your entree by giving you a sampler of something if you can't decide between two items or change a side if you don't like what's offered.  They always aim to please!  Mark comes around personally to visit each table & has a friendly, top notch staff to support him that seems to genuinely like being there.    Being a creature of habit, I usually get the Ribbon Pasta with Chicken sausage and it's perfection, has me dreaming of my next visit!  A light, but complex broth with wide egg noodles, campari tomatoes, spinach & a fennel chicken sausage that's just amazing. The warm bacon candy salad is a party in your mouth!  Really, it's that good!!  I've also had the salmon & sea bass (a special that night), both worthy of a repeat visit!  The atmosphere has a comfortable, non-pretentious, neighborhood vibe that welcomes you whether your in jeans or a dress.  Hubs loves Marks Famous Spaghetti & Meatballs and the Grilled NY strip, I mean really, how can you go wrong!  Warm Chocolate cake, Profiteroles & Creme Brulee are just what the doctor ordered to put this one on the top of anyone's list!!

-2vP6RHAQXDaKfF1BSNKLA.text: I have no complaints about Tarbell's. I've eaten here more than a dozen times and have never been disappointed. I met the owner Mark Tarbell, which made me fall in love with this place even more. They use as much local organic produce as as they possibly can and rather than throwing away all the used vegetable oil, they re-use it for the owner's car which has been converted to run on veggie oil rather than gasoline. Fantastic for our local economy and the environment.   The service is fantastic, food is orgasmic, very lovely atmosphere, great wine list. I've ordered so many items off the menu that going into luscious details on any one and not the other would be an injustice. Every time I eat here I catch myself saying "this is the best ______ I've ever had".

yDlYl6XkMf8Rg9n-i-2r0w.text: I can't believe I have never reviewed Tarbells! This is one of my favorites as the food/service is consistently awesome. Jillian (not sure if she works there anymore) is the best server! This establishment has it goin on!

DI2yxaPUS5n919RjeUyFsw.text: My go-to restaraunt for celebrations, taking guests or just a beautiful night out with my hubby. I love this place, the food is wonderful, cozy atmosphere & Mark always gives his personal touch by stopping by tables, sending a little something extra to those of us who frequent this place.  It has that comfortable, neighborhood vibe, and a menu ranging from comfort foods like spaghetti & meatballs to steak and seafoods, that makes you want to keep coming back.  The addition of the Tavern & Wine bar is nice for even more casual dining and an added bonus of choosing & purchasing a bottle of wine that you can pair with dinner. I've been here many, many times over the years and am never disappointed!

Kfen7D-cr42QfuW6cyTROQ.text: Great find for us as we were on PHX for the first time.  Best mussels that I have ever had.  Tremendous food.  Candied Bacon Salad was excellent.  Scotch Beef was tender and delicious.

CVHWaD1IacpY1dSyeyBO0g.text: We went to Tarbell's for our anniversary. I would definitely recommend this restaurant and we will definitely go back. For the negatives, which are few, I would say it didn't feel as cozy and private as I would like to celebrate an anniversary. Although the restaurant was pretty empty, we were seated in the center of the room close to other diners. I also really appreciate it when dining in a nice restaurant for a special occasion if the restaurant asks when making a reservation and if they at least mention it. Tarbells did not do that. We had the Artichoke Leaves for a starter and I would say they were ok. Nothing special, I probably would not order those again. For the positives, the service was great. The menu was creative and everything seemed appealing on the menu. We ordered the Hand Pulled Mozzarella Salad and Himachi Crudo for starters also. Both were great, the Himachi was amazing! For entrees we ordered the Halibut and the Tars Scotch Beef. That was also amazing. For dessert we had the profiteroles. Definitely would order the Himachi Crudo, both entrees, and the profiteroles again.  We will definitely be back to try more dishes!

htaBN0UA3Q82HhS0k18zTw.text: My favorite Restaurant in Phoenix by far, I keep searching for better, but who knows why!  Dishes that separate Tarbell's from others:   Soups to die for  Caesar the way it was meant to taste  Pommes Frites as heavenly as any in Paris or                                       Brussels  Sliders to crave many days after  Scotch Beef I continue to dream about  Pan Roasted chicken - I NEVER order chicken in a                                       Restaurant, except here  Mac & Cheese good enough for dessert  If this isn't FIVE STAR in Phoenix, I can't imagine what is, but I want to go there!

62k6mC7_EZ5AtwKkWCAeRA.text: Great food.  We had the chicken and mashed potatoes And the salmon on crisp potato pancake.  Both were excellent. Service and drinks were very good.  The only disappointment was that we asked for extra sauce for the mashed potatoes and found a $4.00 surcharge on the bill.  This was reversed when I complained

RT3ECmp-1xRNLC0qRsGjzg.text: Great place for an anniversary!  Perfect for an upscale, but laid back night with excellent  food!  My wife and I went there for our 5 year anniversary and like other reviewers here  the owner came out and had a nice conversation with us.  All of the staff responded quickly to request, but didn't make you feel rushed.  Very nice place to spoil yourself with great food and be treated excellent!  You won't be disappointed!!!

lTo6TIFPrSv6DToaZeHGfg.text: Absolutely first class!  The service is spectacular. We had Keith as our waiter. He was laid back yet professional. Very friendly and helpful. We started with the homemade burrata, which was amazing. Creamy on the inside and perfect outside. Served with tomatoes and a basil sauce. It all was amazing. Forgot to mention the fried chick peas that they give you when you sit down. I could not get enough of them. Good thing the bowl they came in was small or else I would not have enough room for everything else. Ok for our main dishes we had the homemade ribbon pasta and the bolognese. Both tastey and full of flavor. Be sure to ask for bread so you can absorb the Parmesan broth the pasta comes in. And to end our meal we had the. Lemon curd with fresh berries. It was light and delicious. It didn't make me feel guilty to have dessert when isn't heavy and so filling. All in all it was a wonderful and absolutely scrumptious night. Can't wait to come back!!

yuJ2GpLE4OGBDcgP98ghDQ.text: I had a great birthday dinner at Tarbell's yesterday evening. It was a quaint restaurant with SUPERB service. The hostesses were very friendly and seated us promptly when we walked in (although we did make reservations ahead of time). The server was very genuine and attentive. She knew the menu and offered to split my guests meal in half because he could not choose on just one entree. Talk about service!  I ordered the special halibut (Mr. Catch of the Day) and it was exactly how it was described.   Although I would not recommend taking many children to Tarbell's, we did take our 10 mo old son and the wait staff was very gracious to him. They even thanked us for feeling comfortable enough for bringing the entire family to dine with them.  GREAT EXPERIENCE. I will return!

lvi8nk3ycH7jP1Ne1wGXkw.text: Excellent service, even better food. The seafood risotto is to die for, and my husband loved his pasta and sausage dish. It's a VERY expensive place to eat, but hey let's face it, you get what you pay for and here, you're paying for perfection.

nT8IZOlWGO2t4wDJ_YH2nw.text: Great atmosphere and service. The food and drinks are very well made and delicious.  Be prepare for the high prices.

0m0m6shCQum1ca5zdBDtQw.text: Be still my beating heart!  When I moved here almost four years ago...I was looking for a restaurant to host a very special occasion for 7 guests.  I went around and checked out several highly recommended establishments and Tarbell's was my last stop of the day.  It was actually closed on the day that I arrived to check it out so I just looked through the windows into the restaurant and when I saw their semi-private partial glass enclosed dining room, I knew this was the place.  On the day of the event, we had two vegetarians in our party and that was not a problem at all (I think their food was actually the best).  Instead of getting an entree, my son ordered three sides and he was completely happy w/his meal.  I recall having the raspberry mojitos and chocolate martini and both were sensational.  Dessert was also top notched and to make the experience even sweeter, Mark Tarbell came by to congratulate us and thanked us for choosing his restaurant to host our special event.  From beginning to end, our meals felt like it was taking us on a culinary adventure.  Service was also excellent and everyone in the party agreed that we'd come to a very special place indeed.  I've been back to Tarbell's on a couple more occasions since then (always w/guests in tow) and the experience has always been the same...everyone leaves completely happy.  This is a very memorable place and I would come here more frequently if it wasn't so far from my house.

FowRl4mPjktqT8KK3acXgA.text: A regular in our restaurant rotation, just went again and left happy as usual. We love the carpaccio appetizer, always superb.My scallops were done perfectly and my wife's fish of the moment was scrumptious. The sorbet is always a great way to finish without feeling guilty! Never disappointed,Tarbell's is a Phoenix classic.

7GFjL7G4RX9rhbfFKph_cg.text: I have been here a half dozen times but realized I hadn't written a review after my last visit. I love Tarbell's, plain and simple. The food here is always spot-on and they have some of the best comfort food selections. The spaghetti and meatballs are so good I have had day dreams about them!  Their mac and cheese is smashing as well, we usually get an order of it for the table to share. I recently got the scottish salmon and it was top-notch. For dessert, their creme brulee is amazing- wow!  It is definitely a treat to eat here!!

NaVRIUI0YS-5YztzPZQawg.text: Let me just say it really takes an experience to move me to write a review for a business.  Tarbell's was so incredible on so many levels. Not only was the food incredible but the service was outstanding as well.  My husband and I had never been here and were just wanting to try it out.  We ordered wine ( which was divine) the mac and cheese and salmon dish to share, and the kale salad.  We simply asked our server questions about the mixed vegetable dish , we decided to pass since the salmon was coming out on a bed of greens.  Much to our surprise she showed up with a complimentary plate of mixed veggies to try since it was our first time there .... and no surprise at this point but the vegetables were incredible as well.  Now usually I skip dessert (spare myself the added calories) but after learning that the owner studied culinary in Paris , i was inclined to try the "wife salted popcorn creme brulee " .  My husband and I just got back from our first trip to Paris and I have been searching for ANYTHING that even comes close to authentic french creme brulee ..... and THIS WAS IT !!!!!  Out of this world !! Worth every calorie lol !  Not to mention when looking at the dessert menu my husband was asking how the bread pudding compared to the brulee.... and low and behold they brought some complimentary bread pudding for us .... which was also mouth watering .  We most definetley will be back and often.  This is one of our new favorites !!! If you are on the fence about trying this place out ... please do! You won't be disappointed in the least !!!!

X2J0szpt6cgZvJoiH1aoDA.text: Like many of the reviewers here have noted, I had pretty high expectations before we ever sat down at our table on Friday night.  I had heard of this place as a foodie-favorite and I love supporting a local celeb-worthy chef.  After a great cocktail at the bar (LOVE the atmosphere including the open kitchen -- very warm space with high energy), we sat and enjoyed the mussel app.  The size of this appetizer was disarmingly huge!  When the server brought out two large bowls, I was so confused that I asked if he had put in an order for each of us; the server kindly explained that it was just one order that he split for us (WOW).  I did not finish the app, partially because it was so huge and partially because it wasn't life-altering and I wanted to hold out for better flavors to come.  I ordered the fish special (can't remember the fish name now, but it was a sea-bass like white fish) and my date ordered the peppersteak.  We did some splitting and switching on our entrees, and honestly...they were good -- totally solid.  ....but I felt bad for having such high expectations.  Solid wasn't what I was expecting...I was expecting impressive, surprising, can't-get-enough.  Overall I really enjoyed the atmosphere and the food was good; I wouldn't hesitate to go here for a business dinner or accept an invitation to go, but I won't be picking it in the near future.  Because I wanted to like it so much, I hope that I do go again in the future to explore the menu a bit more and perhaps better understand the hype -- the potential seems like it should be there.

SHD3ihL5r87BCIoBUR7rIQ.text: Not even sure where to start on this but definitely made our first exploration of Phoenix worth the trip. The staff is great. We got seated on Valentine's day last minute. The server was very knowledgeable and helpful picking dishes and drinks. Drinks were great all around and the barkeep even wrote up his recipes for the Hive drink he makes. The food is outstanding. We had rock shrimp and candy bacon to start. Entrees were salmon and New York strip. They paired well with the Hive and Silver Oak cabernet respectively. We'll be back again.

8G_fYy3dequrbtQeMPliRw.text: Got a steak which was over cooked with the demi being too cold so it was stick, gummy. Got the "poutine" fries which were not poutine at all. The demi again was too cold so it was sticky and the fries were thin cut and frozen. If you're going to put a special item on the menu at least use hand cut fries.

jQAc3Flj-kmhWEKgS1avVg.text: In my business I'm fortunate that insurance company people come out every quarter to wine and dine me, and I always get to pick the restaurant! I've been hearing fabulous things about Tarbell's for years, and have been making my way to dine there for awhile. Last night was THE night!  As I walked in the door, the hostess was smiling and the owner/chef Mark Tarbell was standing right there to welcome the guests - and since I'm a huge fan of Iron Chef America, I was incredibly excited to meet him.   The waiter was soft spoken and really pleasant, and the bread they bring to your table was delicious. Upon perusing the menu, there were several things that caught my eye - the Crispy Chickpeas, the Calamari and the House-Pulled Mozzarella. I'm a huge fan of the last two (and they were really good), but the first one had me a little skeptical. The Crispy Chickpeas were DELICIOUS! Crispy, a little cheesy, and just perfect.  The Tuscan Kale also had all of us a little skeptical, since kale is generally bitter. Not so with this delightful salad, I could eat it every day! For the main course we ordered the Mr. Fish of the Moment (halibut), Pan-Seared Ahi Tuna and the Cast Iron-Seared Pepper Steak - ALL of these were absolutely perfect in temperature and flavor!   Dessert is a must, especially here! We split several desserts -  Mascarpone Cheesecake  with Rosemary Caramel Sauce (TO DIE FOR) Profiteroles with Vanilla Bean Gelato & Chocolate Sauce (AMAZING) Southern Bread Pudding with Kentucky Bourbon Sauce The "Beloved" Chocolate Mousse Featuring Guittard Chocolate (MY FAVORITE)  I tried and loved them all!  Bottom line - this is now at the top of my favorites list. I would eat here every day if I could afford it!

MgHVI0IxBqRny6XvEt5TRg.text: Went here for dinner last night and haven't been in over 3 years. Still as delicious as I remember and classics are still on the menu. Started the night with the Uptown, a great drink if you like Whiskey. I was impressed by how quickly after we ordered that our appetizers came out. The Caesar salad was delicious but typical of what you would expect, which is exactly what I wanted. My husband had the carpaccio which was plated amazingly and tasted delicious.  For the main course I had the pan-roasted chicken, the skin had the perfect crisp yet the chicken was so moist. I would highly recommend ordering it. My husband had the Mr. Fish which last night happened to be halibut, it was served with the best tasting hummus I have ever have. To finish the night we had both the warm chocolate cake and the apple pie. Both these desserts were wonderful. The ambiance is nice and was romantic in a booth. The staff were very attentive and really took great care of us. Tarbell's is a great Arizona restaurant that never changes which is why we love coming back there.

PmWT9Fw96i8meZJctsuo1w.text: TarBlows!!!! I am not sure who is giving rave reviews of this restaurant but either they are friends with with Mark or simply do not know food?? My wife and I had reservations for 8pm and when we arrived, the manager tried to sit us at a bar high top. Are you kidding me?  With a reservation its simply standard to provide a table in the main dining area and not at the bar.  They did clear a table that had left and upon seating provided us with bread.  The bread obviously was store bought (my guess LaBrea) and had been sitting in a basket under the heat lamp.  Wife ordered his "famous" spaghetti and meatballs. While the meatballs were very good, the sauce was absolutely deplorable. I believe they use the pan drippings as the marinara sauce as it was extremely greasy, no taste and just simply a mess. I ordered the seafood chowder which at $25 is anything but seafood.  All they do is add a ton of butter and cream, sprinkle 4 mussels, and honestly tiny "bits" of seafood of salmon with corn, onion and that's about it.  Pathetic.  I have had much better at whole foods take out than that. Service was satisfactory nothing to write home about but not bad either. In conclusion, this establishment should be ashamed at the food they put out as there is simply "no care" about there product.    Keep to wine Mark, that's something you at least know little about!

9jdpTIWkjv9CJq16nqEwYA.text: One of my favorite restaurants in Phoenix and certainly worthy of the Iron Chef.  The decor is kool, without trying too hard - and the food is absolutely fabulous.   If you're looking for a full-flavored dish, try the spaghetti and meatballs - they are to die for good.  Made with organic tomatoes and hefty, beefy orbs...delicious.

OzGuzOMmKTttJu1EsxrOqQ.text: Unfortunately, no longer my favorite. Seriously, they could not have gotten us out of there any faster: we sat and were handed a drink menu then within 5 seconds, approached for a drink order-wow, let me look... no martinis? So I had water :( for Valentine's Day (boo). Next,  The waitress was nice but not friendly... when she was facing us, she spoke kindly but fled before we finished speaking.... Boo. I ordered Scotch Beef Sliders without horseradish and crispy fries and you know,  they came with horseradish:(. Very difficult to get the waitress' attention because she was asking for feedback before I took my first bite (again feeling rushed) and I said the fries were good. I got her attention and told her there was horseradish on them, she grabbed the plate and was gone before I could say that I wanted them to go so that I could save room for dessert. I finally flagged down the busser who told her for me. She came to the table to let me know they are ready but I explained that I will be too full for dessert and I want dessert - she stepped away and several minutes later, brought the bag of food and apologized and scurried away. I really wanted the coconut cream pie I saw on the menu earlier so I waited and waited, watching her flit from here to there and finally caught her attention to get a dessert menu. To my dismay, no coconut cream pie. When she came back I explained that I had my heart set on coconut cream pie that I must have read on the Tavern's menu. She said ok, scooped up the menus, walked away. She completed our billing and transaction very briskly and we were on our way. They did comp the to-go sliders which was nice but that wasn't the problem-it was the experience. My husband had a great meal by himself. When the waitress did come to our table, she was unsure of the menu and unfriendly. She asked me if the horseradish was mixed in with the beef and I said, no, it's on the bun. And she spoke nicely and in a sweet voice but it seemed like she couldn't get away any faster - mid sentence. Anyway, if we go again, it will be to-go

WEJoLxvZFQK6qHZvWn6rMg.text: Very nice atmospher. Owner pleasant and greeted us for a birthday celebration. Food was good, but over priced for the sizes. The lobster tail is a main dish, but the waiter stated it was appetizer size. We ordered it anyway and he was right. Small size without much flavor. I really wanted to like this place more because I heard many good reviews. May give it a second chance, but would rather try one of his other places with different options and prices.

tNcWgio5Wf1UHaMwS2QsTQ.text: The place exemplifies the casual elegance that Phoenix is renowned for.  This is the type of place you eat at before a night at the symphony.  The food, the service, and the atmosphere are all excellent.

xbwbZb-1iZhn5w6SaI1AaQ.text: Mixed Drinks.  Try the Texas Sazerac, and don't look back.  Very, very well made.  The chocolate mousse is a great way to end the night as well.

s-ZXQQpDRmsjT7ynaIv_9Q.text: Nice bar and bartender. Had a drink and waited for the rest of our party to arrive. Had a Palma Fizz- like a vodka tonic w/ ginger which added a unique flavor. Wife had a Mai-Tai. Calamari for appetizer and Kale salad. Both were excellent. Our table got the Pepper Steak, House ribbon pasta, scallops and the Scotch Beef. All were excellent/ very good. I ate a combo of the scallops and steak. Both were cooked perfectly. Dessert we got 4 to sample. Caramel Cheesecake, Creme Brulee, Choc cake, and Bread pudding- all good. So many great desert choices. I will have to go back to try the Choc Mousse. Overall a very enjoyable evening. Server was great. Wait staff attentive. Will be back.

P0IAVhcIAiiJsx8fR1kbTw.text: 4.5 stars rounded up to 5.  Excellent restaurant.  Had a great meal at Tarbell's.  Ambiance and service were very nice.   Food was truly wonderful.   We had the famous spaghetti (trust me-its a main course) and the special ravioli. Both were very tasty, cooked to perfection and the ingredients and spices just exploded on the palate. Also, prior to that had the beefsteak/'tomato salad, and the house salad.  All greens, fresh, crispy and tasty.   Nice wine list.    Split the bourbon chocolate bread pudding to finish the evening.   Highly recommended for fine dining in Phoenix.

VoEdi1ugrVIHnixwEWWUFg.text: A restaurant for special occasions. Mark Tarbell came by our table and asked how our meal was and we told him the truth - it was fantastic. Marvelous melt-in-your-mouth Scotch beef in a savory red wine reduction and grilled wild salmon were our choices and they were wonderful, preceded by superb crispy calamari. Great bread putting and homemade cheesecake topped the meal off nicely. Not cheap but well worth it.

INsXZ4UE0dl6BNEtt5iQ7Q.text: A great place for amazing food! Right when we walked in, the place was filled with people and a great view of the kitchen. I knew right away that it was going to be tasty with how many people were seated instead and even at the bar eating their dinner.  To start, we started off with the mozzarella, tomato and basil plate. So fresh and all the ingredients just melted in my mouth. I got the chicken and my boyfriend got the steak. Absolutely loved every bite of it. The service was a little slow towards the end and it took us a while to get ahold of our server, but more talking time for us.

LhlF4snzXSKPUashvJZ2HA.text: It has been quite a while since some place motivated me to write another review. Lots of OK or mediocre out there. Anyway, this past Saturday I took my lovely bride to Tarbell's for her birthday. Hadn't been there in about 8 months. The food was every bit as good as we remembered (seriously, it is really good) but what set the evening apart was our server, Audrey. She was charming. She was attentive without being bothersome. She was just friggin' delightful. As I mentioned, we both loved our food (the short ribs really stood out) but what will be remembered long after the memory of the tastes have faded away was the overall feeling of the evening. Audrey just made our night!

B0iDkl8J2CyclGnBf0AloA.text: If you want to impress anyone with great food and perfect service then take them to Tarbell's.   Tarbell's is how all places should be run with the ultimate care for their customers and food.   Upon arrival, the parking is horrible since there are other popular places on this corner but the valet is easily used after a short wait in the car line.  Once we entered we were greeted by none other than Mark Tarbell. We had reservations which were ready for us in an already packed restaurant.   Atmosphere: Fancy without being pretentious, warm and comfortable. A great bar area that you can come to anytime just to chill with some drinks.  Food: It's all good, fresh and local. A friend from New York (famous musician) had a small list of places in the country that stayed local, Tarbell's was the only place listed in AZ. Seasonal menu, which a few staples.   Service: Beyond excellent! Our waitress was fun and upon questions of the menu, she was honest and even steered us away from an item that she was not fond of. Our busser kept our water full without being obtrusive.   Price: Is appropriate for the quality atmosphere and service.   Room for improvement: None  The place is usually full with people having great conversation, so it's not very quiet, but fun and energetic.

zYkgviSP5IdYkvMPpNS-6w.text: My dad came to town for a visit and when he's in town I always take the opportunity to try a restaurant usually out of my price range. For this visit I booked a reservation at Tarbell's and was excited to head there for a nice dinner. We were not disappointed! We arrived and were promptly seated. While perusing the menu we each ordered a gin martini; with a twist for me and dirty for my dad. They were both very good, but not outstanding. A group next to us ordered a variety of things on the appetizer menu and made the task of choosing one quite difficult, but we decided to go with the pommes frites. It's probably blasphemy to say that these reminded me of Steak and Shake fries, but they did, only 10x better. Somehow they are able to keep these thin fries piping hot for more than 2 minutes. We also shared the soup of the day, tomato bisque, and the bacon candy salad, both of which were delightful. For our entrees my Dad went with the Scotch beef and I picked salmon. We thought both were good, but the Scotch beef was the winner. For dessert it was again the table next to us who ordered a variety and made it difficult to pick, but we went with the bread pudding. I like bread pudding and this was good, but not great.   Overall, we enjoyed this dinner very much. It isn't very often that we go all out and indulge ourselves and Tarbell's was a good choice to do so. The service was well-timed and we never felt rushed. The waitress did a good job of checking up, but not being overly attentive. There are quite a few places to spend a nice evening in Phoenix and this is a good choice, but I wouldn't be clamoring to come back, either. I do like that Tarbell's is a nice change of pace from most of the upscale restaurants in town that specialize in steak.

4nk4aVZELOMjFc6PBPKTfg.text: Tarbell's is top notch in all areas!  Food quality, service, ambience, amazing!  I recently took ten business associates there for a meeting, and I got nothing but compliments the next day on such an excellent choice of restaurant!    Definitely try the Spaghetti & Meatballs as well as the Mac N Cheese, and even the Pizzas are to die for.  And the burger too!  You really cant go wrong here.  Warning the deserts here are HUGE (yet amazing).  One desert is enough for 2-3 people!

dSid6fXVBVkgQuwPgMng2g.text: Tarbell's is amazing. I've been here several times over the years and have never been disappointed. The rock shrimp with salsa appetizer is delicious.  I also like the steaks, but you can't really go wrong with anything from here.  If you're looking for a great restaurant to eat at, this is it.

URh1x5Tk0plFXSoG-4VroA.text: We have visited Tarbell's numerous times over the years. We really want to love it as much as we used to, but sadly no... Too salty and inconsistent.

zoDSb5tH_1WfbTrh5UXVIw.text: Service is incredible and the pasta is out of this world! My only complaint is that it's really tight in the dining room and can get incredibly noisy but everything else makes up for it.

zF7RR-E2AYBJ6wc-uvIQew.text: I have been here before but not for over a year and the experience was just as I remembered. The food is over the top good and the service is always spot on.

n2lMCFj1BlaHY5BpehvrOA.text: I was super disappointed in this place. We went on Mother's Day and maybe that was my problem. They had a super limited brunch menu and it was ridiculously priced. I'm not shy about paying for great food. But it was just basic food with no special twists or even unique flavor. I had a $20 gift card and I still spent over $50 and we didn't even get anything to drink. And I was still hungry when I walked out. DON'T go here for brunch. Not really sure about the other times.

bSKnV3ltnbNHng33uCjW8g.text: I went to Tarbells with some friends last week and I wasn't disappointed. Tarbells has a very friendly atmosphere and great service! I have the gnocchi which was fantastic, the gnocchi were tender and the gravy was so flavorful! My friend had the fish special, they said the flavor was good, but liked the gnocchi better... I will return to try more dishes!

photos.caption: Photo of Tarbell's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Special
Photo of Tarbell's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Gnocchi

Vkxzqm4H2QuorZmOG_wPBA.text: It's unfortunate that I feel a need to update my original review from 2014 because things have changed here since then, and not for the better (in my opinion.)  It starts with me calling and making a reservation (as I do every year on my wedding anniversary.) When I arrive, they seat me in the bar area. Why? The dining room was widely available, I was dressed well and I had a reservation.  What's wrong the bar, you might ask? Foot traffic and noise. In fact, by 7pm, I had to YELL for my wife to hear me across the small table. This got old really quick.  To make matters worse, Mark has apparently changed the recipe for the mozzarella cheese on the pizza that I love so much. Now he is using Balsetta Mozzarella which is very creamy and, again in my opinion, absolutely disgusting on a pizza. Having something creamy on a nacho is fine. But having something creamy on a pizza just turns my stomach.  They used to bring four little mini French loaves to the table with butter. Now its messy, crunchy pita chips and hummus. Personally, I find hummus disgusting.   I ordered a Coke and they give you very tall narrow glasses filled with ice. This immediately reduces the volume of Coke that can fit in the glass and dilutes it to the point it loses flavor and carbonation.  When I asked for less ice, the glass was still filled with ice! In my opinion, no soda glass should be more than 1/3rd filled with ice unless a customer requests otherwise.   The service here is still impeccable. And that's what stopped me from walking out and never coming back. Our server remade the pizza with normal fresh mozzarella and put a note in the computer that when I order it in the future, I won't have to tell them. A nice touch, but weird.  The noise was outrageous. Here I am dropping near $150 for a special, romantic and delicious dinner with my wife and I can barely have a conversation with her and the food is not how I was expecting it from past experiences.  I hate to complain. I'd rather just walk out.   In the end, things were made right with the food, but it was too late. The evening was spoiled and the noise became unbearable.   What saved our business entirely was the actions of the staff. We ordered a Creme Brulee to share and they brought it to us gratis, with a beautiful 'happy anniversary' written on the plate in chocolate sauce. It was the best part of the meal!  Whether or not I'll come back for the food I can't say. But I will definitely come back for the service. I've never experienced anything quite like it before. Made me feel like I was a king. I just didn't want to complain. But at these prices and prior experiences, I felt I had to.  My wife and I really enjoy Mark Tarbell. He seems like a great guy (he has no idea who we are). We enjoy watching him on PBS Check Please and recognized his appearance in the movie Mensch as well as his YouTube videos. Perhaps one day he will offer something 'normal' on his menu for people like me that enjoy fine dining but are not food adventurous. I know what I like and it doesn't require any improvement. To have at least one common comfort food item on the menu that is SIMPLE would be very considerate for clientele like myself who consider this kind of a dining a once-a-year experience and, as such, have not developed a palette for strange blends and mixes. I bet a hamburger, chicken tenders, soft fresh pretzels with a dip, basic angel hair pasta with a simple Pomodoro sauce, would taste incredible if offered here at ANY price.
