Not suggesting all of it, just ONE of those items would be a delight to see offered on the otherwise mostly unrecognizable items offered on the menu.  Yes, it sucks to be a fussy eater. I hate it. I wish I could just order anything like most people, but I'm afraid of the stomach cramps and other after-effects I would experience if I forced myself to endure it.

rFbdlxMgVClSRk5eCmtOrQ.text: Tarbells is that one restaurant that is always consistent.  Every single meal is always perfect no matter what you order.    I love that on sundays they choose another region and bring into the menu a specific food from the region. This past Sunday I was excited for a philly cheesesteak.  Apparently many other people were also super excited and they ran out before I got my order in.  No big deal because there were 15 other things which I was excited to eat.    Needless to say it was a great night out, and this is always a top recommendation while in phoenix.

photos.caption: Photo of Tarbell's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Here is a great look at the whiskey list.

PWdDlBeiuzG_lPQY6-s7Zg.text: Great food and service. Will come back again. I ordered the paper stake and my wife had the escargot and the fish both were great.

GoC_AXQ4RgDiYyIlFal_Eg.text: Wednesday evening we made the trek from Mesa to enjoy Tarbell's! We wanted to celebrate a special woman's birthday! A Mesa native and world traveler, who had Tarbell's on her bucket list! All diners were pleased with this venue! As it was not our first encounter, we made some recommendations! The pan roasted chicken was delicious! Two ladies raved about the salmon! Wine selection is abundant; hence, no one had difficulty making a choice to accompany their meal! The grand finale was the decadent cheesecake topped with rosemary glaze... Split by the four of us! Our waiter, Nathan, was delightful all evening long! Our VIP birthday diner was more than impressed with this gem of a dining venue!

photos.caption: Photo of Tarbell's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tarbell&#39;s ensures one feels special on their day to celebrate!

qng5LfDXkZwYwzPfEuakjQ.text: Went there with friends the other evening.  They LOVE this place.   He had made reservations for a table next to a window.  For a Wednesday, I was surprised to see it was FULL.   And it was NOISY.   I had a hard time hearing her and vice versa.  He pondered the wine list and selected a fine bottle of chardonnay.   I have no idea what it was, but it was a good choice.   I had the squid ink angel hair with calamari, and she had the Seasonal Chowda, which is advertised to be chock full of fish Tikka Masala, saffron, jasmine rice.     I do not like the flavoring of turmeric; therefore, was glad I did not order it.   I did taste her order, however, and I suppose, if I like turmeric, I'd like it.     My dish, however, was good, albeit the pasta was cooked more than I would have liked.  It was stuck together, and I had to separate it with another utensil, but the flavoring was exquisite.   I liked the calamari.    I was stuffed, but we decided to share a dessert; therefore, we ordered the Profiteroles with Vanilla Gelato and Warm Ganache. YUMMM!!!   When served, it appeared in the shape of two cream puffs with a light covering of chocolate.   The gelato definitely cut any too sweetness there could have been.   It was good.  Well worth it.    This restaurant has been in the valley FOREVER!!   They are regulars.   Mark Tarbell, the owner, came in at the time we were waiting for our table.   A very cordial, friendly man.   Made a point of saying HI to his customers.   Would I return?   Yes, of course.   I liked what I had.    Size:  4 KB

k045yqQjetjei4IDgjmW-g.text: I had the pleasure of attending a dinner at Tarbell's last evening hosted by winemaker, James Callahan of Rune Wines. From the first course to the last every dish was perfectly paired. I will be spreading the word about Tarbell's, Tarbell's Wine Shop, as well as local Arizona winery, Rune. Cheers!

iQyPTQMHglDMnsoZObciSw.text: Usually a fan of Tarbell's and Mark's menu and food prep. Have enjoyed a birthday tradition there for coming on 8 years taking our wives to dinner with another close friend couple. We arrived on time for our reservation and waited 25 minutes to be seated. Then experienced exceptionally slow service taking nearly four hours to complete the meal and were served the signature bread pudding for dessert ,cold , dry and inedible. A very disappointing performance. Pretty sure we'll be looking for a different birthday tradition - we were definitely treated as yesterday's news not longtime loyal patrons

oUJYKZYoUftQ9uM6gcNHFA.text: I've eaten here numerous times. The kitchen is the best in Scottsdale/Phoenix. The food is always superb. Only disappointment once was soft shelled crabs. Was seasonal. Not missed. Service is professional. Anyone we've brought there becomes hooked.

58z5QIG_qUzZ5Ovvm6gYkg.text: Had an amazing time celebrating my mother's birthday at Tarbells! The food was absolutely delicious and the drinks are just perfection! This will definitely become a tradition for all of us. Thanks to the wait staff, they were lovely!

photos.caption: Photo of Tarbell's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. They gracefully brought out this cake for her. So sweet!
Photo of Tarbell's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. I&#39;m a vegetarian so this was my meal. So good!

TOYeD30gMy30XMMzTl0UIA.text: Whenever I'm given the option to pick a dinner spot for a romantic, special meal, Tarbell's is my 1st choice.  To start, the service here is absolutely outstanding!  From the host, to the bartenders, to the wait staff...everyone here is friendly, knowledgeable and makes you feel like you are in for a special treat.  Extra bonus goes to the fact that they are attached to a wine shop, so you get some really fun wines at a really decent cost.  Talk to the sommelier, and they will lead you in the right direction.  And then to the star of the restaurant, the FOOD!!!!  Holy mother, it is simply out of this world.  I have tried a few items on the menu (scallops, shrimp, meatloaf...) but there is 1 dish in particular that keeps us coming back.  That dish, is the House-Made Ribbon Pasta.  It's almost hard to think about this dish when I'm not there, because it makes me salivate and crave it through my core, however if I have to describe it, all I can say is it's fresh pasta done perfectly, with a sauce so buttery and warm that it'll make your toes curl in excitement.  Plus, the homemade chicken sausage meatball is unlike anything I've ever eaten anywhere, and I would gladly buy a dozen of them to have on hand at home.  This dish is seriously that good.  If you are looking for a special meal that will leave you satiated and smiling, I highly recommend spending an evening at Tarbell's.  Trust me....you're gonna love it :)

xGojKIsWHOXcjoKVXRXQBA.text: Using yelp and our hotel concierge we chose Tarbell's   1) the burrata was way over salted, inedible  2) the pasta and meatball, sauce=I won't mention the words my wife used to describe. Suffusive to say=not good 3) cheesecake has all the flavor of a chunk of Philadelphia cheese block but with the addition of being old. The "sauce" (which I did not get on mine) was meant to cover this I would guess. 4) at best this was a 50$ meal but at 2.5x that we left sorely disappointed

SdDiOwScatAFjvam4NcMqQ.text: One of the best meals I've ever had at a restaurant. Food and service were both excellent. Our server Allen was almost too nice, but it seemed genuine and I hope we have him again in future visits.   We had calamari and their mozzarella special as appetizers, both had great flavor and I especially enjoyed the lighter batter they used for the calamari. Not one bit of chewiness in the calamari.   For entrees we had the lobster gnocchi and the Scotch beef. Portion for lobster gnocchi was reasonable, would leave me a little hungry if I had not gotten an appetizer. Great texture from the gnocchi and the lobster was well done. Wife enjoyed the scotch beef, picture an elevated pot roast.   Dessert was the cheesecake with their (rosemary?) caramel sauce. I did not really care for the sauce, although wife loved it and I'm sure many others do too. Again portion here was great and the texture was amazing. I hate ordering dessert (usually a rip off in my opinion) at restaurant but will certainly get this again.

ZGhqsssFzZ4bulil7Ew2yw.text: If you want the most amazing pasta, chicken, cheesecake, etc...it is incomparable!  We will be back for sure the next time we visit Phoenix!!

lqTcCQOZKI5IZLdt8x-yFg.text: This place is on point from the excellent food to the spectacular bar service and Management! Don't hesitate, come have a glass of wine and relax while everything is taken care of. I had a glass of Caymus and enjoyed the escargot

photos.caption: Photo of Tarbell's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Caymus (wine), escargot, octopus, and crudo.

UEm4F4yaswwEjKChIGgrCQ.text: Tarbell's is an elegant New American restaurant. Attached to a tavern and wine shop, Tarbell's is fun and worth visiting again.  The menu offered almost every protein out there. It also stated that dishes can be made vegetarian or vegan on request. I asked, and the server told me the vegetarian dish of the day was a lentil plate with peas and corn. He used more adjectives than that.  Tarbell's is the kind of restaurant that grills corn and then shaves it onto the plate. The lentil dish was excellent - it felt balanced and healthy.  The mushroom risotto had a strange aftertaste, probably due to the wine used to make it. That didn't stop me from eating every bite. The house-made burrata was out of this world. It made me wonder why I'm not sitting around making burrata and growing tomatoes at home all day. That would be paradise.   I was in and out of there in under an hour. Tarbell's kitchen was quick, and the service was attentive, but that didn't mean they pushed me out. I really appreciated that - there was a great pace that other restaurants lack.   The company was great too - I laughed so hard at one point that I caught hiccups.   The first time I actually left my Bose earbuds on the table because I tend to form small rock piles of personal belongings on white tablecloths. Fortunately, when I called the next day, they had already scooped them and were ready for pickup.   I'm looking forward to the next time I come back, and hopefully it's not because I left personal belongings.

photos.caption: Photo of Tarbell's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. House-made Burrata - McClendon&#39;s Farm tomatoes
Photo of Tarbell's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Parmesan chickpea dish
Photo of Tarbell's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lentil dish - vegetarian option of the day

mxxk2ITfiZ2sHG3H9UAp6g.text: I recently had the best dinner at Tarbell's.  My boyfriend and I had dinner here to celebrate my birthday.  We had reservations and we immediately were greeted and seated.  Our server was very attentive and answered any questions. We started out with the Tuna tartar and the warm bacon candy salad.  The chef split the appetizers which was very elegant to have your own special plate of amazing food.  I fell in love with the Candy bacon.  Wow, perfectly rendered bacon with sugar... it inspired me to make my own.    The tuna tartar's presentation was packed with flavor, freshness and eye appealing.  For dinner,  I ordered the New York steak aged 35 days and packed with pepper and seasoned to perfection. I had this steak years ago here and have never forgotten it.  I love the au gratin potatoes and creamed spinach that is served with it.  This was a fantastic dinner.  We had wine with dinner that paired perfectly.  The evening was wonderful.  The dessert that our waiter brought out with Happy birthday written on it was Mascarpone Cheesecake with Rosemary sauce.  EXCELLENT!!!!  It's by far one of the best cheesecakes in my book.  The sauce is extraordinary!!  Carmel and Rosemary.... it works so wonderful together.  Thank you Tarbell's and staff for a great Birthday dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Tarbell's - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Tarbell's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tuna tartar
Photo of Tarbell's - Phoenix, AZ, United States

GALuFZf1SWakyAQWN8aVzQ.text: Other than the sold out specials at our 7:30pm seating at Tarbell's I was pleased with the restaurants' favorable aesthetic and crowd. I love an open kitchen where patrons can play audience to rising cooking flames and hot dishes ready to be served.  Cubed ahi tuna and chick peas to start (sounded interesting.) And for my main, the vegetarian dish "made with love" as the menu stated - was indeed.    Not to be forgotten, a beautifully assorted dessert platter on the house as a birthday present and dinner topper boasting a rich array of decadent sweets including my favorite the mascarpone cheesecake with warm rosemary caramel sauce.  Mark Tarbell, I'm hooked and I'll be back for more next time I'm visiting Phoenix's camelback area.

I0hPODqcgj4qa4ktUWGj6g.text: One of the best dinners I've had in a while.  Drinks, apps, entrees, and desserts were all exceptional.  Service was as good as you can get.  Went wife and two daughters.  No complaints, only compliments from everybody.  Seated in the dining area but the bar area looked like the place to be, even on a Thursday night.

5Rh7PjrOfZ-YlPyon3iI6A.text: Great service, great food, highly recommend.  We had the scollops and they were to die for, the scotch beef and mac and cheese were also amazing.  Will definitely go back and recommend to friends.

QreylNeSlZL5orJ2EYVnYw.text: I have to say that I love this place! We have been going here for years for so many different occasions and I think thats why I love it so much. It is great for special days, like anniversaries or birthdays and my favorite time, Sunday night at the bar.   My favorite things to eat are: The mussels, the pizza, Mr. Fish of the moment, the chocolate cake, the meatballs, and those little apple bites he won on Iron Chef.   We love Jim and Harry and Patrick too! The people working there have been there for years and its always nice to see the familiar faces.

6KpefQc0RR_j5cSj5W4nLg.text: JKL chapter 2 So at the risk of sounding like a Victrola I am becoming more and more disappointed with Valley bourgeois eateries. There is invariable something that becomes slightly bittersweet by the end of meal. Or beginning with Pizzeria Bianco.                                                     -side note- Sorry Chris, but your lines and wait times are outrageous. Simply because you are  the newest crush of Martha Stewart and Oprah should not allow your reputation to act like a Van Buren streetwalker. If people are first or second in line when it opens, they should have not to wait an additional hour to be seated. Phoenix is your bread and butter. If you lose us, your street cred will diminish faster than Lohan's descent into Dante's inferno.   Ok I am done.   So we arrived a few minutes past our reservations but this did not deter our hostess from seating us immediately. Very nice. And it was still busy at 8:30. Almost boisterous. We were happy. After a few minutes, servers presented us with chilled water and bread served with olive oil. The service was prompt on refills but not overbearing. Big point there. The bread was unremarkable as was the olive oil. Not very flavorful nor was the bread soft. But it was not bad.   We then order tuna tartare and and house pulled mozzarella (their name for Caprese salad). The salad would only be adequate for 2-3 people to share. However, it was delicious. Arugula, basil..well you know the rest. Very fresh, flavorful. The balsamic was amazing. The tuna was fresh but nearly flavorless. If I closed my eyes while eating it, I would have insisted that it was salty diced roma tomatoes via bruschetta. We also order a New Zealand sauvignon blanc. It was a good selection.   K ordered the pan roasted chicken. We started chuckling over this decision as chicken does not have various temperature deviations like beef or fish. So if they pulled off chicken well, that is a good sign. L ordered the bass but we were informed approximately 10 minutes later that they were out. Our spunky waitress apologized profusely.  L ordered Salmon with crispy potato cake with molasses lime syrup. I asked for the cast-iron pepper steak served medium.   K enjoyed his chicken. This is good news for Tarbells. L's fish and crispy potato cake were overwhelmed with the molasses and made the dish seem like more like dessert. Our waitress got L a new dish (3rd times the charm, right?). The manager came over and apologized. But she like it better than the first (or is it second) although it was a bit dry and missing flavor. My steak was 2/3 medium and 1/3 well-well done. It was quite peppercorny. Good cut, but the temp was off. And it could have used some more salt  from the chef so I would not have to salt it so. Perhaps it is my savory tongue that is too blame. It was not bad, just not great. The side potatoes of this dish were divine.  They comped our dessert, which was Warm Chocolate Cake with Pistachio Ice Cream. The ice cream was still solid when we got it instead of melting into some sweet fugue. The ice cream was tasty with hints of a liquor. L told me she thought our dessert was comparable to Safeway. Although it was comped, it still failed to wow us.  The food was almost completely unremarkable. The service was great. I would take servers-in-training to show them what exceptional service is. But not chefs. Bittersweet....

RvGuQuj8z05IiXEVHyWiLA.text: After reading all the fantastic reviews on yelp, my husband and I to go to Tarbells to celebrate our first anniversary. We had made reservations, and were seated right away. The service was as good as it gets. And the food, was amazing. My husband ordered salmon, and I had the pan roasted chicken. Both were amazing. I never knew chicken could taste so good. For dessert, we split a piece of warm chocolate cake with pistachio ice cream.  When the dessert arrived, "Happy Anniversay" had been written across the rim of the plate, in chocolate. It was such a nice touch. Overall it was a fantastic dinner at a reasonable price. We will definitely go back to Tarbells.

0Ir1JQF1WCO6jOTmtQc-bw.text: It's a great date place.   The food is good and the chocolate cake is ridiculously good.    I've been twice. Great service everytime.   They have a small room for larger parties and with 8 people it was very, very tight, but I will definitely return!   Parking is a real challenge on a weekend night -- get the valet.

EaNot897JgKE7pUZAoWPFw.text: This is absolutely my favorite restaurant to go to when visiting Phoenix. The "Scotch Beef" (pot roast) is absolutely the best I've ever had anywhere. They pile it on a bed of mashed potatoes with carrots, green beans, and onions. Then they cover it with the most delicious red-wine reduction gravy. I've eaten it two nights in a row its so good. The drinks are good too. Others I've gone with say the fresh fish dishes are excellent as well.

bByfnl4glUPlQcxjzLS2vw.text: I have been a fan for years! The last 5 times I  am sad to say have been terrible?the drinks R over sweet. Tho Nicole is a master ! The soups R heavy and sour! The tuna tartar is fishy and soy sauced,,, there is a sad downward fall here?

W02lHbGKK9KwpdnCO5noBw.text: Everything I ate was slightly better than I expected. The pepper-crusted steak was better than steaks I have had at MANY steakhouse in the valley.

n1nIOwTi2NspWxOd9QX4Tw.text: Mark Tarbell and his team orchestrated an amazing winemaker dinner featuring the wines of Maison Joseph Drouhin, hosted by Laurent Drouhin. The wines were paired perfectly with creative cuisine artfully plated, thus enhancing the experience of both the food and the elegant wines.   Each course was served with precision and impeccable timing.  Each wine pored into correct stemware, highly polished.  No detail was overlooked. Tarbell's recently celebrated their twentieth anniversary.  Dinners like we experienced last night bode well for many more wonderful years of exquisite dining at Tarbell's.  Enjoy!

pVZ58wJWNRT8Z9fnlvhYIg.text: I found Tarbell's when doing my usual restaurant research before a business trip, and I have been back every time I'm in town, even twice in one trip in December.  Service, atmosphere, and of course the food are all excellent.  I made sure to sit in Josh's section when I ate here two consecutive nights, and he brought out my colleagues favorite NA beer from the previous evening - truly a great experience!  The seasonal Veggie Plate was delicious along with their house staple of Ribbon Pasta with Chicken-Fennel Sausage.  I make kale chips for myself every week, and I was curious to try a salad of raw, purple kale.  So glad I got it.  Fantastic!

4YwhxdErozB0Ax9slxb1aA.text: First visit to very well known Phoenix  eatery. It was real average IMO. Nice ambiance and EXCELLENT service, but you go to a restaurant for food and ours was nothing special at all. The Hamachi crudo starter was creative and tasty, but my Scottish salmon main was dry and had more greens, and less potato crisp on the plate, than it should have. My wife's NY Steak was cooked well, but had no real flavor profile at all. I could have cooked it as well at home, easily. Some slightly over cooked greens and decent fries accompanied the steak. For $38 bucks I think, I expected way more. One other diner had the Halibut Special and reported it was kinda dry and basically uninteresting. Had the Profiterole's for dessert and they were nice. Excellent wine list BTW, but VERY pricey. This is not a place I would rush back to. Sorry........

REbyp13NkIKquaSHd_OGVA.text: Tarbell's has a great chef, good food, and irresistible desserts.  The decor is very modern, with a big splashy painting on the wall I was looking at.  I had a terrific bib lettuce salad, followed by... can't remember what it was called (tarbell cut?), but  it was very much like pot roast.  Delicious and fork tender.  They had other very good cuts of beef, as well a fresh seafood.  For dessert, the four of us split an order of profiteroles and an order of their chocolate mousse.  Yummy.  The atmosphere was fairly quiet.  The only thing that surprised me was the price of a glass of Irish whiskey - we did not ask, but at $18, was the most expensive glass of Bushmill's we have had in a restaurant.

HbiWbof64RXUCrQRqIGZKw.text: What took us so long to find this place?    The food is wonderful, the service is top drawer, and the atmosphere hits the exact right tone of hip.    We eat in restaurants frequently, and this is as thoroughly fine a dining experience as I have had in a very very long time.  Can not wait to return.

78Kn5oz-zD4_71VL5sNrZg.text: We went here for a belated Valentine's dinner. It was fantastic. Parking was a pain, but we eventually found a spot. They seated us immediately (we had reservations) and our server was very attentive. They immediately brought out bread (delish) and water. Not long after, our wine arrived. Speaking of wine, don't be scared when you see the wine list...I didn't see any wines by the glass, only bottles, so I simply told the server what I wanted, and there it was!   I had the tagliatelle (sp?) pasta with wild mushrooms. SO good. I'm a big fan of earthy tasty yumminess, and this hit the spot. Why can't I do this at home?? Oh, and the soup... divine! The special was potato and leek soup. Perfectly smooth, must have been strained several times to get it this smooth. Very comforting. Hubby had the mac & cheese for an ap...YUM! That Vermont cheddar is just too good! He had the pork chop for his entree, and I will never be able to make pork chops at home again. Oh well! He thoroughly enjoyed it. For dessert we had the Iron Chef apples, which were perfect. We were pretty full by this point, but these three adorable little tasty apples were just the right finishing touch.  The second best part of our night (the food was first, of course) was meeting Mark Tarbell! I tried not to act like a fool, but I watched him on Iron Chef, so it was cool to meet him! He was very friendly, very down to earth, and seemed genuinely concerned about our experience. He was walking around to all the tables...great chef!   So for a nice night out, you can't beat this place. Enjoy!

31tSaXJtGQjBIubvi2xlWw.text: This place is great!!  Im kinda paranoid though about the frequency they touch your food.   im not sure how clean their hands are.  Some organic options, really good tuna.

F9dG-NaOUjRJIdG3XXmfDw.text: Tarbell's is at the top of the food chain here in Phoenix. In the dozens and dozens of times I have been here I have never been, nor have my guests ever been, let down.  The drinks are outstanding, the wine list well thought out, the menu a perfect mix that makes you think "gee I wish I could have the Scotch Beef (best item on the menu) and Mark's Famous Spaghetti and Meatballs." Great News you can!  I will have a half order of this and a half order of that, and they say "no problem!"  Anyway, Mark Tarbell has created a special place that all should enjoy at least once; but I recommend not limiting yourself to just once.  Call for reservations, but keep in mind that the bar is a great place to have your meal as well...

yEbSrHfuFrkB7fJL4tDYxw.text: I loved the Muscle starter, amazingly fresh.  Their fresh masseralla salad was very good as well.  I had the pepper steak and my date had the house pasta, just a note on the side they do have a very vegetarian friendly menu.   For desert we have the creme brulee, im not a big desert fan, but it was soooo goood!!! The servise was excellent as well.   over all it was a great experience.

u7uogNBOljWdwM1MaXkBnQ.text: What can I say. This place is amazing. The food is consistently good. The service is impeccable. I go there for special occasions and nights out with my husband. We also take out of town guests here. Always a treat.

j557LAAouXZmMkJ2xWYqNw.text: Exceptional flavors, attentive service, great atmosphere.  Took a group of 7 here on a weeknight for a business dinner, and everyone thought it was a treat.

V8tryh_jIsA5TamYMQ3SpA.text: We loved it - busy, loud, not so romantic, but Mark was kind enough to introduce himself and create an entree tasting of 4 meals for us.  Definitely go back.

OsmLLjO1gjstHqWEodn4Bw.text: We've just moved to Phoenix and so are trying many new restaurants. Tarbell's really stands out. We split the calamari tempura, which was very light and delicious with the 2 dipping sauces. I had the local frees salad, and my husband had the red beet salad. Both were very fresh. The crispy sweet potatoes on the field greens were a nice variation on croutons. I had the Mr. Fish special - seared halibut over Parmesan polenta. Ric had the Scotch Beef. Both were excellent. And we finished with the Date Cake with butterscotch sauce - obscenely delicious. Shane our waiter was very gracious, perfectly attentive, and really good at picking up the tone of the table - joined right in with our sarcasm. All in all an excellent evening and dinner. We'll definitely be back!

eKWFW1_JviRAT7XsMY7NJQ.text: Soup and appetizers were amazing (except for the carpaccio, which was just good).  The tartare was buttery and the broiled capers added that something special.  Whatever bleu cheese they used on the bibb salad was one of the better bleus I've had.  Creamy, sweet, with the perfect amount of bite.  The candied bacon took the first round to another level. Wow.  All around, the appetizers had us panting for more.  Which made the main course all the more disappointing.  The scotch beef was dry and just a little bit better than my mom's pot roast.  The ribbon pasta was ok, but didn't have that special pop.  And the bolognese was just boring.  The disappointment with the mains and the fact that we weren't seated until 8:25 (we had an 8pm reservation) docked a star from the overall review.  Much was at stake with dessert.  Fortunately, dessert was delicious.  The mousse, cheesecake, and the profiteroles were all perfect.  Rich, full of flavor, perfectly sweetened.  The four stars were secured.  I will say that the two groups on either side of our table were a bit too rambunctious for me.  Listening to older masters of the universe talk about the size of their penises (literally) and having their very drunk female companions talk about sex all night was at first a little amusing, but after an hour, it got to be a little old.  Hopefully our next visit will be a little more subdued.

o5Roh-L_Fm51FYeLQAIJtw.text: Rather disappointed, I was fooled by the reviews. Ambience is good but food fell way short of the expectation. Ordered medium fillet but got it well done and very dry. I would say this place is way overrated and mediocre at best, with high end prices.

080GCdRJpOXQyQFx5_mZXw.text: My first time at Tarbell's was with a dinner for 2 certificate. Since neither one of us had been there, our waiter suggested letting us trust him to bring out dishes for us to enjoy as all but alcohol & gratuity was covered. SO glad we went with this option as our waiter spoiled us. Being able to try different appetizers, entrees and dessert felt like we were on a cruise in that the food, presentation and service were immaculate! I don't think there was a dish I tried that fell short of amazing but I do highly recommend the apple crisp. It will change your life. Keep on keeping on Tarbell's

photos.caption: Photo of Tarbell's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Our 4 desserts, all of which were amazing. Far right is the warm &amp; delicious apple crisp

W38xo50G5ntoU8BuWfEKtA.text: Once again.. Simply amazing!! Had excellent meals along with delicious desserts! We had the same waiter as we had when we dined here on Monday and it was nothing short of amazing. I sent a few clients to tarbells that are coming to the area this week and will continue to do so. Thanks to the staff  for an amazing meal, you only live once; I appreciate the art of good food and good service. Touche!

xKNZbn029CawXJB9hKRsaA.text: Perfection! Happy accident! Had a reservation at another place and accidentally ended up here. Fantastic food and service! The chicken fennel and ribbon pasta is to die for!!! Everything we ordered was sublime, start to finish! Will be back! Oh, and they serve Illy coffee, the best!

photos.caption: Photo of Tarbell's - Phoenix, AZ, United States

IBYjtmssY5dofGPsBqEIjA.text: We had our anniversary dinner at Tarbell.  The service and food was wonderful. I plan to return with my family very soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Tarbell's - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Tarbell's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Silky smooth cheesecake.

kPjvpUHJ-pydF1VW36JIqA.text: My first time here. The best steak I have ever had. (Peppered flank steak ) The au gratin potatoes were the best we have ever tasted . This place moves to my top five in Phoenix. The JD and soda was perfectly mixed btw.

MsYz5ZTIoR-gvDVAiP1L1Q.text: I usually have the roast chicken because it's the best. Wouldn't  be afraid of anything on the menu. We live in cave creek so almost need to stay at a hotel after dinner and drinks. Tarbells is as good as it gets anywhere!

r8l28mI5k7M0cb3jqfj8jA.text: We stopped here on a food run around the Biltmore to share a couple dishes.  The beef carpaccio was paper thin and melted.  The mussels in white wine and butter was so good.  We tried to get the bread to soak up as much of the broth as possible so we didn't lift the bowl up to our faces to drink it.  Another table got the Duck Confit Poutine w/ Cheese Curds.. and I need to try that next time.  This stop was right after Tommy V's so we knew not to order more, but I want to come back and explore more of the menu.

XmNQkmcoOMWs39QUZ_-6sw.text: Can tell run by someone in Iron Chef.  Nice atmosphere, food,and wine.  We shared a wide variety of apps and they were all well prepared.  We did like the pizza, was hot though (spice) which was a nice variety.  Wine list was big with lots of choices.  Mains were good.  Pasta was fresh and prepared well.  Maybe next time will make this a 5 vs 4 star, but with all the good, food did not pop this night, so a 4, but still a very nice place to eat and will be a returning customer.

TBPbykMBjWtUKuYWbC1yMg.text: My wife's single favorite restaurant. Anywhere.   This place just never disappoints. High quality everything. The sausage & pappardelle is my favorite. We have tried the scotch beef, many fish dishes, the chicken, most of the appetizers, and always leave happy.   Service is always attentive, and in just the right amounts. Mark Tarbell is likely to be running around greeting customers, which is always a nice touch.   Can't imagine anything less than 5 stars from anyone.

MoaeMNvF_0F9RbMdowadnA.text: I've sat at the bar multiple times and just ordered little bites and wine. Every time I have been in, the staff has been attentive and courteous. I recommend this place to all people I meet that are looking for a great place to have a wonderful food going experience.   I'm looking forward to taking my parents here and out of town guests as well!

3ltr6K9WyA5vbyDARq3WQA.text: *My 200th Review* Tarbell's, you were a dream come True!  This is what 5 stars is to me- The very best service. Every staff member was professional, personable, well groomed, prompt, and smiled often!  The restaurant itself was simple and elegant. Definitely a place I would recommend for a date or special occasion or anytime you want to be fancy!   The crowd was mostly retirees, but I took that as a sign that I was in the right place.  The other diners were very dapper and able bodied and seemed to clearly enjoy the finer things in life.   The food. Mmmmmm yes!! I had the scallops, and they were the best I've ever had. It came with a potato cake and seasonal vegetables, each bite equally delicious. The salmon was also excellent and grilled to perfection. Even the grill marks were absolutely perfect, which I admire because I can not do that myself! It was accompanied by mixed greens with an amazing honey glaze dressing, and potatoes another way- similar to shoe string pik nik sticks but much fancier and salty and mouth watering. We shared the caramel cheesecake for dessert, and that was probably the low point of the meal. Kidding!! Omg, I rarely eat dessert and this was worth.every.calorie!! Perfection! Not to sweet, not too dense, not too light, so full of flavor! The caramel sauce! My, my! I really can't wait to go back. I am very curious about the spaghetti and meatballs! And the profiteroles! I want to try the whole menu, each time it changes!  Thank you Tarbell's, for making my 30th birthday dinner amazing!  Edit: I received a warm phone call from Ty 2 days after dining to inquire how my experience was. I can't say that has ever happened before even at other fine establishments. Very classy. Thanks Ty!

photos.caption: Photo of Tarbell's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Scallops
Photo of Tarbell's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Salmon over mixed greens

GoTWoZA3eFCyDoZ8cyXCTw.text: WOW, Tarbell's is unforgettable and will definitely be a GO-TO for special occasion dinners. (and maybe even to treat myself at the bar :) ...)  Walked in on a Thursday night around 8 pm and were seated at a nice 4-top table right in the center of the dining area, I'm difficult to please, and just by where they placed us, good vibes had already been given off. Our server, Nathan, knew just when to stop by, was able to answer all our questions, and was not pushy at all. The dinner was perfectly timed out, and he never made me feel rushed to finish a course. ....Seriously, what an experience, while we weren't celebrating anything special, Tarbell's truly provided us with a remarkable experience.  After ordering wine, Nathan offered to pick our starters for us since we were unfamiliar with the menu. He selected the Warm "Bacon Candy" Salad, and the Farmers Market Plate. Just a few bites in, my expectations for the rest of the meal were very high.   After our plates were cleared, our entrees arrived. The seafood risotto was good, but a little too overwhelmed with the taste of salmon; but the Tar's Scotch Beef, and the house made Ribbon Pasta with Chicken Fennel Sausage were phenomenal; you can taste quality in every bite... yum!  And lastly, of course I always save room for dessert, I was stuck between the Vanilla Cheesecake with Rosemary Carmel, and the Warm Chocolate Cake, BOTH WERE WONDERFUL!   A genuine thank you to Tarbell's, and Nathan, for making this dinner such a fantastic experience. Dining is one of my favorite ways to explore the city, and I'm so glad to have made a last minute decision to enjoy my Thursday night at your restaurant. 5 stars.. without question!

Gu7iPc7xkR7pWbsRmHWcAw.text: First of all, i dont mind spending a little more for good food, but this place is a rip, way to expensive, and the portions rhey give you are pathetic to say the least, the desert i had tasted like they microwaved it, the taste of the food can use some spices or salt,the iced tea was the worst! It tasted like water, will never go there again

PFhEVZ2X4QzXifUND16kHQ.text: My fiance and I explore a new restaurant every week and this has definitely made the return list. (ASAP). It's hard to beat home cooking. We are quite the "foodies" according to our waiter. Props to him for picking up on this within five minutes of serving us. Not only was the service amazing the manager was hands on at every table. (Helping with serving food, seating guests, approaching every table, and greeting guests). Which by the way is how it should be... Food was absolutely cooked to perfection. Mussels were tied for my favorite only compared to another dish of them compared a completely different way. Can't wait to return. Very soon

photos.caption: Photo of Tarbell's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Halibut cheeks... Amazing crisp finish
Photo of Tarbell's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Absolutely amazing food, service, wine, and atmosphere. Being &#34;foodies&#34; as our waiter called us.. We will be back. Very soon!

aY68IkTcJM8lNQW1k-Qmlw.text: I'm sure this is a great place however my first experience was unfortunately not that good. I can tell that this place is better than 2 stars however our food took 1:45min. By the time we received our food, we had to ask for it in to go containers as we were already late for a 7pm appt. elsewhere. When we arrived we mentioned we were in a hurry however there was a mis-understanding therefore why our food was delayed. I will try Tarbell's again in hopes it will live up to the referral ratings I received from those who suggested Tarbell's

m083Ee9s84u8fn1wqRb9iA.text: Tarbell's was amazing. Kelly our waitress was the absolute best. She even brought us complimentary appetizers and dessert Food was exceptional. We will most definitely return.

photos.caption: Photo of Tarbell's - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Tarbell's - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Tarbell's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Rosemary cheesecake, wow!

yaEzPWjFKkK686B8yw4ioQ.text: My man's birthday was Tuesday June 5 of this year. Tarbell's is a favorite for anniversaries and birthdays. On the way in, Mark Tarbell was going in as well. It was great to see his demeanor with guests like us and his happy face.  We ordered the Carpaccio which was amazing as always with the arugula, just enough vinaigrette and that lovely cheese.  For our main course, my man ordered the Lobster Gnocchi, and the Fettucini with Morrell Mushrooms ( Our server Nathan graciously offered to serve half and half)  I ordered the Peppered New York Strip with Au Gratin Potatoes and creamed spinach. I requested Med Rare and MORE on the rare side than medium.  My husbands was delivered and was delicious. My first bite of steak was disappointing as it was overcooked and not so flavorful ( we noted also our plates had sat under the lights awhile before being served) . I poked around and Benjamin the busboy notice. He came over and discreetly asked if something was wrong. I described my overdone steak. Action was taken immediately and a new steak delivered. It was good but not melt in your mouth.....our server after this became surly with us. I really applaud Tarbell's as they did not charge for my meal. We tipped our server on the ENTIRE amount anyway.  It was a good dinner but not what we usually are used to at our wonderful Tarbell restaurant.  We will go back but we expect it to be a lot more top of the line!

suRE663-lakrDNpL2udRSQ.text: FIVE STARS ALL THE WAY ladies and gentlemen! I absolutely love this place! The food is fantastic, the decor is beguiling, the staff is wonderful and did I say the food is Fantastic!?  I recently enjoyed a lovely  birthday dinner with a group of friends and GOODNESS was it a delight! We were seated in a timely fashion perfectly accommodating our reservation. Our server Nathan greeted us in the most polite regard and exceeded our expectations with his excellent service--making our celebratory occasion all the more of a celebration!

PVydp-uRvzU9J1NdezNcMQ.text: The 2nd time I went to this restaurant it was clean great food and service. I would defiantly go back again.

FdC7oF-ZWiQgcb1Jp0NZ_Q.text: Nice atmosphere but too loud for quiet conversation. Food is good but pricey and a touch too salty. Service is good.  Parking is terrible. Do not go on a weekend because it is impossible to park there. Although they supposedly have valet parking, they were no where to be found and the cars were backed up onto a very busy street. People were getting out of their cars to scream at others who were blocking cars while waiting for valet who never arrived. The worst I've ever witnessed. By the time we found a space to park, which we created ourselves, we were very upset before entering the restaurant. Tarbell's is located in a tiny strip center with other restaurants and woefully inadequate parking. Don't think it's worth the hassle.

yRSnSuGMKoJiOsDuMomd_Q.text: It was our first time there tonight! It was amazing! We went there because they donated to a fundraiser!!! We live in the area and had never been there. I'm so glad we bought this auction item, it was amazing! Aaron I think was the best waiter I've ever had and the food was out of control good.

MAG1778H1ZDtDhKPgXhmPg.text: Brilliant staff... our waiter was knowledgeable about the menu and wine list .. We couldn't decide on what we wanted and they made arrangements so we could customize our dinner in order to try more of the menu.  The food is flavorful and amazing. I could have ate the entire menu and I think we may have. Everything we had from scallops, halibut, tenderloin steak, New York strip, tuna tartare the potatoes and the cheese cake.. completely enchanting.  I am totally in love.

Ph0c7tvK8jY4LNYZkAqTfg.text: I made last minute reservations on Open Table with no problem.  It asked if it was a special occasion and it was my birthday.  When we got there, there were several people at the hostess stand and each of them greeted us with enthusiasm.  We were promptly seated.   As soon as we sat down, we were given a plate with toasted pita chips and delicious hummus. Our server was very pleasant and never rushed us. I ordered Bolognese.  My husband had the spaghetti with the large meatball.  Both entrees were delicious.  I only ate half of mine.  It was a large portion. We did order dessert.  I got the creme brule.  My husband got the very rich chocolate gelato.  In addition, they brought me the very good and large portion of cheesecake for my birthday.   On the way out, every employee that we passed wished me a happy birthday. Thank you for a wonderful birthday dinner!!

KJ9RRFrjyacfoljFsv5XEA.text: Came in for dinner with customers on a fairly quiet Wednesday night.  Knew right away it was going to be pretty good when Larry Fitzgerald was dinning there.  Anyway, the nice thing about dinner with a larger group is that you can try a lot of dishes.  We had good calamari, great bacon candy and an excellent himachi crudo.  I would recommend the bacon and himachi.    For dinner I got the homemade ribbon pasta, which was exceptional.  My coworker also got this and was impressed.  The other winner of the night was the NY Strip, which I tried and it was an excellent steak.  Though seriously... Get the ribbon pasta.  There's a lot of places in Phoenix for great steak.  We also shared a couple of desserts.  Our favorite was the cheesecake.  Very unique.  The bread pudding was ok.

photos.caption: Photo of Tarbell's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Himachi crudo
Photo of Tarbell's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bacon candy - super delicious though so rich probably best to share.
Photo of Tarbell's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Calamari - good version

fAycGFyNEYODOGYDBXtVCg.text: Everyone goes crazy about Marks meat balls and I'm not a professional critique so maybe I just don't get it.  So give it a try everyone I know loves it..

4ZeRWPCJtGYhEiHepXJXvw.text: February 15th, 2019 This was my third visit to Tarbell's and the experience was so amazing I feel I have to leave a review!  The drink I ordered, the bread, the soup (potato mushroom) the entrees ( I had the  halibut and my husband had the New York steak) were all excellent and, served hot, so I knew it wasn't sitting under a heat lamp for a while. My complimets to the chef and the staff for providing such a great dining experience.

EniHaPOiEV6pmlHQW8XJvQ.text: I'm not sure I understand the love for this place.  Even though the website is dated I went by the 4.5 yelp average thinking it would knock it out of the park but really everything about this restaurant is dated.  The decor is 20 years out of date, the menu and flavor profiles are out of date.    The food is good but not great, the wine list is a great value.  Service is pretty good as well, but really not much special going on here.    3.5 stars.

5bBI7gogNDeka-aOuwJVyQ.text: We had heard so many great things about this place, and lived close, but for some reason waited two years to go. Don't wait! Absolutely the best service  (ask for Kelly), and the food was amazing. Nice portions, great salad. We had the pot roast, and sausage pasta. The desserts were some of the best, including Rosemary cheesecake that sounds strange but was so amazing. Such a winner, and we can't wait to go back!

drWuWCKMVOoKBwhoxWZOvQ.text: This was our first visit to Tarbell's after hearing great comments from friends and family who had eaten there.  It was our 60th New Year's Eve together and everything was perfect.  We arrived a little early for our 5:45 p.m. reservation.  While waiting, the owner came over and introduced himself to us and said our table would be available shortly, and it was.  The staff was well trained and very friendly.  My wife had the halibut and I had the Scottish beef.  Both were cooked to perfection, the presentations were very creative and the seasonings were amazing.  Absolutely delicious!  We had calamari for an appetizer.  It was served promptly and was excellent.  The Beloved Chocolate Mousse was the perfect ending to a perfect meal....outstanding! We don't live close to the restaurant, but will definitely eat here again.  Thanks to Mark and his staff for a wonderful experience.

lrVEuhtAwHVclgLf3IH2hg.text: We had never been to Tarbell's before, and decided it was the place to grab an early Mother's Day dinner. The service is impeccable, and you will feel tended to throughout your visit.  I enjoyed my grilled romaine salad, and the roasted chicken was wonderful. I'd read on Yelp that they would let you order half portions, which allowed me to get half a salad, as well as half of the chicken paired with half of the ribbon pasta. Yes, that was far too much food for me, but I was able to try a variety of things, and had leftovers for tomorrow. I appreciate that Tarbell's offers this option for portions. I shared the cheesecake for dessert, and it was wonderful. If the description of rosemary in the caramel sauce freaks you out, don't worry. It really is just a hint of the herb.  **I almost dropped a star off my review because of the owner, but decided that the food and service are what matters. He was making his way to all of the tables, yet pointedly skipped ours. The logical assumption is that he was very busy. But when he first came through, we were one of three occupied tables. As the room filled, he made it to every table  but ours. As we stood up to walk out, he made eye contact with me. No smile, no "thanks for coming"- he just  turned away. It was hard not to feel completely slighted.

T_ik39jjkvnRz0FFDdSNGA.text: Had to wait 15' for a table- little room to stand- even though had a reservation and was on time. Very loud, crowded, expensive & food mediocre. The lamb, salmon & soul was tasteless. Couldn't hear across the table. Parking nearly impossible.

uLiMPxtJplk-olBwS1Ot1A.text: Fresh menu, fresh ingredients, great service. Not much more to say on this one. The visible pizza oven was temping but on a visit for dinner I went for the fish special of the day which was a freshly caught swordfish and was not disappointed. The side bonus (which did not really apply to my menu selection for the night) was also seeing they are open to changing menu items to be gluten free as well. What? Recipes on their website too? Not sure when, if ever, I have seen that before.  Before coming here comments from others set the bar pretty high and I would say there was nothing to disappoint that expectation level on my first visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Tarbell's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. House made Lemon Cucumber Cello for dessert #GeniusNetwork 2016

hl3S6y0Bqhv_zq1Q6QQOvQ.text: When I made reservations I asked for a dessert with a candle for a birthday celebration. We received the most delightful cheesecake with a candle and Happy Birthday written in chocolate on the plate. After the meal we had, the serving of cheesecake was just the right amount for the four of us. Dinner was extremely good. Two of us had the Scotch Beef and the other two had the NY steak. The portions were just the right size. We all cleaned our plates and weren't stuffed, but not hungry either. We had the butternut squash soup, which was the only disappointment. We all agreed that it was a little bland We ordered a white wine and because the bottle wasn't chilled enough we received another wine (on the house) until our wine was ready to drink. The wait staff was very attentive, but not hovering. A wonderful experience. We'd all go back.

J1YCcwgC1-KanDoNxhVV5Q.text: My meal was ok.  JUST KIDDING. My meal made me wonder what the hell I'd been doing with my life? It also made me miss my grandparents, but that's another story.  This story is about my love of scallops and cheesecake ... and rosemary. If you want to impress me, feed me these things. Seriously, that's all you have to do. Basically, anything with rosemary will make me like you.    Unfortunately (and fortunately), I was on a date during this dining experience. When the cheesecake arrived, I wanted to devour the whole thing, but I had to pretend to be a lady. Apparently, ladies don't shovel dessert into their mouth like a hungry animal ... at least, according to that etiquette school I attended as a child.  I can only eat desserts on dates, otherwise I have no self-control. Oh, little ol' me? Just a bite. Yeah, that's all I want. Just a taste. No, no, I couldn't possibly. Okay, maybe one more. Okay, this is the last bite. What's that? You're looking away for a second? Boom, okay, one more bite won't hurt. Just don't go to the bathroom, okay? I can't be trusted.

8zrqyqmfvO5DUmUuiGBRJg.text: This review is just for dessert only. I was in town checking out Phoenix, we had dinner elsewhere and then we were craving a fancy dessert. Tarbells was the only place I could find that served creme brulee, so that's how we ended up here. The staff was very nice and attentive even though we were only having dessert.   I got the cheesecake with caramel sauce and my husband got the creme brulee served with fresh berries. Both of the desserts were amazingly delicious! The cheesecake was one of the best I have ever had, my husband who just wanted creme brulee was addicted to the cheesecake by the end. It was a very generous portion served in a fun cylinder shape, and it was so rich and smooth I couldn't quite finish all of it which makes me a little sad. The creme brulee was also really good, crispy on top and creamy underneath, lots of delicious berries as well.

VvxFELzluZyCC3VomN1rmg.text: One of the best date night dinners we have had. The ambiance and attention to detail was truly special. The staff is experienced and well-trained. We always had service when we needed it but it was not over-bearing. The food was great. The steak was perfectly cooked, even for my medium-well taste. The onion strings are a hearty portion and great for sharing as an appetizer. We recommend Tarbell's to our friends and will go back again.

NMnDLDQlSX6D1kO8coRs7Q.text: I love how many great restaurants in the Phoenix area are in strip malls. It always makes me giggle.  Atmosphere is nice - it's contemporary and has good energy.  We shared the calamari appetizer, it was great.  Nothing highly unusual, just good calamari.  I had the chicken sausage pasta dish.  It was yummy, but not as good as the scotch beef my parents ordered.  GIven the chef won "Iron Chef America" (only challenger that season to beat an Iron Chef) - I expected the food to be a bit more adventurous. It's pretty straightforward - almost comfort food.  Our service was great - the server had been there a long time. She was friendly and attentive.

TplYD26Gt3Fs8_8aFnrLng.text: This place is amazing!! The food is excellent. Scotch beef with mashed potatoes is my favorite, but everything I have had has been just as good... pepper steak, kale chips, ceasar salad, etc.  The scallops are the best I have ever had. The owner is always in talking with customers, the bartenders are awesome, service is incredible. Very warm and welcoming atmosphere. You can have a half order of anything on the menu, whether you are not very hungry or want to try two different things! One of my favorite places in town.

tFiqBrKBlmfRv790lH-oLg.text: Outstanding experience.  The food, ambience, and service were A+.  Food was prepared and seasoned perfectly.  I ordered the swordfish - absolutely delicious and the side of risotto was the best I've ever tasted.  My husband ordered the sausage pizza which was excellent - nice thin crust and flavorful.  Dessert was a creme brulee served in a baked apple with caramel sauce - wow! Our server was great - she was extremely attentive and really knew the menu.  Her recommendations were right on and she was able to explain items we didn't understand on the menu.   Highly recommend this restaurant especially for a special occasion.

tRBGMoFjlnJclTiCXRBqkQ.text: Bah.  I expected so much more.  Noca (one of my top 3 in AZ) is less than a mile away and I expected Tarbell's to be at least near the level of quality.  Now, I must say, the service was 5 stars (great server and charming Mr. Tarbell came by and chatted with us) However, the quality of what was on our table just simply wasn't there.    Two people in our party of three ordered off the restaurant week menu.  The fresh mozzarella appetizer was described as "delicious, but lacking pesto".  I ordered the Grilled Organic Salmon on Crispy Potato Cake molasses, lime, McClendon's honey.  The salmon was cooked to perfection and I thoroughly enjoyed the tangy glaze.  But OMG!!-- the crispy potato cake confused the hell out of me-- it tasted like burnt shoestring potato pieces.  Seriously. I expected crisp fritter or hash...something edible and not over-deep-fried.  Onto dessert.....I opted out, but the other 2 were given dessert with the restaurant week deal.  The mousse was terrific! (props to that) The doughnut holes were a letdown.  Like my potatoes, they where very overcooked.  In fact, one was ridiculously dark brown-- visibly over-fried.  We were kind of surprised it was even brought to our table like that.  For the price that we paid for average food, I really wished we would have gone across the street to Noca :(  Highlights:  service, atmosphere, mozzarella, mousse

UyQA-YkQe08UAYpY3ronlw.text: Our meal was really wonderful but the service put this over the top for me. I was curious about the scotch beef and asked the server his thoughts. He encouraged me to try it and said if I didn't enjoy it they would be happy to make me something else. A few minutes later he brought over a plate of sliders made with the beef so we could sample it. It was delicious!  I ordered that as my entree and was very in love with it. My husband had the Scottish Salmon and asked to pair it with asparagus risotto and the were happy to accommodate. After our food was gone they brought us an amazing serving of cheesecake with rosemary Carmel sauce because he heard us mention it was our anniversary. The buttermilk mashed potatoes are to die for. We had a wonderful night out thank and greatly appreciated the thoughtfulness of our server.

gzEU2TK14TwO0u-bs5zj2w.text: Yeah... I did it. I was in the Phoenix area and could not resist checking out the Iron Chef competitor and toppled Cat Cora. So with taste buds set for battle and stomach ready to receive I ventured in.  The restaurant is quaint. The waitress was incredibly helpful. I am one of those "tapas" eaters...yup I enjoy a little bite of everything and especially if it comes in the form of outside my comfort zone. Granted, the items on the menue here are fairly standard fair, but done exceptionally well.   I had the swordfish and beef carpaccio. Both were absolutely excellent. The service was top notch, it did get a bit noises (but the noise was fun energetic chatter...which was nice). Visually the food was average...but probably better than most restaurants. What I apprecaited was visually it was still manageable and you didn't feel as you didn't know what your next step was...take a picture, poke it, smell it...stare at it.   Anyways, good stuff, I will be back!

wccFk5D2AqVhaOW2owL_pg.text: We have been to Tarbell's numerous times and it is always an excellent dining experience. Most recently we went for dinner on Valentines Day, 2012.  We were promptly seated then water and bread with EVOO were served moments after we arrived. Our server was very informative, extremely pleasant and non-intrusive. Chef Tarbell came by our table and chatted for a few minutes then each course came out as the previous plate was lifted.   The food is always fresh and delicious. My wife had the beet salad and I started with the potato and celery soup.  We both chose the fish of the day which was red snapper flown in from Maine. The bean medley that accompanied the fish was just as good as the entree itself.  Chocolate cake with pistachio ice cream polished of a wonderful Valentine's dining experience.  Bravo Chef Tarbell  PS We love this place so much because it is a place for foodies that is not pretentious. It is a business casual affair and the decor and layout are very appealing.  The windows always catch our attention because they remain impecibally clean.  You'll SEE what I mean.

Zg5xoxP0srg_FwBuno64tg.text: I'm so glad after going to so many terrible restaurants recently that Tarbell is not just hype!  The portions are pretty tiny.. but every bite I tried of every dish was pretty much Italian as good as it gets.  I had the ribbon pasta with sausage and spinach.  Also tried the bolognese.  Also tried the chicken.  The bread pudding I wasn't a huge fan of.    I can't wait to come back - definitely a special occasion restaurant of choice for people who appreciate good food!

tgpvaEPuRv4z58-Ob1KlVg.text: Tarbells has been a favorite for years.  Last night was not a good night. It was crowded as it always is on a Friday night.  We were seated promptly in an average location. Sort of felt like we were in our neighbors table the way the table was angled. The service was very slow.  We were well into our cocktails before we ordered our apps.    We ordered the carpaccio and the roasted  brussel sprouts.  The carpaccio was delicious.  We really enjoyed it.  The roasted brussel sprouts were equally good.  I had the fish special of the night and my dh had the ribbon pasta which he has had many times before.  My fish was just ok. The description sounded great but there was something seriously bitter on the plate.  On top of that, the dish was incredibly under seasoned.   I love the wine list and usually love the the food. Last night it was just meh.

vHobciyaG8l-8v0ULnOn_Q.text: Food was good and the drinks were even better. The Texas Sazerac is very good, though small. Had the signature dishes (scotch beef, meatball, handmade pasta, and scallops) and everyone enjoyed the meal immensely. The service was a bit lackluster for a restaurant at this level. We had to micromanage the staff a bit to take our order and get bread plates (and they weren't even that packed). But overall a good experience. I hope their service improves, as there is good potential here for fine dining.

mb--2hhVWqnCZNwNprtamw.text: Its really sad to hear John S. factor parking while rating the food at Tarbell's. Perhaps he should have spent an additional couple dollars to valet; and olive oil served w/ bread instead of butter isn't really as "fashionable" as it is traditional, esp at Italian restaurants.   One of my all-time favorites there are the spaghetti and meatballs. One of their signature dishes and probably some of the best I've had in town!  Our service last night was outstanding....as usual! The place is indeed small. Reservations on the weekend are necessary well in advance. So its easy to imagine that they try to turn tables quickly. No excuse, however, for a customer feeling rushed.   Otherwise, the pasta dishes are especially fantastic and worth a small inconvenience.   Bon appetite!

dnHS2oNQ-CMem5LXO_lf-g.text: We were given a gift certificate for Christmas from our kids to go here!  We're very excited to try it!  We ordered the mussels as an appetizer---they were raw!  Then tried Scotch beef sliders---they were good!  I ordered the recommended special which was prawns with pasta---prawns were terrible and the pasta was raw!  The server felt bad and brought us the augratin potatoes---they were raw!  My husband ordered the roast chicken for $29---it was roast chicken!  Not going back!  Nathan the server was great!

xxj9ZXrjxMEz9LPpQ5l-sQ.text: By far the best restaurant in Phoenix!  Mark Tarbell always goes the extra mile to make his customers feel special and appreciated.  The food is always fabulous.  He always puts a unique touch on basic dishes, again making you feel special.  Love love love this place and it's a MUST for anyone dining in Phoenix.  The wait staff was extremely attentive never even allowing our glasses of water to get half empty.  We were never rushed to leave even long after out meal was paid for.  Always an enjoyable experience.  Thanks Mark!!

b0O_n5cHNP24hawq0a9v6A.text: What a restaurant! Absolutely loved my experience at Tarbells. I've been hearing rave reviews for quite sometime and decided to try it out recently. My party and I sat at the bar, which was a great choice because the bar was comfortable, rather large and really social and fun. The bartender (young woman) was fabulous, inviting and very nice! She was very attentive. A guest in my party dines at Tarbells often and she had his drink in front of him by the time we walked to the end of the bar.....Now thats some customer service for ya!  Food = We started with the Calamari. A favorite dish of mine and this one was outstanding. Two very different but delicious dipping sauces. A roasted red pepper and a pesto mix. Not sure which one I liked more :) I enjoyed the pan-seared jumbo sea scallops. TO DIE FOR. I am a huge scallop fan and these were done just right. Caramelized, giving them the right amount a sweet....and it was served over very yummy risotto. Another dish enjoyed by my party was the Fennel Sausage Pasta dish, the fennel sausage was AMAZING.   Overall experience was fantastic, as soon as I get another opportunity I will be dining here again! :)

iTZeBka8MlvJd4Prr49uWQ.text: We wanted to have a good place to have dinner with my son and his girlfriend. The front desk recommended Tarbell's for their impressive wine list. The ambience in the restaurant was nice and subdued.  The menu was filled with a good mix of fresh veggies and great meat dishes. We all had a hard time choosing what we wanted. The chef was no help; he sent a appetizer of calamari for us to share. It was delicious. My son ordered the salmon and his girlfriend had the pan seared chicken. Both thoroughly enjoyed their entrees. My boyfriend chose small plate of the Carpaccio and I had the Scotch beef. The gravy was so smooth and the mashed potatoes so tasty, I wanted to lick the bowl. Everyone really enjoyed the evening.

bnqPr41Hk4GqqRlbsbU5lw.text: I can't believe I've never been here so I finally made a point to go!  Ambiance is great. I was on a date but I could have just have easily had a dinner with anyone here and it would have been perfect. The menu is not elaborate but very creative. My friend ordered the pasta and they offered to split two dishes for him so he could sample both. Great wine list. Not the best I've seen but you can definitely find a nice bottle.  Mark up is going to be ridiculous of course so find one you like and then get it at AJs or Total Wine.  The service was prompt and friendly. The table next to us was doing Grande Marnier flight which was different.  Dessert which we never skip was delicious! We had the mousse. I had the Scotch beef.  It was so tender and flavorful,  it just pulled apart on my fork. We also tried the pizza as an appetizer.  So good!  It was dim and quiet.  Some music played and there were plenty of servers.  Overall very nice place. Prices are a tad high comparatively.  Filet was about $49. But if it's a special occasion or, you're not paying,  definitely recommend! !
