5ovzl6J2lC61L4_APGPF8g.text: From greeting to goodbye, this was a superb dining experience.  I was able to make a reservation using Open Table.  A friendly Tarbell's caller confirmed the reservation on the day we were scheduled.  I told them we were celebrating a wedding anniversary, though we did not want a fuss and we rarely eat dessert, so I wasn't asking for anything.  We were greeted with a sincere "Happy Anniversary".  Our server was relaxed and well informed.  I told her that I avoid gluten, and she immediately knew how to advise me with the menu.  We started with wine by the glass.  I had a light pinot Grigio and my husband had the Malbec.  Both were just fine.  We then ordered, sharing a Caesar salad for a starter.  It was romaine and kale, an interesting variation of the traditional Caesar.  We didn't have to ask for no croutons.  I ordered the mussels and my husband ordered a steak and buttermilk mashed potatoes.  After we finished the plated shared salad, our server surprised us with two magnificent appetizers.  She took it upon herself to choose appetizers for us because I told the confirmer that we don't eat many desserts.  The mozzarella and tomato salad and the sweet bacon with cabbage were outstanding!  Our main dishes were perfectly prepared.  Servings were huge.  The potatoes were exceptionally good.  I finished with an illy espresso, as good as I have ever had.  This was one of the best, most unique dining experiences we have had.  I can't wait to return.

nUjlsBU4m3hcMglviXfhOw.text: So I just came back from Tarbell's.  Underwhelmed and slightly offended would be the summary for my experience there.  The positives, straight-away:  the ambiance, decor and the bartender serving me were all perfectly adequate -- and that's where they end.  So I'll be the first to admit, I'm a male 30-something showing up alone on the Saturday before Mother's day, without a reservation and wearing a tshirt and jeans (nice ones though).  Even if you consider gender and age profiling aside, there is absolutely no excuse for how I was treated when I walked through the door.  I walk in, and the hostess just gives me a blank stare.  I say "Hi".  She continues to just stare at me like I'm a two headed alien.  I actually had to initiate spoken language by glibly asking "This is a restaurant, right?" -- clearly I'm trying to get noticed -- there isn't a crowd around me.  "Yes this is a restaurant ..." followed by more staring and silence.  I say "well, I'm pretty hungry, can we do something about that" -- and only then does she bother to explain that the dining room is full but I could find myself a seat at the bar.  Gee thanks.  It was so unbelievably disrespectful and unwelcoming I'm pretty sure the only reason I actually sat down at the bar was because there was a seat open, and I was still trying to process what had just happened.  Trying to put that behind me, the lady barkeep takes my drink order, and my food order:  carpaccio ($17) and the NY steak ($44).  The carpaccio was the most boring carpaccio I have ever had -- not bad, not good: boring.  Insanely, there was too much meat!  Just all meat and parmigiano -- a little more olive oil and some simple dressed greens would have made that dish so much better.  The steak I ordered medium-rare.  It came out medium, it was kinda charred, and really tough for "35 day aged" hand-picked angus prime -- more like the consistency of medium London broil from Safeway.  It had a sauce on it (which wasn't mentioned on the menu) that just looked and tasted like the most basic demi-glace sauce you could imagine -- at first I thought it was the steak bleeding off.  I don't eat potatoes, so I just asked for extra spinach.  Pan creamed?  Pfft -- I swear it was simply a pile of salted, wilted spinach -- it had no seasoning I could detect, much less any kind of cream or butter or anything.  It was so plain it was sticking to my teeth.  I skipped dessert.  Final thoughts:  after some consideration, I still gave this place 2 stars.  If you're an older, much more boring person in the world, this place is right up your alley.  With all the Bentleys and Porsches parked out front (I saw some fogey driving a Viper!) this place would probably be perfect for older rich people that have no real palate:  people that go to restaurants to improve their socioeconomic standing among their peers instead of discovering mind-blowing food.  I'm sure Chef Tarbell is an excellent chef, but I'm under the impression he has had to dumb down his food because the well-heeled, stodgy clientele wouldn't be able to appreciate the real thing.  That, or Food Network's ICA is scripted and staged.

F2tVvGrN58GVXP5PXjbE5Q.text: As a foodie, traveling through Phoenix, I was excited to be able to dine at Tarbells. Sadly, my experience did not live up to the billing. As a solo diner, it was obvious I was pegged as a "turn and burn". I was quickly served  a tasty olive oil and bread for dipping, however the bread tasted very much like frozen par  baked bread, that had been reheated. I would have expected something a little more refined in such a restaurant. The server, who when I asked about the menu, what she liked, did not tell me about the specials I heard her recite at other tables around me. I ordered the carpaccio which came out in less than 3 minutes. Obviously plated ahead and kept in the fridge with which I have no problem per se, but the chilled meat subtle taste was masked by the very cold what was beautifully marbled beef. Add to that, the overpowering amount of vinaigrette dressing on what looked like pretty arugula and the carpaccio was almost indiscernible.  On the server's recommendation I ordered housemade ribbon noodles with homemade chicken fennel sausage, tomato, spinach in a rich buttery broth for my entree. What arrived was a very full bowl of broth that was very very rich with butter and for the first three spoonfuls was luxurious, but way too rich to be able to enjoy it in the quantity served. The fresh noodles that I had to search through the broth were stuck together in one mass under a small pile of canned tomatoes, the accompanying spinach also lost somewhere in the broth. The sausage looked like a breakfast pattie that had been browned on one side and then broken into pieces. Not what I was expecting. The fennel seed was so overpowering I could not eat it all. Because of the reputation and rave on line reviews I will tell myself, maybe I made lesser menu selections and will, when I am in Phoenix later in the year go back and try again. Fingers crossed.

RC86WW3X4k4VLjsAleP7tQ.text: My boyfriend and I went here for our anniversary, and it was very good. The ambience was a little old school, but the food was great. We split a light salad to start and the waiter had them split it onto two plates for us, which was really nice. The salad was flavorful, but not overpowering. I had scotch beef for my main and he had BBQ pork. They were both delicious! I could have licked the bowls. Finally for dessert we had this amazing cheesecake with rosemary caramel sauce. It was so rich and wonderful. This place is a bit pricey, but it is so worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Tarbell's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Scotch beef... mucho tasty
Photo of Tarbell's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Rosemary caramel cheesecake *drool* This is a must!
Photo of Tarbell's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. BBQ pork on french fries..... so good.

jvXET-17yzMnX50SdSGQlw.text: I don't understand how this restaurant has become so popular.  Regrettablly, I have to eat there a few times a year as my boyfriend's father likes this place because of their round table in a semi-private room.   Last night was hopefully the last time I will eat there until the Holiday season.  I ordered the Fire-roasted Seafood Chowder.  It was bland and lukewarm.  It tasted like someone opened a can of ro-tel tomatoes and added chuncks of overcooked Salmon.  A chef should be ashamed to serve such a dish.  If it would have been just my boyfriend and myself dining - I would have sent it back without hesitation.  Did I mention that this "chowder" was $18 - ridiculous.  I gave it two stars because the server was nice - but the food alone is one star.

7G8YCaDMV7Tl5yWwz_FL2w.text: Alan is an amazing server, he went above and beyond for us and he has a great sense of humor. Each dish starting with appetizers then two salads that were amazing and all of us ended up eating off eating off each other plates since they all were AMAZING! The wine list was very accommodating to any one's taste.We ended closing the restaurant after our 2 delicious desert we ordered and the extra one that Alan surprised us! 5 star all the way! Thanks Alan!

3Ns0DP7W50z9HrLLvnjj9w.text: Awesome new tavern. Kale chips, scallop seviche

LSii3VIReug-qiOdL7MgBQ.text: I had the pleasure of dining with two lovely ladies this past Tuesday evening. We were coming here for Restaurant week, but ended up ordering straight off the menu. From start to finish, the service was outstanding. Our hostess greeted us with the biggest smile ever, our waitress was so very knowledgeable and I took her recommendation from my glass of wine ( Ancient Peaks Cab) to dinner (Grilled Organic Salmon on Crispy Potato Cake molasses, lime, McClendon's honey) to dessert (The "Beloved" Chocolate Mousse Featuring Guittard Chocolate) OMG! everything was amazing. The table even shared the Mac and Cheese made with Vermont Cheddar. I am telling you, if I was at home by myself, I would have licked the bowl. Same for the Chocolate Mousse. (still shaking my head it was so good)  Will I be back, absolutely! It really was a great experience from start to finish!

mI1B7cqeQJE6KnUtAYEpRQ.text: I've been wanting to go to Tarbell's for awhile now, since it's such a greatly reviewed local restaurant, and because head chef Mark Tarbell also won Iron Chef America, when he battled Cat Cora with the secret ingredient of apple. (His winning dessert from the show is on the menu.)  I'm disappointed I wasn't completely wowed by the place, but the friendly and knowledgeable staff was definitely appreciated.  The restaurant's decor isn't particularly stunning. The tables do have linens on them, but the atmosphere was pretty plain, save for a few brightly colored paintings. The view outside is of a parking lot, so while the restaurant looks cool from the outside with its window walls, it's not fun to look at cars on cement while you're eating.  The crowd skewed older, middle-age and above. Besides a couple kids with families, I might have been the youngest person dining there, which seemed sort of weird. It's definitely a place I'd rather go when I'm middle-aged and have savings to spend, rather than head there now.  Food-wise, I was impressed with the abundance of locally grown ingredients. That's a really great thing to have in a restaurant, so it was really respectable, but the food just wasn't spectacular like I had hoped.  The salad I started with, Maya's Field Greens ($9), had fennel, carrots and an amazing carrot vinaigrette (I left the beets off my salad.) It was really heavy on the greens (I sort of felt like a rabbit as I ate it), but because they tasted so fresh, it made up for the lack of diversity in the salad. And the dressing was so delicious, I would prefer it over ranch-and that's a big deal for me.  For my entree, I had housemade fettuccine, with a spinach pesto sauce, squash, caramelized onions and goat cheese ($19). While the sauce was great, and I really enjoyed the goat cheese flavor, I wasn't as enthused with the consistency of the pasta. The strips were so thin, it almost melted together. It was difficult to twirl on my fork and a little messy to eat. I did like the combination of so many flavors, though.  We also had crispy chickpeas ($4), which were very interesting. I prefer regular chickpeas to these crispy ones, but they were seasoned well with parmesan, olive oil and parsley and tasted even better when I added them to my pasta. I just wouldn't order them to eat them alone again.  My favorite part of the meal, besides the tasty bottle of red wine we had from the massive wine list, was the dessert. We had chocolate mousse ($9), which was thick and creamy and topped with tasty whipped cream.  The dessert wasn't enough to make me want to come back any time soon. I feel like I could get better farm-to-table food at chicer places for less money (see St. Francis). Maybe I'll try Tarbell's out again, but it probably won't be until I'm way older.

QFewL7_LkuzgESZKPHqdHQ.text: Tarbells reminds me of some highly-rated restaurants that i visited when I lived near Malibu that were highly rated. They were ok, but not worthy of their rating. Their location near the ' disposable income ' Capital of the Western World-gave them better ratings than they actually deserved. Tarbells has some good, solid food, but there are dozen better restaurants within a 5 mile radius.

HtKD20NVWhuYcwvqNP6ydQ.text: First of all, we are regulars who love this place. Excellent wine list with servers who are knowledgable about all of the wines. Fantastic service and great food! Lives up to the hype every time we go!   Keep up the good work Mark!!!  Doug and Noelle

photos.caption: Photo of Tarbell's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Doug and Noelle at Doug&#39;s birthday at Tarbell&#39;s!!!

32FjOMgOHCmYaLbrnu1qvg.text: Uhhhmazing!!! What a fabulous meal! Great service, and each dish was another amazing experience.  We had the spaghetti and meatballs  and the Scotch beef...  Both amazing.  Created corn.... Amazing.  Bread ... Amazing.   Dessert..  . Amazing  Wow

wohaJfCX8LS3iiS2EJPyMQ.text: Officially, the best place to eat in Phoenix.  My mom has been living there for years, and we were desperately looking for something special among the chain restaurants and fast food places.  We will look no further... Had the special - some snapper dish, as did my friend.  We went for my mom's birthday and will definitely returning before her next one.  Service was exceptional... I've never had a restaurant call me the next day asking how everything was.  Someone called me the next day and actually remembered we were celebrating my mom's birthday.  The only disappointment was the fried bean app - skip it!  Waiter had fantastic wine pairings for each course.  Love, love, love.  Made me feel like I was in a great restaurant in NYC, except that the service was way better.

lKTvN-kfhlwb_X4yC_mbRw.text: We ate here on a business trip as part of a recommendation from a friend.  I had the scotch beef with the buttermilk potatoes and it was delicious.   The beef melted in your mouth.  We also had some type of fried bean, calamari, and a sampling of their salads and everything was to die for.  Although it was pricey the meal was delicious and it was worth it.  I also like that our server was very confident in her recommendations and was willing to tell us something was better than something else.  You often get servers that are willing to tell you what is good and what is not on the menu while I don't think this place would have anything that was bad it was nice to know what the house specialties were

HhgXdc9bJpHUDwkkUa-wCw.text: This is our 'go-to' restaurant for our anniversary or a special occasion.  The food and service are consistently excellent.  When I want to recommend a restaurant without a second thought, Tarbell's immediately comes to mind.  We generally order one of their steak entrees and have never been disappointed.

8NCm8sYe2zzn1GyFfi9GCQ.text: Ok, to be fair, I am that rarest of breeds: a vegetarian foodie.   I realize that gives me a lot more challenges at many restaurants, but I have to say I was really disappointed with the food at Tarbell's. I had read all the reviews about how he was an Iron Chef competitor, etc, so perhaps I was expecting too much.  We dined very early, so there was no issue with parking or crowding in the restaurant as many other reviewers had mentioned. We were seated immediately. Server was pleasant and informative as well as prompt. I have no issue at all with the service. In fact it was quite exceptional. It was the food which disappointed.  I asked the server about vegetarian options. There was a seasonal vegetable mixture on the menu and the server convinced me that was the way to go. We discussed a few other options, but I went with his recommendation. When it came to the table the presentation was "interesting" but not especially appetizing.   The flavor wasn't disgusting but certainly not great. I ate about a quarter of it. The server asked if I disliked it. I told him it was edible but not great. He instantly offered to replace it with something else. Points to him. I declined a replacement because there really wasn't anything else vegetarian-without-alteration on the menu that evening. I declined having him take the item off the bill as I did eat part of it. Without being asked the server informed me later that he had taken my entree off the bill.   I forget what we had for dessert. That's a bad thing. Dessert should be memorable.   All in all the bread was really good, the rest of the food was only ok, the service was great, ambiance was ok and the price was WAY too high for what we received, even with my $22 veggie-pile entree removed from the bill. I'm not a cheapskate and I am no stranger to a $200 dinner, but it better be a darn good experience for that. Sadly it wasn't. Dinner companion and I will not be returning.

bMPq70ijIKt8vG-obij7cQ.text: Came here with several friends for a celebration. Audrey, our server, made the celebration great! She provided probably the best service I have ever experienced. The food and desert was great! 5 's all the way...

6ld9B4YziiFuXruBf8ESHg.text: I took my mom here for her Birthday, I made a reservation through Open Table and called a day in advance to confirm that they would have a pre selected desert that would come out with my moms name on it after dinner. We arrived ahead of time and were seated immediately, which was great! Unfortunately we were seated next to a very large group of women who were extremely loud. In order to talk we had to yell at each other and even then we couldn't hear the other person. This was not what I was expecting for ambiance. We asked to be moved to a quieter area and were promptly moved. The ability to move us was a huge plus, the noise almost ruined the nice evening I had planned. The food came out and was absolutely delicious. We started with the Burrata, I had the George Bank Scallops (amazing) and my mom had the Scottish Salmon (equally delicious). We ended our meal with the pre selected desert, Vanilla Creme Bruelee with mixed berries. They spelled my moms name incorrectly...that really irritated me because I spelled it out in advance when I called the day before, but overall the experience was redeemed by the food and the really great staff. In my opinion I wouldn't go back to Tarbell's for a special occasion, unless you don't mind the noise. It gave us the feel of an upscale sports bar than a fine restaurant. However, I would dine here again with friends.

O5lLx9er_pIdFDSchN9kkw.text: Fresh food, great flavors, deftly made, impeccable service. @Tarbells I accidentally wandered into this restaurant when it first opened in December of 1994 and have been a customer ever since.  The atmosphere is "cool" and allows one to feel comfortable arriving in a suite and tie or in jeans and a tee shirt.  The staff is welcoming and attentive to detail. There are seasonal dishes that are interesting, amazing and rare - and standby dishes that we love to order.  Things to try: House pulled Mozzarella with tomatoes - yes, it is a standard in many restaurants until you try this one, and this will become your new standard. The chicken fennel sausage with broth is one of the most incredibly complex broths that tastes like it was made with incredible care and precision. Pan roasted chicken is never dry, perfectly crispy skin. The vegetable plate is amazing, almost enough to inspire me to become a vegetarian. Fish of the moment - always fresh, flown in daily, prepared well - my wife loves the halibut. My son has gone there since he was born - he is welcome there, fussed over, and they always have noodles ready for him (home made). I cannot recommend this place enough

uhbqtFDWbDcOfQO6t90jPA.text: Pretty good. However our dishes were very inconsistent in quality. We actually had to send one back. It was sooooo over salted. I haven't sent a dish back in years. We all agreed we could just barely test lemon in the lemon curd dessert. The candied bacon appetizer was great. The strozzapreti was great. The olive oil cake as delicious. One weird thing was the serving size of the desserts was so much larger than the entrees. I think it's good, but overpriced.

g41gQLHP84Xx-HVpUrDuVg.text: First comment is we went in for a late dinner stayed beyond their closing time never a push a rush to leave. I really do not have one complaint the food was stellar The fish was excellent flaky delicious wine the waiter suggested was excellent everything was wonderful. Lastly I will comment about the staff everyone we met or encountered was pleasant!

YRD0V9eJAYcehGuX5pScfA.text: We always pick somewhere fancy and a little pricey for Christmas Eve dinner, and we picked Tarbell's last year.  As someone else mentioned, it isn't the most cozy place (read: romantic), but it was certainly nice.  The only reason I didn't given it 5 stars is because we have gone other places that were even nicer, with outstanding service (Tarbell's service was great, just not impeccable which is what we were looking for that night). The food was great.  We ordered the mussels and expected a bowl with a dozen in them to share- NOPE!  We EACH had a dozen mussels...almost unable to eat them all and dinner!   The place was busy, mostly an older quieter crowd which was nice, until a trio of young Scottsdale-ians walked in.  Boo. Valet was super easy, food was great.  Would go back for a nice dinner, just not for our nice Christmas Eve dinner.

mVDeMWJ3bsW4wK5kexewlg.text: Incredibly pleasant surprise finding this gem owned by a chef who was on Iron Chef.  The menu was a great balance between seafood I love and non-seafood which my wife loves.  I initially chose this restaurant just for the grilled Caesar which was better than I thought it could be.  When our waiter Keith offered to give me a half portion of the lobster gnocchi and a 1/2 portion of the squid ink pasta instead of making me choose, I fell in love with the place.  Only thing better than that service was the taste of those two dishes which were INCREDIBLE!!!  Oh, the molten chocolate cake we had with salted caramel sauce topped this dinner off in a way I couldn't imagine.  Go have a great dinner at Tarbell's!

2ObJ8f0KtpAiGcbCBX3vSA.text: Tarbell's is such a neighborhood gem. Hands down one of our favorite spots for special occasions. We were there yesterday for Valentine's Day and we really enjoyed that they had their everyday menu available. No preset, three course meals. YES! The wine list is top notch and the food is incredible. We really enjoyed everything we ordered, mushroom risotto and the halibut; even the items we didn't order (complimentary)! The owner was gracious enough to introduce himself and wish us a great night. With champagne, no less!  Such a wonderful place - we will be back. Again, and again.

TXP9LvjdBt-uy8V6NXjEpg.text: Tarbell's had excellent food, great drinks but the service was fantastic. Nicole had excellent suggestions and made a delicious drink to start things off. Food was quick, well plated and incredible flavors. Definitely try out the creame brulee.

V17njXAkb6QDiDK1r8duBg.text: This past Saturday night we visited Tabell's after talking about it for years. It's probably been 20+ years since we've been there. We arrived early and were seated quickly. The place was filling in fast. It was somewhat quiet with the carpeted flooring and diamond shaped foam sound suppressers on the ceiling. Our waiter was Nathan, very nice and professional. Our order started with some apps. I ordered the Escargot and my wife was considering the mussels but changed her mind. Nathan asked if she would like a half order and she said no. A few moments later my escargot arrives and a small plate of 4 mussels. Nathan said he didn't want her to feel left out. The escargot was prepared differently than most times I had them. They were cooked well and laid in a small dish of mushroom sauce. The mussels he gave my wife were horrible. Mussels should be somewhat firm in the shape of your thumb and orange in color. These had the texture/taste of warm slimy oysters. My wife had to spit hers out into her napkin. I tried one and it was pretty bad. I've never had slimy mussels before. Our entree's arrive, I had the salmon and my wife had the special for the night, the halibut. My salmon laid on a bed of salad and then on a second bed of grated potatoes that were glazed together into a hard layer and served cold. I'm not sure if they were just for aesthetics or too eat. I broke a few pieces off and it was ok.... My wife's halibut was full of grease and was like eating mush greasy pudding. There was no flakiness, texture or taste. It was the worst halibut we've ever had. I tried some and I had to pass also. We only ate half our plates and a woman came by and picked up our plates, so the waiter never saw the amount we ate. We didn't want to complain and start a ruckus. We passed on desert and left for home. We were so disappointed and let down, I don't think we said three words on the way home to Gilbert. Very disappointing evening...

photos.caption: Photo of Tarbell's - Phoenix, AZ, United States

_hXl08FA9fM9fv787mcVxw.text: It was my birthday dinner.  The front of the house staff is fantastic.  Service was fantastic. Kir royale is my favorite drink.  I've had them all o wr the world.  This was my favorite.  His wine selection is outstanding.  The escargot was the best I've had, and that is a giant statement.  I've eaten it in at least a dozen James beard nominee restaurants.  He wins hands down.  Our brussel sprouts and Augustin potatoes were good not great.  The lamb gnocchi was amazing.  My companion loved his scotch beef.  If you get the chance to eat here, do it. The awards are well deserved.  This is NO emperors new clothes situation.  He has a gift.

qOtgB3bA-J7fp5IYCVcVdA.text: Tonight was my first time eating at Tarbell's and if you don't want to read my entire review below, then just know that I HIGHLY recommend eating here (especially with a significant other on date night).  Over the years my girlfriend has only heard incredible things about this place but since she lives in Peoria, she's never got around to trying it. Since I live pretty close and decided to have a nice dinner tonight, she managed to schedule a same-day reservation for 8pm and on a Friday no less!  We arrived shortly after 8, and walked into what seemed like a packed house. Even as we were taken to our table, I was only able to spot a handful of open seats (and that's including both bar seats and open tables!). One of the only things that I did not enjoy was how it seemed just slightly too overpacked. I would have rather paid an extra $10 on my bill to have more breathing/walking room.   Our waitresses name was Jaclyn, and she is one of the main reasons why we will be coming back regularly! I imagine that all of the wait staff are as attentive and accessible as Jaclyn was. Why else would it stay so packed until closing :)? (Thank you again Jaclyn!)  As for the food, we were given complimentary pita chips and hummus (YUM!). I was in the mood for a pasta dish so I asked for Jaclyn's recommendation. She insisted on the spaghetti and meatballs and her 2nd choice was the bolognese. Me being childish, I chose the bolognese because it sounds like bologna and she said the noodles are ribbon noodles. My stunning date ordered the mussels and the beet salad.   "The beet salad was not worth it at all. The ratio of beets to arugula was like 10:1, the plating was lackluster, AND the portion size left a lot to be desired....shame" -K Rose  Shortly after my bolognese was brought to table (very quickly I might add), I though it tasted pretty good. Then Jaclyn, without any request from us, brought a decent sized sample of what I missed out on from the meatballs. OH MY GOODNESS, IT WAS EASILY THE BEST MEATBALL I HAVE EVER HAD...(secretly I was a little sour about it because I was stuck with bolognese and was wishing I had ordered the meatballs)  All in all, this was a fine 5 star dining experience. The wait staff was great, the environment was electric, and the food was top notch. I highly recommend you try this place, and please don't make my mistakes... get the meatballs!

rIHlCU4cbwXVWIrznoh6ow.text: Superb  service, food, and atmosphere. Highly recommend for special occasions. Truly a 5 star. The drinks are excellent also. Don't expect a bargain, you will pay for what you receive, which is truly excellent.

IxWicqugZEq2AJCstc-dXA.text: Woke up pinching myself making sure last night was not just a dream. Nope. It wasn't. Just a magical dinner at Tarbell's with unparalleled service from Eric and Modesto.  We had dinner reservations at Tarbell's and decided to just eat small and save room for some downtown Phoenix bar hopping.  However, Tarbell's made that difficult because everything on the menu looked completely jaw dropping incredible. We ordered the 'Mr.Fish of the moment' *drool* we were also able to try the calamari which was fresh and not overly seasoned so the flavor bursted with the salsa verde.  For dessert I HAD to try the cheesecake with rosemary caramel. The hint of rosemary balanced out the sweet caramel and the delicious heaviness of the BEST cheesecake my tastebuds have ever been gifted of trying. I will dream of that cheesecake for years.  Thank you so kindly to Eric for making my birthday dinner special and overal, memorable!

pXSNS5yr-B708vub4jlv-Q.text: Dinner on Sunday PM celebrating Mothers Day and a birthday.  Seated almost right away.   Everything was perfect:     Timing and flow of the meal (I hate to be rushed).      Wine list was interesting and had some relative values.    Food was excellent (lots of flavor, not too rich)    Polite and genuine staff.    Even the two valets who stayed late just for us  What else to say?  Yes, it is on the higher $ side but totally worth it.

5GcAXTfLgi9_I9WTJ7N_Gw.text: The beef carpaccio was delicious & a good size to share. The gnocchi with lamb ragu was tasty as was the Fish Chowda. Would return to this restaurant

dFdOgUYvmnTtuXiVeCZSBQ.text: Absolutely amazing from start to finish. The staff is friendly and helpful, the food is superb, and good god is the cheesecake delicious. I think I found a new favorite restaurant.

ZDllJosxgCL2dbizQ_oR6Q.text: I had heard about this restaurant several times from my fiance and his parents. They live in the Phoenix area and have dined here many times. They always talk about the excellent treatment that they receive from the manager, the servers, and the bartender. We were in the Phoenix area for my fiance's birthday and he decided to spend his birthday night dining at Tarbell's. We had made a reservation prior to coming. When we got there, we were a little bit early for a reservation so we decided to enjoy some cocktails and appetizers at the bar until our table was ready. The bartender was incredible at explaining all the different kinds of bourbons that they had and the distilleries they came from to my fiance and his dad because they love bourbon. I also enjoyed a delicious vodka martini. They brought a few different appetizers and even brought out a complimentary dish for us! I ordered the salmon when we finally got to our table, and of course my fiance and his parents got the steak. The steak is really what the restaurant is known for. They had a great menu as well. My salmon was delicious. My fiance enjoyed his steak but later on felt sick because there was a lot of black peppercorn on the steak that didn't really sit well with him. I have noticed that a lot of fine dining - steak restaurants, they often season their steaks a bit too much for our taste. Our server-Alan was spectacular! They brought out a complimentary birthday dessert for my fiance which was nice. The prices are high, but it is a fancier - upscale restaurant where people dress up and enjoy the fine dining. There is a parking lot outside that is pretty spacious. Overall, I would recommend going here for the food and the environment.

photos.caption: Photo of Tarbell's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Make a wish!

J1PMtaR8-o-JvgbBTmFySQ.text: Grading on a high curve of price and expectations, I give it a "ok" rating.   They are obviously using the highest quality ingredients, and have a great selection. I wanted to love it. My husband and I had the rare occasion to have a babysitter. Perhaps my expectations were too high...   I'll just jump right to the end of the story and tell you,... my lobster gnocchi was shockingly over-salted. My preference typically veers towards overly-salted anyway! How could this be? It could have met my high expectations if not for this. Fluffy little gnocchi, light and balanced sauce, fresh hunks of lobster ocean goodness. We also tried the popular desserts - cheesecake and profiteroles. I love cheesecake but this version got rid of the parts I like best - the graham cracker crust was just a sliver of mostly soft crumbs, and the texture of the rest was less soft melty goodness but rather edging towards flan.  On the good end of the spectrum, my husband's ribbon pasta with chicken fennel sausage was also slightly salty but with outstanding flavor. I get why it has such high reviews. I'd go back just for that. Our Nashville-night-special fried pickles were, as I was hoping they would be, the perfect upscale version of one of my guilty food pleasures.   I left with the hope to go back someday but it may be half a lifetime before I decide to work it back in for another try.   *sigh*

p9EekuwMFkP8WBTIa6uFzw.text: Excellent service and very delicious food!!   I came here with clients while I was in Arizona for business and absolutely loved this restaurant. Our waiter was so kind and accommodating! We had 2 guests that were vegan and gluten free and our waiter did everything he could to make sure there was plenty of food for everyone! Great Italian restaurant and am looking forward to coming back next year!

cs6DN-XJKSnKU7423pzRAw.text: Last night was our first visit to Tarbell's. It was the best meal we have had in a restaurant in a very long time. Our server Kelly made the night very special as it was my birthday. We had Alaskan halibut and scotch beef for our entrees. They were both exceptional! Our desserts were fantastic. I wish there were more stars I could add because this place really deserves that.

xlmUxSyDBbrI4Kl9CdhYIg.text: My roommate had a gift card to this Italian restaurant. Someone told her it was the best Italian food in Phoenix, what a lie that was. Their was a fly in my water, the food had no flavor, the service was crap, and the list goes on. Hell oreganos is better than this place, and Tarbell's is a so called higher end restaurant.

42qCF1G9Qd-5CcLBaaRzfQ.text: I've had Tarbell's bookmarked for as long as I can remember-- I'd heard and read about local chef celebrity Mark Tarbell's 2007 Iron Chef America victory over Chef Cat Cora, so it's been a wait of ten years! A friend and I just finished a lovely bottle of white with charcuterie from a wine bar nearby and wanted dessert, so we both checked our Yelp apps for bookmarks and Tarbell's came up. Turns out he's never been to Tarbell's either, has never even heard of the restaurant, and all it took were photos of a cheesecake and profiteroles and the decision was made-- my wait was over! I had no idea that it's so lovely indoors! We walked through the entrance to find a crescent-shaped bar in the middle of the restaurant, with an open kitchen behind it and a few tables lining the walls to the left and right of the bar. There were colorful abstracts under subdued lighting on the walls, and I appreciated that it wasn't very dark inside. (I'm not a fan of dark interiors kept dark to induce low inhibitions. Part of the magic of dining out for me is the plating of the food, as well as the use of colors and textures to create beautiful ambience.) Tarbell's is intimate and has a lively energy, as well. And there's no doubt that the bar is center stage and the place to be, at least for dessert and cocktails! I hadn't planned on having any more to drink besides water, since we already had cocktails elsewhere, but a man sitting to our left offered to buy us a round, but with his choices of alcohol. (He'd heard me nix the whiskey sauce on one of the desserts we'd chosen, so he instructed bartender Mikey not to give me anything corn-based.) Turns out he's a liquor supplier of Tarbell's, or something- hey, I was buzzed and busy taking a photos of the orange hippo sitting on top of the coffee machine and our gorgeous desserts! yelp.com/user_local_phot... I didn't enjoy the gin-based mojito drink I was given, but I thank you for your generosity, anyway! Friend enjoyed his twist on an Old-fashioned and Sazerac. But what about dessert? We couldn't decide on profiteroles or bread pudding, so bartender Mikey said he could give us half of each; an order of profiteroles includes two pieces, so we were given one. yelp.com/user_local_phot... The profiterole turned out to be massive! I've had them before from different places, and the standard sizing is much smaller. Not here, and it came with vanilla gelato and delicious chocolate ganache. I didn't get to inspect the gelato or even get the chance to ask for more ganache, because my friend pretty much inhaled most of the dish (and I can't blame him!). The bread pudding was the complete opposite of the profiterole. Granted, it's half the size of a normal serving, but was it TINY! If I weren't allergic to the pecans I didn't know were included, I might've cared, but I enjoyed the two bites I had, and really, it was the salted caramel sauce that made this dessert shine. yelp.com/user_local_phot... I definitely want to return to try some apps, an entree (or three!), and perhaps the Apple Crisp soon!

rcTwMRuH9bKF0XFqohNhOA.text: Came here on the recommendation of how fresh and yummy the food is and was completely caught off guard by the spectacular scotch (and whiskey) offering.    Yes the food is fantastic; I can't believe I ordered beets... Wait! I can't believe I devoured every morsel of beets.  The daily catch and lobster gnocci were quite nice as well.    BTW, Tessie made my experience all the more special.  She provided superb menu recommendations and even though I don't think we'd ever met before, she made me feel like family.  Thanks Tessie!  Also, I'd like to thank Stephen for coming over and chatting with me about whiskeys

jMTilA6tQw00H2bBzcLiGQ.text: Great restaurant with amazing food. Tarbell is the man. The steak I had for my birthday dinner was perfect. The Chicken I had the time before was also incredible. They do a great job with wine pairings. The quality of the ingredients and detail to each dish is noticed and greatly appreciated. This is how a restaurant should be. Tarbell sets the standard for what every great restaurant should strive to be.

RGtNprfLhm654seQOMj3rg.text: This place just never disappoints! My wife had the Bolognese and I had the halibut and they were exceptional. But there is another hidden gem as well! Kyrri is this so me and even if you don't drink wine you should ask for suggestions... She loves what she does, is energetic and just does a fantastic job. We cannot recommend her enough! Everything she has ever offered has been spot on.

photos.caption: Photo of Tarbell's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The halibut special
Photo of Tarbell's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. My wife says this is the best Bolognese ever

_QWzVAuxYw1bqqfqhbFeZw.text: An illusion that somehow falls under the radar posing as quality but in reality falling short of even mediocrity.  I was looking for the perfect spot for us to check out while we were in Phoenix and figured yelp can't be wrong! Almost 5 stars - I was sure this would not disappoint! After all how can 300 reviews be off.  --The AMBIENCE Really nice and appreciated the lighting. Unfortunately there was a table of 4 men near us who were so loud that I could barely hear the person across from my very own table! The crowd skews a lot older - 60+   --The FOOD  Hamachi crudo I saw beautiful pictures of this and instead got mediocrity at best - soggy and sad looking. I would never ever order this again. Least the presentation was semi pleasant to look at.  Warm "Bacon Candy" with Frisee, Radicchio, Soft Poached Egg I'm not really sure why you need to sous vide an egg... the dish didn't make much sense to me because you have a lot of salad and just one eggs... it should have been a smaller portion salad, the bacon should have been chopped up and mixed with the salad. Instead you get one bite of egg, spending 5 minutes trying to grapple with cutting the bacon. The flavors make sense just not the final dish! Least there was an attempt here sort of...  Housemade Burrata with McClendon's Farm Tomatoes This is the saddest excuse for a buratta I have ever tried anywhere!! The inside of a buratta is supposed to be creamy and open to up as you cut it! This... was cold and as you open it you get farmers cheese! What the heck is this... we didn't send this back but I stopped eating after one bite - this was a sad excuse for trying to cook!  Octopus ravioli So this came out cold. The dough of the ravioli was disgusting - too thick and cold! I have never sent a dish back in all my years of dining but I was not going to pay almost $40 for cold ravioli!! What a disgrace! It's almost as if someone left them out sitting and the waiter was too busy to get them and like 10 min went by before they were served. They gave us 2 apps to apologize but even the apps were terrible. Also the 2 apps they gave us were shishito peppers that were not charred enough and greasy while the cauliflower app was so dry it was like crackers with random pieces of carrot on top... why??   --ChaChing I cannot believe how pricy this place is and that people actually pay this!! Like why? Is it location? This place is a complete rip off!!  --The LETdown I wouldn't send my worst enemy here! The food was pitiful, the price a joke and it just made no sense. I will never go here again and hope the food gets better. I should have known it was a red flag when they have so many types of cuisine on the menu! Why the heck do you have hummus as a starter? What does that have to do with anything? Get your stuff together! This restaurant has an identity crisis and I hope people start realizing this. I bet this place has regulars that come here often but how can they be so blind to the quality and price they are paying. Please please proceed with caution!  --The SERVICE Our waiter was pretty attentive even though it seemed like he had a lot of people to cover tonight. He was considerate when we had to send a dish back and very flexible. I was a little annoyed that the waiter kept pushing the most expensive dishes repeatedly - don't appreciate that!

t2REzQlnfij4lGQjSouvJw.text: We were invited to have dinner at Tarbell's by some friends who were in town for a weekend getaway. The restaurant was highly recommended to them by Geoffrey (The Concierge at the Biltmore where they were staying!).  Pre-dinner drinks at the bar (we were early) were nice with a very generous pour of Crown Royal from the bartender for me and a wonderful glass of Pinot Grigio for my wife! The atmosphere is relaxed and casual but leave your t-shirts and tennis shoes at home!   Once at our table, our waitress Wednesday was very helpful in making suggestions about food choices. The Butternut Squash Soup was excellent. Our food choices included; Scallops (excellent), Salmon (good), Chicken(Excellent) and the Fresh Mozzarella plate. In addition, Wednesday brought us over a few other dishes (on the house) for us to sample. Mac and Cheese and Brussels Sprouts. Now I love Brussels Sprouts anyway but these were to die for and while Mac/Cheese has never been one my favorites - YUM. Oh and the yellow beet salad was very pleasant departure from the typical salad.  Desserts here are for sharing and while the Creme Brulee was OK, the Southern Bread Pudding with Bourbon Sauce was excellent!  While we were eating Mark Tarbell did wander in and he made a point to visit every table and have a quick chat with all the diners that evening. An added bonus was meeting Geoffrey (who was picking up dinner to take home) and he insisted (that even though we were eating sweet stuff now) we try one of the meatballs that Tarbell's makes for their spaghetti and meatballs dish. Wow, that was excellent! I now know what I will be ordering next time we come here for an evening out.  I wouldn't say that this is a romantic place to dine at as the noise level did increase as more people arrived but, it is a great place to come for a meal. All in all this was a really nice dinner out and we'll have to treat ourselves to another visit in the future.

tofUSwlAjIln-n1K9VsylQ.text: Tarbell's is a Phoenix legend on Camelback.  We joined an out of town couple for a friend's dinner.  Friend remarked that it was the best meal she had experienced in Phoenix. As they are annual snowbirds, that's quite some compliment!  Service was extraordinary and attentive without being overbearing.  You can't go wrong with Tarbell's!

shVJZkCM1CTm1d75I55b5Q.text: I first experienced Tarbell's back in 2005 and wanted to come back this year to see if it maintained its high quality of food and service. Tarbell's did not disappoint.   Tarbell offered a wide selection of wines and we got what we wanted. I had the iron cast steak which was delicious. I think I'd the pork chops back in 2005 and suggested one of my buddies to order it. I was fortunate enough to had a piece at medium rare and it was great! My two other friends had the ribeye and fish and both were up to par.   Tarbell's is one of my favorite restaurants in the greater Phoenix area. I will definitely come back here. I also thought the prices were fair. The service was also exceptional. No complaints here.

FgYFlfkvn8-bIqUENDyupA.text: This is a new Phoenix favorite for us...from the lively bar area, to the stand-out food, to the attentive service.  I was thoroughly impressed and we'll definitely be back!  There's valet parking but you really don't need to bother.  The plaza lot out front has ample parking and you're just steps from the entrance.

tq68MH3b4r0WQO1SPS0xHw.text: We are totally impressed with this restaurant!  The service is amazing...I look for great service since we eat out often. Every waiter that we have had has been exceptional. The food was prepared perfectly, unique and unusual....a total treat.

XNBWDSoC7DN7dvlJFPcTZg.text: After reading yelp reviews for over an hour, I  found this restaurant whose chef happened to beat Cat Cora in Iron Chef, I had to try it.  We passed by it earlier when driving and the strip mall is nothing to write home about.  In fact, it looks very 1970's.    I never thought there would be such a good restaurant in this mall.  The service is absolutely OUTSTANDING!  The water glasses never were more than half empty, food came out quickly (not pushy quickly), and the waitress did an AWESOME job describing the dishes.  She clearly is a foodie.  Being a foodie myself, I like hearing people describe food very expressively.    Wine - fantastic wine list!  We were looking at wines and the waitress recommended one which was fantastic.- Carpaccio - good and alot of it.  (it was a bit heavy on the salt and I love salt).  Mussels - you get a ton of them but the flavor wasn't as flavorful as I would have expected. The chicken sausage w/tomatoes, fresh pasta ribbons in a parmesean broth - EXCELLENT!   Bread - excellent.    My expectations were that of a 5 star restaurant, the experience was 5 stars, food 4 (only because of being an Iron Chef winner).    Menu is well rounded and offers many differen options - all farm fresh.

Mrp5Lxpd1vZmlSj1Yqbzzw.text: What an amazing culinary experience. Our server allowed us ample time to explore the menu while sampling a delicious Cabernet. To snack we enjoyed roasted chick peas in Parmesan cheese. Afterwards, we decided on the scallops and sword fish. Fresh, fresh and fresh. Also tender and buttery. Fantastic and full of so many flavors.

Drtc6oUPT7IS-um1fSVH_Q.text: Possibly the best kept secret of Phoenix! With a somewhat smaller dining area as opposed to chain restaurants, this unique, upscale, fine dining establishment earns its keep on quality service to customers, not quantity of throughput.  It is a higher end restaurant, so if you expect that, then you won't get sticker shock.  Compared to other higher end fine dining, it's actually very reasonable with appetizers in the $20s and main courses in the $30s. We had a reservation through Yelp, so my table was ready when I arrived, which is always nice.  Also, there is valet parking service since the parking lot can be crowded, but I found a spot without a problem before I saw the valets.  We started our meal with the hamachi crudo appetizer, which was delicious! I don't know how they get such fresh fish in Arizona, but whatever they're doing is working! The service staff was very attentive and on their game, pulling plates as soon as we finished and bringing out the huge Diver Scallops next.  Again, it was absolutely scrumptious! My mouth is now watering just remembering how perfectly prepared it was. For the main course I enjoyed the delectable AZ honey glazed Scottish salmon with curried potato cake and a side of kale greens.  The salmon was perfectly prepared, and went very well with the sides and glaze.  The potato cake was delicious as well, but the kale really surprised me by how well prepared it was.  I wish I could get the chef's recipe because I've never been able to get kale to taste so good!  Finally, I finished the night with the apple puff pastry, which has flavors reminiscent of a country apple pie your grandma might have baked, but completely inside of a flaky pastry.  If you're looking for a classy, quiet restaurant with an amazing menu perfectly prepared and served to entertain an important client, take that special someone out, or just treat yourself, then look no further! I highly recommend this place, and can't wait to go back.

6r_HfuU8EHB6z0eLqMikUA.text: Very good service, the staff were very helpful and there for your needs. Great selection of meals prepared by the chef. Good range of scrotch whisky. I would definitely would love to come back. Put this on your list to visit.

CQbU3zgjFXS_sLBKixXPMQ.text: The atmosphere is very nice..w/the center stage being the semi circular bar. The lobster risotto was delicious.  They serve these dried out chick peas (management needs to get rid of this item) at the beginning, have them replace it w/some warm bread and olive oil.  Everything is ala cart, so prepare to spend some dollars at this restaurant. But, overall very nice experience with an attentive wait staff.

CIvQQxnQHd2P6r0iUT8liQ.text: The food is amazing, the service great...but the portions left us hungry :( we ate a pizza after. Wasn't as good but definitely more filling.

p78uGZFN4fpmwV4Xnvdc3g.text: Amazing. Fine dining Italian. They let you do half dishes!! Bartender was super friendly and made me a perfect negroni on a big cube. Loved every single thing I tasted. The scallops were so rich I wanted to get up and dance on the spot. They served us well after close as we got there about 15 minutes prior and they were super cool. Loved everything not one thing was off. Well rounded. Great place. Already getting cravings to go back...

pWf5z1gNbC-qcgJEoeLWVQ.text: 4 stars for the food 2 stars for the service.  The food was good and the muscles were fantastic; however, our server for such a nice restaurant left a lot to be desired.  We will probably go back again I just hope the service is much improved.

uyj8b74mycuB-M6mxVQMyg.text: We ended up at Tarbell's for our anniversary dinner after reading poor Yelp reviews of the resort restaurant we were going to try. I'm so happy we were able to get in!! We had a wonderful meal and the service was excellent!   I would recommend Tarbell's to anyone looking for a delicious meal.

gEWBdtADAvwnL07EuvjnUA.text: Where in the world do you get purple kale?!! I love kale and having to say that I love love love the purple kale.  It's so good that I didn't even need the dressing.  I wish it would come in a big bowl, because I can eat it all day long.   "The earth's best" was AMAZING!!  For people are not vegetarian they would want to be after this plate.   All the different mix of vegetable were perfectly contrast each other.

wBoal-M58ARGwpQeB5yNyg.text: Alright, so I went to this place with very high hopes. Yelpers raving about it, the place has all these awards, magazines are talking about it, there's an iron chef challenger/winner here, etc etc. With all the hype, I was a bit cautious, but still expecting to get my socks completely blown off. Was it a disappointment? I wouldn't go that far, the place is good. Service is awesome, food is high quality. But, it just isn't as great as what people will want you to think.   Like most of my foodie adventures with friends, we all had a cocktail. They were all good, and we sampled a large selection. I don't think anything from this bar would disappoint.   For food, we started with the crispy white beans. Very different, and that's why we got them. I still don't have a solid opinion on them, but they're strangely addicting. Salty, oily, cheesy, thyme-y. Give 'em a try, at least you can say you did. We also had the onion straws with Tarbell's "Secret Sauce." These are good, I'd recommend them for a group appetizer, but just nothing that spectacular.  For the entree, obviously I had to try the scotch beef. This was pretty good. The gravy was amazing. The beef itself, though, is just a roast. I've had the same thing a thousand times at home. My mom could rival Mr. Tarbell's famous scotch beef anyday with a slow cooked roast, and she's no iron chef. Still, it was good and I would get it again. Tender, juicy, flavorful. The potatoes it sat on were good, too, but really the special part is the gravy.  Others at the table had salmon and the house ribbon pasta. Salmon was good, nothing out of this world. The pasta was also not super impressive, just nice, good quality food.  We couldn't resist dessert and got the chocolate cake with pistachio ice cream. This was truly awesome. Creme brulee was also really quite good.   This review wouldn't be complete without mentioning the service and the atmosphere. This place really does a good job taking care of people. The server we had was amazing and all of the staff was super attentive. They know the menu, give good suggestions, and truly make you feel like a guest. This goes a long way nowadays in restaurants and in my opinion this alone gives them an extra star.  Speaking of stars, this place is really good. In no way does it deserve a 5-star review. 4 stars, sure, but they aren't getting it on food alone.

GtHGOlo4_M37ag6TUB0D7A.text: I reserved for a birthday date and the staff were very accommodating to my request and friendly. I love the staff, wish every restaurant was as professional and courteous as Tarbell's. I will certainly use this place for special occasions and a dinner night out.   One thing I almost forgot to mention, I ordered a special they had that day and there was an issue with the food that I wont say but again the manager came out personally and apologized for the mistake after I reordered  and actually took that item out of our dinner bill. And I have to say that was a very expensive meal and I was really impressed with the service. Thank you Tarbell

K3fHVSAcDRSmkzI4rtW27w.text: Ambience is energetic, hip and upscale. Food was excellent; I had a pizza from their brick oven. Just as good as Cibos, in my opinion.   The menu covers the gamut of tastes: seafood, beef, vegetarian... But doesn't show much creativity as compared to Citizen's Public House.  Service was impeccable and the kitchen was lightning fast. I'd definitely go here again without hesitation.  This isn't your sit and have a long drawn out meal where you're chatting and snaking for an hour or two. This is a quick, fun, energetic place to enjoy dinner before going to your next adventure.

479tPRLrh4q_EDqBu8Hrjg.text: My friend highly recommended the Cheesecake with Rosemary-Caramel sauce, so tonight because I was working late, I decided on a whim to call ahead and order some to take back to the office.  Over the phone they seemed to enjoy hearing that their cheesecake came so highly recommended (I don't think they are used to getting orders for just dessert). When I showed up to pick it up, the manager walked up and greeted me himself. He told me he was very happy that I came all the way there just for the cheesecake. He then discounted my order as an "Early Christmas Present". I was taken aback.  The cheesecake itself was amazing. They left the sauce on the side so it didn't get messy during travel. Consequently, I was to drizzle a little bit over each bite. The combination of the creamy cheesecake and the rich sauce was perfect. I recommend it to anyone and everyone.  I'll definitely be eating at Tarbell's for more than just dessert in the future. And although I can't tell you much about the atmosphere or the dining experience (yet) since I ordered to go, I can tell you that the manager there was extremely nice and everyone else I interacted with over the phone and in person was also wonderful.

CYKj4w5bdOHNv74Yv54qUA.text: Our first time at Tarbells was great! We happened upon the restaurant by luck after we were dismayed from the crowds/long wait at postino and LGO. Without reading a review,  we chose this place out of sheer hunger.   Our menu: Fish of the day - flute. A nice white fish dish,  good flavor,  just not quite enough flavor for the price.  House made ribbon pasta with sausage - delicious! Amazing flavor in the sauce,  perfect pasta,  tasty sausage.  Creme brulee - delicious!  Great portion to split between two or three. The hive (cocktail) - wonderful!  High end bourbon with rosemary and honey,  great combination.   Service: Our server was Martin - he was awesome.  Very attentive and showed up at all the right moments,  but not overbearing.    Cherry on the top - as we were leaving,  we were given little bags of popcorn!!! What!? Only because I'm a popcorn lover was this so impactful, but this little treat just tipped the experience from great to awesome!   Obviously if you're researching the restaurant you know it is on the pricey side. (Since we hungrily stumbled in,  we had no idea). But we were quite pleased with our experience and will be back again!

v72XVwXRoMOUPQmRbGMcYQ.text: We had the absolute best time at Tarbells! I have been wanting to try this restaurant for a long time and I'm happy I finally had a chance to!  The roasted golden beets salad was really good! The fresh herb dressing was really unique and complimented the tastes with the grapefruit and the golden beets!  The house main ribbon pasta was in a really light broth sauce and had a homemade chicken sausage with it! The sausages and a lot of great flavor!

H91YV2JExWn_zy4-_IonHg.text: What a great experience. We went to celebrate a birthday and had a great time   The service was excellent. The only downside is the parking. The hint of rosemary in the caramel sauce was so delicate and the cheesecake so smooth. It was heaven to eat.   I am going back.

whcm1tqI2yF5XdPoaFArJA.text: I have always loved coming to Tarbell's ! The friendly service and comfortable  Atmosphere is very inviting. My favorite is steak and a cold beer ! Or Pasta night at Tarbell's is a family Favorite  Will be back soon

ER797pW13Dim9eRfA-HS8w.text: Nice atmosphere, server was wonderful, and the chicken was delicious. Overall, this was a great evening and it was packed on a Tuesday night. The food, ice tea, and the four spreads with the bread was awesome.  I love trying new places in different cities and this did not disappoint!

6LINIR39S75WGU2miu2XVw.text: After deciding that we needed some delicious food and drink, we settled on Tarbell's. Looking for a more relaxed experience so we elected to dine at the bar. We were immediately greeted and drinks came in a flash. Our server, Talia, was amazing. Super attentive and had some amazing suggestions. We ordered the pizza of her choice as wasn't disappointed. After raving about the cocktails, she briefly introduced us to the Head drink curator and he took some time to answer our questions about the drink menu. The food was amazing and the service matched. It was a wonderful experience. We will be back!!

78_l7ROG6sFlb-kdrw-IzA.text: Great place!  Great wine list with even better prices!  First class service!

wSx_gkC3c7qzna5H_1ew-Q.text: My family of 8 celebrated my wife's birthday this evening! The food was Amazing and spectacular! It's a modern twist on food, a new taste and you feel special receding the food as it's out of this world! Their service is a 10 Star, the food quality is a 10 star and the ambiance is great, intimate yet fun and exciting! Mark Tarbell the owner has a great following and he's amazing as Preparing Food! He's one of the best if not the best Chef in all of Arizona!  This is perfect for a famiky gathering, entertaining clients, a date night or taking out the entire family.

Ii3PpSRpD4n9-RTa-cmjYw.text: For my mom's birthday, we made a reservation on opentable for dinner at 6:30 on a Friday night. We arrived about ten minutes early and were seated right away. Parking can be a tad bit difficult, but there is the option to valet the car if there aren't any open parking spots.  The restaurant itself looks fancy, but upon sitting down, I noticed that the tables are pretty close together, which makes the atmosphere seem loud and crowded.  While we were looking at the menu, we were brought out bread with four different toppings. The bread was warm and the hummus was an interesting option to eat with the bread.  My mother and I both ordered the seasonal chowda' and it was delicious! The fish was well-cooked, the mussels were delicious, and the broth was so flavorful. Bread dipped in the broth was such a delight! We also ordered the Brussels sprouts as a side. They were definitely charred, but weren't too flavorful in my opinion. My boyfriend ordered the spaghetti and meatball. The spaghetti was cooked perfectly and the giant meatball was easy to eat and there was no need for a knife! For dessert, we ordered the chocolate cake and the apple and cinnamon cobbler. Both were absolutely delicious and we were so shocked that both desserts were on the house for my mom's birthday! Besides the loud atmosphere, I would definitely recommend this restaurant for a special occasion!

-uii-9uOd4Q9PGtQKTNkiw.text: Absolutely delicious!!! Excellent wine list. I started with the beet salad.  It was amazing. I wanted to lick the plate!  Then I had the mussels. They were soft and succulent. The broth was wonderful and the bread was crusty and delicious. It's pricey but SO worth.

Z-rnWHuTwEERkIPsxmou5Q.text: Truly breaks my heart this visit, I love Mark Tarbell and have an enormous amount of respect for him. I frequent his PBS show and he is a much more charismatic host than the previous Robert McGrath. It was a busy weekend night and our reservation was not quite ready so we had a drink at the bar.  Our table across from the bar was a glorified high top bar table difficult to share large plates. Server was friendly and professional yet seemed to sometimes glance over us when we had noticeably empty plates or water glasses on his voyages past our table. I understand they are busy and it truly has a European dining experience vibe to it because nothing is fast. FOOD.....My mouth was watering for the tuna tartar with deviled egg mousse and avocado, was sad to be informed after we ordered that they are out. So we ordered the calamari which was fantastic, light and crisp with a zesty salsa verde sauce, "pizza of the moment" was very good thin light crust with arugula and I am so sorry I forgot the meat I believe it was chorizo that created a zest. Georges bank scallops were very fresh, parsnip puree was not my favorite but they were so good on their own.  The NOT so good, I admit we were thoroughly confused at the salmon advertised as lime molasses glazed organic greens and a potato cake. In our mind a "potato cake" is a condensed potato dish often in the shape of a hockey puck for lack of better words. The dish arrived with what could only be described as hash browns all over the plate. Yep hash browns covered in salad topped with a salmon. The flavor was lacking in the salmon and quite frankly the "potato cake" tasted like Ore ida potatoes we could have picked up at Safeway. As a side we choose the au gratin potato which I hate to say it was very DISAPPOINTING. The potato had a thin bake on top but when we cut into it we initially thought it was raw, noticing the translucent color of the potatoes but luckily it was cooked it just had ZERO flavor, it was like eating bland mush. The little details were kind of annoying as well, like our server never took our menus including their impressively large wine menu that was nearly the size of our table (we were drinking cocktails that night) I guess it was good we were next to the window we just propped the menus on the sill......maybe our location did have its perks.
