pNELwPF7x5OmTAFEDHMJqQ.text: I have never had this happen before.  My daughter was in town for her and her mom's birthday which are one day apart and I wanted to take the family out for a nice dinner to celebrate.  We hadn't been to Tarbell's in a while so I thought it would be a good choice.  When we got to the restaurant my wife and I both commented that it was nice to see a good crowd with all of the new restaurants out there.  We had a group of 5 and were immediately seated for our 7:30 reservation That's where everything good ended.  Our server had an assistant with her who obviously was in training or something as he was not allowed to speak. As we had a fairly large group and the room was loud I asked him a couple of questions and he stated I needed to talk to the main server.  The server wasn't terrible but she did not seem as engaged and friendly as the service I had received in the past. She seemed a bit flustered and not on her game.  We ordered drinks and apps that seemed to take a little longer than I thought they should but not crazy considering how busy the restaurant was.  We had told the server that we were celebrating two birthdays and she said she would be providing us desert to celebrate.   She then took our dinner and wine orders.  About 15 minutes later she comes back with desert menus. I thought this was a bit odd but I thought maybe she was just trying to stay out in front of things.  About 10 minutes later the deserts that we ordered showed up at the table. Now I'm thinking this is very strange but we sat there to see what was next as we had not been served our entrees yet.  The server never came back to the table.   At this point we are done with this so I told the family to head to the car and I would take care of it.  I sat at the table by myself for another 5 minutes and nobody came by.  I finally got up to head out when I saw the server and a manager at the front desk talking about the situation that they now realized.  At this point I told them that I am going to assume that we are done here and I took my hungry family to another local restaurant.   Mark - I was pleased to see that your long standing restaurant continues to get the crowds but this unfortunate situation really put a damper on our what was supposed to be a family celebration. As you know there are several new options in the area which situations like this will make it difficult to consider your restaurant in the future.

KFCkOE7JeiyTo0nni1EjGg.text: Fun facts: Chef Tarbell was a winner on Iron Chef America and is the host of Check Please on PBS!  We were actually going to go to Vincent's but it turns out they are closed for the week. Since their bistro doesn't take reservations we didn't think to call and didn't realize they were closed until we had pulled into the parking lot and saw the notice on the door. A quick search led us to Tarbell's which I've had bookmarked for some time. So, it was Vincent's loss and Tarbell's gain for not being open this week!  The ambiance here is nice. The bar area looked like a fun place to have a drink and the formal dining area was pleasant with an open airy feel. I love the music they play in here too, a mix of some classic rock hits from artists like Queen and Guns & Roses.  The menu is one page and has a diverse selection to please many dining here. The items ranged from the more casual such as pizza, to surf and turf tenderloin with Jonah crab, and had a vegetarian selection "prepared with the utmost care and delight". Sounds very delightful for sure! The top of the menu also notes that they will try to accommodate any special requests guests may have.  There is also an extensive wine menu, and I love the fact that the wine menu is made out of cork. Such a creative touch!  I had the following:   Complimentary hummus and pita chips- The hummus had a strong cumin flavor. I like cumin, but it was spice overload for me. The pita chips were light and crisp, with a mix of cheese coated ones and regular plain. I do appreciate that it was a more unique complimentary starter compared to other restaurants that serve rolls or bread, as well as appreciation for the fact that it's free.  Watermelon berry gazpacho- There was something about the flavor that didn't quite sit well with me. For me I think it was the vinegar in the gazpacho, which drowned out the more crisp refreshing flavors of the berry and watermelon. It felt like I was sipping a thicker version of some cranberry-pear balsamic vinegar I used recently at home. I did like the little punch of spiciness from the inclusion of some chile in the soup though.  Beef carpaccio- The presentation was beautiful, with very thinly sliced beef, peppery arugula and a generous portion of shaved cheese. I enjoyed the combination of flavors for the most part but I didn't care for the thick flakes of salt in the dish since I'd get an occasional hit of pure salt granules while eating.  Halibut with scallop creme and charred tomato relish- the halibut was cooked perfectly, with a crispy nicely browned exterior and very tender flaky interior. The relish and scallop creme combined beautifully with the fish in flavors and textures. The only negative about the dish was that some of the really blackened charred bits from the tomato weren't fully removed so I got some pieces of crunchy bitter charred carbon in some bites.   Profiteroles- We split these and got one each on a plate. The two profiteroles are huge! The vanilla gelato was lightly sweet and delicious sandwiched in between the choux pastry. The chocolate ganache blanketed on top of the whole dessert was rich and decadent.   Service was good. Plates were taken away as needed and water was refilled constantly.  As we were about to leave the lovely hostess gave us each a cute little mini brownie to take home. Very nice!

photos.caption: Photo of Tarbell's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mini brownies for us to take home!
Photo of Tarbell's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Profiteroles (2 of 2)
Photo of Tarbell's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Profiteroles (1 of 2)

u0RPqdKigNRibTXFb-M_Ig.text: Tarbells is a lovely upscale restaurant. My family and I really pigged out today, we ordered a cheese pizza and the baked chickpeas as an appetizer. As my main course I ordered the roasted chicken (in the picture below). The chicken was fantastic, I would highly recommend it (it takes 4 days for them to make)! My family also enjoyed their meals. My only issue was the dessert menu, they didn't have a classic dessert like cookies, brownies, molten cake, etc. And as we left they handed us small brownies instead of mints, I wish they would have put that brownie on the menu instead.   **As a side note, the service was fantastic! Our server was super helpful, nice, and funny.

photos.caption: Photo of Tarbell's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Roasted Chicken

VRyiMdxTBGY6ZildDY9u_Q.text: It's obvious that the menu is carefully planned and tuned however that is where the nice experience ends.  We have been a couple of times hoping that it would get better but each time it was just worse than the last. Even though we have a reservation each time we still end up having to wait.  Per the front of house staffs suggestion we have each time gone to the already overcrowded (directly by the front door) bar and ordered a drink from the overworked bartenders.    This past experience included a server and server in training and the two were OBVIOUSLY not getting along so I basically paid a lot of money to be made to feel awkward by the staff.  The pizza appetizer was okay but the Scotch beef was excellent in all fairness.    The clincher on why this time was the last...  Not once but twice there were patrons that went out on the porch and were smoking and OF COURSE this wafts into the restaurant.  The first time the staff did nothing for so long that a bar patron got up and actually asked the men to move.  They moved, wasn't that hard.  The second time the staff notified the manager by pointing at the man smoking right outside the door and he waved them away and walked away, doing nothing.  Even the bartenders were complaining loudly enough that I could hear them from my table.  So we all just sat in his smoke smell ruining any flavor the food probably did have.    Disgusting. `

pMNQjMQnOh8wUsa4w9N9XA.text: I had a Magnificent Mother's Day dinner at Tarbell's  My son and I started with their fantastic Caesar salad (which they were more than happy to split for us). In fact, the chefs will create anything for you, and the service is impeccable! Everyone is so warm and relaxed. They make you feel right at home as you experience the elegance and evidence of a restaurant owned and operated by an Iron Chef America Champion and all of the national awards. Choosing a wine is effortless since Mark Tarbell is a wine connoisseur (has a wine store next door, writes a wine column) and has the perfect pairings or suggestions.  The Gnocchi with Lobster is spectacular! It had the freshest, sweetest tomatoes cooked to perfection, just like the gnocchi & lobster, in a light creamy sauce.   Their Creme Brulee is exquisitely smooth with the perfect amount of vanilla, a flawless layer of caramelized sugar, and big fresh berries.   I also have to mention their special touches, like their housemade Tahini cumin hummus and chips, when we were seated, and the individually wrapped lemon cookies as we left. Our friends, who dined there last week, received individually wrapped pieces of banana bread as they left.  Tarbell's is very special and innovative, upscale yet relaxed.

photos.caption: Photo of Tarbell's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Créme Brûlée was so smooth &amp; creamy with just the right amount of vanilla, and the crunch of a generous layer of caramelized sugar.
Photo of Tarbell's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The gnocchi with lobster is so fantastic &amp; tender, the tomatoes are fresh and sweet and the sauce is light and creamy.
Photo of Tarbell's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. This was half of their fantastic Caesar salad. (They were happy to split it for us.)

lnvZx4zHKsVIlU54DSbYjg.text: They were able to accommodate a large party, allowed us to select whatever we wanted from the main menu, allowed us to split the check, allowed me to bring in decorations, and fully helped pull off an epic surprise dinner for a friend. They also were patient and accommodating when it came to food allergies and the needs of each patron I had with me. I had originally planned for 22, but 2 could not make it last minute - 20 people is still a huge crowd and yet the service was flawless. So incredibly grateful for all they did to make this event memorable. I highly recommend this location for any large events you may have.   This was one of the only places that was able to accommodate a large party without requiring a minimum or a rental fee. Thank you so much Tarbell's staff!

photos.caption: Photo of Tarbell's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Allowed me to bring in some other balloons and small decorations.
Photo of Tarbell's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Allowed me bring flowers in for the tables
Photo of Tarbell's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. They helped me set these up and it looked amazing!

KQ3-YZFIS9SNxFTrZGXOOw.text: Living literally right around the corner from Tarbell's - it's astonishing we don't come here more often!  After tonight - we will add them to our 'go-to list' for sure!  We usually eat dinner at the bar - but arriving at 5:30 - the bar was packed on this particular Friday night.  With still some seats available for dinner inside, before the big rush - we opted to sit outside and and enjoy the 70+ degree weather.  Turned out to be a great call.  The hostess who sat us at our cute little table said, 'wow, it's nice and quiet out here..' and even Fernando, our waiter, said, 'it's so nice to be out here!'.  We started with 'brown liquor':  an Old Fashioned and a Manhattan.   Both fantastic.  We checked out the extensive dinner choices ('Seasonal' and 'Non-Seasonal') and couldn't really decide on what to order.  Our attentive waiter offered up the KEY for ordering:  1/2 and shared portions! UNBELIEVABLE!  You have to do it!  We shared Salmon, Alaskan Halibut  and Bolognese for our main dishes. Where can you do that at a nice restaurant - and at a reasonable price!?  Look over their menu - and hear the daily specials, and if you can't decide - no worries - try a few!!  We joked after dinner:  between the cocktail, 3 dishes and the bottle of wine - how can do we rate what was best?  Well, YOU CAN'T!!  Everything was memorable and delicious!  Amazing experience and you must give it a try.  Don't forget our tip - sharing is KEY!  So much fun - such good food!  Cheers!

dP7gQtxJv4o33pW7wz6EkA.text: Eat there a few times recently. Well worth the visit. Pretty good food and friendly staff. You can buy the wine next door at retail prices so you avoid the rip off mark ups. Lunch time was a little more relaxed than the evening. Raw Scallop starter was great. Paella best avoided. Special house tacos well worth tasting. Overall a neat authentic place that has positive friendly vibe. You can even park your car next to your table if you eat outside. But please no rusty junkers...

J3Ay9BMneQwXlNnhXOjf1g.text: We went there last night as my husband had received a gift certificate for his birthday. It was good. We shared the tuna tartar and it was incredible, probably the best part of the meal for sure and one of the best tuna tartare I have ever had. Then I ordered the scallops and my husband some steak with shoestring fries. My scallops were good and my husband's steak was okay but nothing memorable... We had a creme brulee for dessert that was good but the top was a bit too thick and sweet. It was s nice dinner overall, our waiter wasn't the sweetest or friendliest but hey I wasn't there to make friends !  If in the area I would would come back

3aTX1LDrRrQxHxX3F8oYNQ.text: The service at Tarbell's is top of the line. Food is great, wine is definitely pricey (I'm more of a 2 buck chuck gall myself). I recommend the Last Word cocktail. Newer cocktail menu, and it's a good one!! I had the golden beet salad and a peppered steak. Both were delicious. When it came time to order dessert, we couldn't decide, and the waiter said "one is on us, just get both!" We did, and I have to say, the chocolate mousse was the standout of the two. It was a tiny bit disappointing when the check came and we were charged for both desserts. No big deal, but I could see another patron being upset. Overall, great food, great service, great atmosphere. Come here to splurge.

pcjmbbhg4c1ojxcikTHJnQ.text: Amazing food and service.    Had the scotch beef, which was extremely tender and flavorful, but next time I'll ask for more gravy.  The scallops are a must-have.  The beet salad is a great value & super full of beets - very tasty.  The flash-fried white bean appetizer is fun, different, and good.  They'll make anything on the menu as a half-order, which is super convenient.  The mini apple dessert which he used on Iron Chef weren't as amazing as hoped.  The bread pudding w/whiskey sauce was excellent.  Will definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Tarbell's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Half order of roasted beet salad with Cabernet aioli. Outstanding flavor and value.
Photo of Tarbell's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Scotch Beef full order. Very tasty but not as interesting or juicy as hoped.
Photo of Tarbell's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sea Scallops. Half order (they&#39;ll do anything on menu except pizzas as half order!) EXCELLENT.

-P3flLG4oBPZzkr9I-Zcsw.text: Great food, service, and cocktails! Has a traditional steak house upscale feel but with a laid back atmosphere. My fiance got the aged steak and loved it and I had the fish of the day. We ordered the Mac and cheese to share. Really really great food! Recommend!

jn6sJjVu6mzKMTq96iBueg.text: Outstanding service and some delicious plates! The ribbon pasta is by far one of my favorite ever!!! So simple yet delightful. Had the left overs this morning with bacon since I finished the chicken sausage last night... Still perfect :) fiance enjoyed his grilled steak-cooked to temperature (medium rare). We ordered shrimp rocks as appetizer and we were impressed! The waiter bought out some cheesy Mac and cheese on the house when our main course came out- which was a nice surprise. Can't forget about the grilled asparagus...gorgeous side to the steak! One of the best restaurant in PHX, should be everyone's next stop :)

photos.caption: Photo of Tarbell's - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Tarbell's - Phoenix, AZ, United States

a1CXFYYffg7urbWqSUIROQ.text: I liked the fact that this was a smaller place, so thus a more intimate dining room, although the tables seemed a bit close. The wait staff was very friendly and mostly attentive although I do feel like other tables got a bit more attention (I think it's because I tend to be a younger diner at these types of establishments, which means I won't order as expensive items or won't tip as much - so wrong, but I digress). The house bread that was served was especially good and served warm - mmm.  Our table ordered mac and cheese and onion strings to share. Both were super delicious, the onion strings came with a phenomenal dipping sauce that I loved. For my entree, I ordered one of the homemade pasta dishes which was very rustic and delicious, although the chicken sausage was a bit heavy handed with the fennel seeds. The others at my table ordered the special of the night that was some sort of fish and polenta that looked great. My fiance ordered the scotch beef which he loved as well.   We also all ordered dessert, carrot cake (meh, I've definitely had better), chocolate mousse (pretty good, but standard), bread pudding with a bourbon sauce (super rich, pretty good), and homemade sorbets (the lemon being the best and very refreshing).   I would say definitely check this place out, especially for special occasions.

photos.caption: Photo of Tarbell's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. House-Made Ribbon Pasta

cVaykqRaWLzWj1cuC9q3IQ.text: The food is outstanding, just had another excellent dinner here two nights ago. The chicken is excellent - so are the shishito peppers, burrata salad, burrata/prosciutto pizza, rock shrimp, scotch beef - literally everything!

nd_td0VFHaBPUkeKm8GbHw.text: We had a fantastic evening at Tarbell's. The atmosphere is lovely, the service terrific and friendly. The beet salad and Caesar salads were excellent. The Mr. Fish of the Day was a Skate and was interesting and unusual and well presented. Their Bolognese (that takes 4 days to make) was the best I have ever had. It is served with fresh homemade flat noodles and was delicious. There is an extensive wine cellar to complete the meal. Prices range from $16-39 per entree and the evening for 2 with a beverage was $90. We highly recommend it and will definitely return.

photos.caption: Photo of Tarbell's - Phoenix, AZ, United States

QqBjuuSxiIvs8X01MJYUBQ.text: I love the atmosphere here.  It is a cute little restaurant with amazing Martini's!  Service is wonderful as well.

MaXfnPQ48w36kTXGc7i09Q.text: I give this place a 3 with the hopes of returning and giving it a 4 or 5.   My wife and i had the spinach dip, bolognese, and a 35 day aged peppercorn steak.  In addition to our order, our server presented us with a complimentary burrata appetizer, as it was our first time to the restaurant. Whole tomatoes are my least favorite vegetable (or fruit, whatever, shut up) I appreciated the gesture and the cheese mixture was quite good.   Spinach dip: not actually a dip, like chips and dip, but I probably would have realized that if I actually read the menu. Its a puff filled with spinach and though unexpected was very good.   Bolognese: I only had a bite but it had good flavor, so I can't comment much more than that.   Steak: they offer steaks either grilled or peppered. Should have gone with my gut and just gotten the grilled steak, but went on a limb for the peppered. I ordered medium rare; in my opinion it was slightly overcooked but I do like steaks quite rare so I didn't complain. The steak itself had great flavor, but delite what the server said it had a much stronger pepper flavor than I was expecting.   In addition to the entrees we had pomme frites (fries) and Brussels sprouts.  The fries were nothing special. They were fried potatoes, as expected. But you can get better fries at any fast food restaurant.   Sprouts: definitely overcooked. They looked almost completely black, basically no green left, little flavor left besides the charring. But, mixed with the sprouts were caramelized white onions which basically saved the dish. Cook them a few minutes less and they would be absolutely terrific.   Overall, I give service 4 stars. Server was knowledgeable but could have been just a tad quicker with drink refills. The ambiance is great, and it may have just been timing but when we pulled up there were 2 Bentley's and a Rolls parked in front (good thing we borrowed the in laws' car so we fit in).   I would return to try the non-peppered grilled steak or the lamb, but for my current visit I would have to give 3 out of 5.  Definitely give it a shot. It was not a bad experience at all

vYbcUdlWKBJW-gF20ayaHg.text: Always a top notch dining experience. Nothing short of perfection. I recommend the burratta for an app. Ask for Eric For great service!

gOKhiigzpieuWgkxI7JKgQ.text: First time.   Overall it was very good.  Creative and tasty.  I had the peppered strip and I ordered it rare plus, but it came out medium plus. No worries. They made another rare plus steak without a word.  Lastly, they did not charge for either steak. It was on the house without a word or a request.  That was a great sign and it allowed for a larger tip.  The staff were great.

9OeX_lruCut7nI_OjT1F7g.text: Our favorite restaurant. The candy bacon salad is a must-have! The Chocolate Mousse was like eating a dream. The BEST! Can't decide what to have? They let you order 1/2 orders!

hdAIySeFVxK1SPdq7SKC3A.text: could be one of the top 5 meals ive ever eaten. started with the octopus appetizer...90% of the time you get octopus its over cooked and rubbery...this place cooked it perfectly..melt in your mouth and the sauces were awesome. i had the pan roasted chicken and it was tremendous..normally i wont eat the skin but it was so perfectly golden brown and crispy i ate it all..wife had the salmon and it was one of the best sauces ive had on seafood...desert we split the sticky date cake with butterscotch sauce...you could put the sauce on a shoe and id eat it...the waiter was great...i couldn't find a flaw with this restaurant...so worth the price

jS0GMtIYP49Mw36pn1RzEA.text: This place is so damn good....it has to be one of the best restaurants in Phoenix. The pizza has a flavorful thin crust and is perfect. There is no reason to not always order the giant meatball on the side. I've been going here for years and am constantly impressed. Everything they do is perfect.

AgchLwpOuPheLSsMjpOaaw.text: My wife and I went here for our 15th Wedding Anniversary dinner. We chose the place specifically because of Mark Tarbell's reputation as a chef.  Everybody makes mistakes. It is how you handle them that shows what kind of a person you are. In the restaurant business, it's that attitude that turns a "we won't be back" into "we'll definitely be back!"  The story:  We arrived for our reservation and were promptly seated. We started with the Kale Chips as a starter, and both quite liked them.  I ordered the scallops and my wife had the halibut special. My wife's was excellent, she was very happy. My scallops were fairly underdone -- cutting into each of them it was clearly raw in the middle. The garnish of pea tendrils and morels was fantastic.  I informed a passing employee (I thought she was a hostess) as our waiter was busy with a large table,  and she agreed with a quite surprised look that they were definitely undercooked.  When I got the plate back, it had been reheated and not refired...I was a little surprised to have them reheated (at $38 a plate) instead of a refire, but they were well cooked now and quite good.  I informed the waiter after I'd finished that the round small potatoes had also been a bit underdone but edible, probably because the garnish was rushed by the undercooked scallops. To be honest, the waiter kind of ignored us a bit after this.  The employee that I'd returned my dinner to came back and apologized again. It turns out she was a manager, and she informed us that she was comping my dinner, as well as two deserts of our choice.  The deserts, by the way, were outstanding! My wife had the creampuffs and I had vanillabean cheesecake with a very unique and tasty rosemary caramel sauce.  After dinner, the owner and Chef, Mark Tarbell came by. He said that mistakes didn't happen often, but that he wanted to make sure it was properly resolved, and he apologized and specifically thanked me for bringing a mistake to his attention.  I said that it had, and I was happy, and my wife specifically told Chef Tarbell how pleased she was with manager's response and attitude.  We'll definitely be back to Tarbell's both because of the food (which was excellent, and that they fixed the error quickly) and the customer service!

7KX2rIS24gHzyFrGL1n26A.text: I truly thought this would be a follow up review. Then I discovered that I never had reviewed one of my favorite neighborhood eats!  Tarbell's is the perfect restaurant for a special location, or if you simply want a bit of joy in your evening.  Menu is varied with appetizer/ side dishes satisfying for a main course also. The carpaccio is the best in the valley, with an original presentation. The waiters allow you to savor a bottle of wine with small pours & frequent attention to the table.   Last night we tried a bacon candy salad. The bacon and radicchio didn't initially appear to match but Beau and I devoured it. Watching the service was impressive as they hustled with completing orders, interacting with the customers or cleaning every component of their area. ( Never will you see a waiter/ bartender checking a phone or texting away. )  Thus, fantastic flavorful dishes. Acoustics pair the happening hum behind the needed intimacy for a conversation. Service is friendly & professional.

HvhvFvNJaQHomFFeRokfVQ.text: When my wife and I chose a date night to treat ourselves and leave the kids with Grandma for a couple hours, we chose a local place that we haven't been to in quite some time (3 years). Now I recall why, and will certainly never dine at TARBELL'S ever again! To our surprise they were celebrating the truffles of Perigord that night. So the truffled risotto with seared medium rare scallops sounded wonderful! Or so we thought! To have the audacity of serving basmati rice in a watery cream sauce and call that risotto is a travesty! And more so, the arrogant 25 year old waiter came over and sliced the truffles over the dish and the perfume was non existent! Meaning the truffles were old and certainly not winter Perigord truffles! Two slices of winter Trufles from Perigord would perfume a 10 foot area in seconds. Hell, summer Oregon truffles would have been 100 times better that the crap they called Truffles from Perigord! It does not matter that I am a graduate of The Culinary Institute of America, class of 1991. How in Gods name can you serve basmati rice in a cream sauce and call it risotto!?!? And when I called the manager over, the little twit tried bluffing me by saying, the Chef ran out of arborio rice and substituted basmati. Really, when there is a Safeway an 1/8 of a mile away, you couldn't find any bloody arborio rice??? So, it is extremely sad that Mark Tarbell and his bullshit James Beard award can call himself a Chef when what I just detailed is his fingerprint for "fine dining" in Phoenix. ZERO stars is more applicable!

U9gdMyp6_-qX1z2uLrocSw.text: The food was absolutely delicious. I recommend the Ahi Tuna Crudo App, Bay Scallops entree, and Salted Carmel Apple Crumble dessert. All around a great dining experience and I'd go back for sure next time I'm in town.

3ZiuLNhqzjRUy-kosCGxkw.text: Came here for an anniversary as it was one of the top 10 Zagat rated spots a few years ago.  While the food quality did meet the price mark, I was sort of disappointed with the Ravioli and Oysters. We got a 1 foot long dish with 3 oysters on it. 3 is not divisible by two. So, they could add one more and make everyone happy.  However, the cocktails and the wine selection were good and the food was definitely savory. Service was great as well. Come well dressed or you will look bad.

FixjwBOmeM-LSh9FZJ4DsQ.text: My mother, sister and I had dinner here recently while out celebrating Mother's Day together. It was a truly fantastic night.   My mom ordered the House-Made Ribbon Pasta. It was truly phenomenal. The sauce was out of this world. I could have spent hours eating just that with a loaf of bread.   My sister had the Pan-Seared Scallops. I haven't eaten scallops in years after an icky food poisoning incident but I had to try a bite and they were melt-in-your-mouth nummy. Tasted more like lobster than scallops even.  I was torn as to what to order but I settled on the Pan-roasted Chicken and I was far from disappointed. It was, by far, the juiciest, best prepared chicken dish I've ever had.   All told, it was a perfect evening. The atmosphere felt a tad dated but it almost made it all the more charming... kinda like we were stepping back in time a bit.

hqtX7p0uHjhpXeIt-s6J9Q.text: I had an outstanding dinner here tonight. Started off with a delicious ginger mojito and some pretty decent bread. I ordered the pepper steak which came with au gratin potatoes and spinach.  The spinach was very good. The steak was amazing - nice thick cut, with plenty of peppercorn and a perfect sear, cooked to a nice medium rare. But the au gratin potatoes literally brought tears to my eyes, they were so good. Easily the best potatoes I've ever had. I don't know what it was about them, but they were absolutely perfect.  It was a big meal, so I decided to skip dessert. But I know I'll be back again before too long.

0KkVmuk4YwpmatB4K1vw-w.text: Wow, incredible service, fantastic food and great ambiance.  We had Spinach Gnocchi, Carpaccio, Calamari and New York Strip all exceeded expectations.  Desert was Warm Chocolate cake with Pistachio ice cream and Cheesecake.  Highly recommend as a date spot, just a get together or special event.  Well worth it!

jtNH2U-zKYZkissHX-AsKA.text: Amazing!  The Chicken sausage pasta definitely works!

VAD7oTsLX_Rz8gDBE3_rTQ.text: Pretty damn good.  I'd say that going on a weeknight you'd see more of the Geriatric crowd there, but who gives a rats ass? This is the guy that smashed Kat Cora's face in on Iron Chef!  His cuisine reigned supreme! :D Anyway I went with my girl, she had the chicken I had the linguine with clams.  Fan-fucking-tastic.  Her chicken was cooked PERFECTLY - they even got the skin ontop nice and crispy.  My pasta was obviosly fresh and the broth/sauce it was served in with clams was soo god damn delish I had to soak it all up with bread before I let the bus boy have my plate.    Desert - very good, I had something made of chocolate, but my dates desert  - the strawberry short cake, on a sweet biscuit was a bit sour and not as sweet as we hoped. NOT bad by any stretch, but not what we were thinking it'd be.  The waitress promptly took it off the bill when we told her we didn't like it, saying she wants us to love our experience and to come back!  RAWK ON! Tarbell's FTW!!

tUoAlfnCnqhasBBEpUv36w.text: Don't come here for restaurant week, overpriced menu for the food you get. Tried all 3 main dishes and they were all bland, needed to add lots of salt. Service was excellent on the plus side.

hIoYHEWB-xCxHVbv3vo0Dg.text: Would never go back. The calamari was the most dull plain appetizer ever. At least try to serve something eye appealing. The side dish of white beans were basically fried peas, but just the shell of the pea - no pea inside. And it was served before the meal. We sent it back. I never send back a dish, So instead we got the peas and carrots which were drenched in butter. Again served before the meal! Why?? Than the meal. The halibut was dry, and had zero taste. The chef also forgot the sopreseta. And the waitress argued that it was there. Awful. The salmon was subpar, sitting on top of a oil drenched potato latke. The only reason there was lettuce on my plate was to soak up the oil. The bread and wine was good. We just couldnt wait to leave!  Sometimes i wonder if people just think they like the food because they should. A severe dissapointment. Sorry.

tg_wxSaZmr4moDqC8cDQHQ.text: I have to be honest. I wasn't really all that impressed.   I mean, it was good, but I have heard people ranting and raving about this place for a long time so perhaps the expectations were a lot higher than they should have been.  I got the scotch beef and it was delicious for the first few bites, and then I realized it tasted like the barbacoa from Chipotle.   Service was good, but not anything outstanding.

ZDX-_F0v1SWI62x2pXsmDg.text: Very good food. Had the pasta with bolognese sauce; very tasty. Bread pudding was divine. Service fair to partly cloudy. Table space is a bit tight. And, jaysus, does anyone put on decent garb to go out to dine anymore?  "Let's see: just finished mowing the lawn. Shit, shower and shave? Nah, blow it off honey, I'll go with what I got on..."  MadMen on AMC should be required viewing where men actually put on a necktie when going to someone else's home for dinner. Not that a tie is mandatory, but put on a collared shirt and a jacket in the winter time. Might actually lead an onlooker to believe you're doing well...hell, you'll believe it yourself after a while; funny how that works.

ztKycPXoXpHgnJrIrVe1WA.text: Extremely delicious!!! Great food, great service, great wine. Loved the innovative choices loved every minute we spent at this restaurant.

CH55xnygUsXU4rEAQ652Lg.text: I've been hearing the buzz about Tarbell's for the past six years. I finally tried it out. It was restaurant week - fixed menu. The soup course was borscht, followed by Cornish game hen with root veggies and for desert a lemon tart with raspberry sorbet.   Alright, I have to vent...I come from a family of skilled borscht chiefs!!! ;) While the dish Tarbell's called borscht was pretty good it was by no means borscht. Does that make sense? Well, if you're Ukrainian, Russian, Polish or some sort of Slavic it will. The Cornish game hen was really delicious, seemed like the perfect meal for a cool fall day. Crap, this is Phoenix and it doesn't cool off until December!! Sorry, got a little carried away with my fantasy. Back to the meal - the desert was amazing! Lemony goodness + a flavorful scoop of raspberry sorbet = happiness!!!  All in all Tarbell's scores 4 stars by me but don't take my word for it just eat it.

2pAs98gzHTd2Jzj5iTh_Ug.text: I go to Tarbell's about once a month, and the thing that impresses me is that I always get a great meal.  The appetizers are inventive and delicious, and the entrees, are always spot on.  If you are a person that likes great food, but does not like to try new things, order items from the "Things that do not change with the seasons" portion of the menu.  This features great dishes always served with seasonal organic vegetables.    If you like something new and sometimes different, order from the "Things that change with the seasons" portion of the menu.  Here you can find fresh and new menu items (although not changed that often).    Also, if you like fresh organic vegetables, Tarbell's has an organic vegetable plate served as an entree which is outstanding and always a little different.  Also good for an appetizer for two or three people.

gOadWX2gr3Zhm-ek5VAZDg.text: Great food and great service!  We had a fun evening. Highly recommend the cheesecake dessert!  Will definitely stop there again when we are back in town.

RGu7Olvvk5L4_Pr_4epmRQ.text: Had high expectations due to the celebrated chef. Pizza crust awful, honestly, frozen is better. Bolognese that is apparently made over days  is nothing close to Bolognese. Two poor dishes, we will not go back. The server was great however. I am sad to write this, maybe the amercian dishes are better.

fb42v8V8W9dyXjxs5VjS_g.text: The first time we went to Tarbell's was fantastic. This most recent time was a disappointment. The wine was good, and so was my meatball pizza. Mom's seafood chowder sounded like it would be full of mussels and there were hardly any. Dad got the spaghetti and meatballs and he compared it to Chef Boyardee. The chocolate mousse was outstanding but the ice cream in the profiteroles was gelatinous. Also, in our reservation, I left a note to the maitre d' that obviously wasn't passed along to our server. She did a great job, but it was disappointing that we had to fill her in.

a6FRtjPQsw7TwBgiGYQIxQ.text: We went there Saturday.  I had the cast iron-seared pepper steak.  My wife had the Swordfish special.  I also had  1/2 order of the Tuna Tartare and she had  1/2 order of Mussels and we split a Cesar salad.  The Tuna was tasty as were the Mussels.  There was nothing special about the Cesar.  Both main courses were TERRIBLE.  The Steak had no flavor.  Neither my wife or I can figure out how anyone can take a piece of meat like that and prepare it to the point where it is completely without taste.  I almost asked for steak sauce, or ketchup or anything to give it "something".  Fortunately, Salt fixes everything.  The creamed spinach is still a mystery.  Usually creamed spinach is chopped and has a cream sauce.  Spinach that is simply Boiled or Steamed spinach IS NOT creamed spinach.  The au gratin potatoes were dry as if they had been sitting, for hours, just waiting for a victim.  The Swordfish was equally as bad.  It had absolutely  no flavor and the consistency of a cardboard.  Her bustle sprouts did have some flavor since they were burned and tasted like charcoal.  We are still AMAZED that anyone had the skills necessary to turn two pieces of meat into completely flavorless ... I don't believe words exists to describe these bland "creations".  She was really excited about going to Tarbells, as was I and because of that, we were really let down.  Again, it wasn't just bad, it was TERRIBLE.   That was Saturday and we are still talking about how awful the food was at Teribells.  Now only was the food is Awful!!!!, Teribels is located in a terrible location, and we were lucky to get a parking spot.   We were so looking forward to a night of fine dining, instead, we got a bill for $103.00 for the worst tasting food either of us has ever endured.

G8CQPjIJFSLtgj1yJelgKw.text: A chef that can do great things with brussels sprouts always get major points with me, second only to one that can make creamy soups not laden with cream. Mark Tarbell does both exceptionally.   On our last visit, I broke tradition of ordering the special of the night and opted for the chicken. Yes, big deal one thinks ... think again. There is something magical in that bird, a perfect balance of salt and crispiness. When available, I go ga-ga for the lamb with brussels sprouts and french lentils. Another must is the duck confit appetizer. Heaven.   I typically don't bother with the pizza -- it is good, but not really an attraction. The by-the-glass list has several good selections, including a very well priced sparkling. The waitstaff is efficient, professional and friendly, something of a rarity even among many "upper echelon" establishments in the Valley. Yes, parking can be a bitch at that plaza, and yes, parts of the menu are a tad bit weather worn ... but sometimes there is nothing wrong with a little comfort food.

faN4FGN-1fgQGdOWjSGdag.text: I'm yelping out Tarbells a few months late beause I forgot to do it right after my first visit!   Hubby took me for Valentine's Day this year.  Great little romantic spot.  He tried the spaghetti and meatballs-didn't like it at all.  Felt that the sauce was a little bland and watered down.  I ordered the filet-which came out perfect and melted in my mouth-so good.  The manager came by and asked how our food was-I encouraged hubby to be honest.  He was.  They apologized profusely.  He then ordered the pan roasted chicken-loved it.  They also offered to make me a new meal since it was Valentine's Day and "i shouldn't have to eat alone."  Hubby didn't mind so I kept eating.  Mark Tarbell came by after the chicken came out to make sure it was to hubby's liking.  What do you say to the owner/Iron Chef?  Hell yeah he liked it!  In the end the wonderful manager at Tarbells comp'd our ENTIRE meal-4 glasses of wine, salads, appetizer and meals!  He said he did this since it was Valentines Day and they wanted the night to be perfect for us.  You don't come across such great service everyday.

RZxup_yzm3sbdmf9J_hDPg.text: The menu is always top-notch, the ingredients are fresh and there's always a nice ambiance in the place.  Come for the food, stay for the wine list and return to have a drink with the professional cougar who gave you her number at the bar.   I would recommend this place to anyone looking for great food and service.

Fc8skKC7qCHyhAtI05BWzA.text: I decided to try this Tarbell's after reading all the great reviews and it didn't hurt to hear about the owner winning on Iron Chef. I have to say this was a wonderful meal. I had the Scotch beef and my wife had the salmon, great flavor and quality. The service was very good, our waiter was very knowledgeable about the menu and made great recommendations on what to order. Very glad that we chose this place while in Phoenix.

Tiu0Z_M5XZ3gacPx-uAmcw.text: Excellent birthday dinner!  Spot on service and the food was delicious! You can't go wrong with the Scotch Beef - met in your mouth good!

PCz56gaAcbqgV_Zng6qJOQ.text: I have to whole heartedly disagree with the other diners here. I think this place is fantastic! We had reservations and did not have to wait at all. The service was prompt and our waiter was attentive, although he could have been a bit friendlier.   We had the spaghetti and meatballs, the pork chop, and the scotch beef. The meatballs were some of the best I've ever tasted and the pork chop was definitely in the top three pork chops I've ever had. The scotch beef was very good too, although it could have been seasoned a bit more. We had the bourbon bread pudding for dessert. Heaven! Absolute heaven!   We will definitely be back every time we are in the Phoenix area!

3jG8ooFSCOkhLCgI-wLDgg.text: Really good food but my only complaint would be the service. The beef carpaccio appetizer was fantastic - all fresh ingredients and a large portion. My father and I loved the swordfish special with yellow tomato broth, fig compote ad rice  Issues with service: It took a while to get the wine we ordered. My father and asked to sub the rice for roasted brussel sprouts on the swordfish and our waitress brought us the swordfish with just brussel sprouts. It took us a while to be able to flag our waitress down and get the other parts added to the dish. Those parts were pretty critical to the dish (pretty bland without them) and she really should've clarified in case she misunderstood (which she did).

mDiut64LFwW0OtF8h3f0bw.text: The chicken livers appetizers were fabulous but everything else was unremarkable.  The roast beef sliders bun was soggy and the meat was lacking in flavor and quantity; the pizzas were way to thin and overcooked so that it was like eating a cracker with tough overcooked cheese sticking to it.  The Margherita pizza came without fresh tomatoes top, which were missed because they may have added some moisture to the cracker effect.  The cheapest bottle of wine was $43.00.

SAua-nDndo7hDQORnuZcyg.text: My husband and I went for our Anniversary dinner the other night. The food was delicious! I had the NY Steak with fries. The streak was cooked perfect and the fries were out of this world. I could have eaten a whole plate full of just fries. My husband had the spaghetti and meatball. The meatball was as big as a softball! I got to taste a little bit and it also very good. We would definitely recommend this place. My only complaint is it was a little loud and it was sometimes hard to hear each other.

_c3GbuMEQT9MZ-9DLN9B7w.text: First time at Tarbell's but definitely not the last. Our server, Eric said the scotch beef was like a hug on a plate and I have to say it was a fabulous hug! The gnocchi also knocked our socks off! And the peach crumble - unbelievable. Thanks to Eric and the entire team at Tarbell's for a fantastic evening.

JqS7znfgSIYhGeTi-0L50Q.text: Another amazing meal accompanied by amazing service! We started with sharing the caprese salad and beet salad, both very good. The homemade burrata was very creamy on very fresh plum tomatoes with a light pesto sauce. The beet salad with arugula was even better. The sweetest beets with fresh crisp arugula and creamy goat cheese with a very light dressing both were so large I was able to take some of the beet salad home to enjoy. For our entrees my husband had the NY strip; very tender, cooked perfectly medium rare delicious with a Cabernet reduction. He loved the accompanying  sides of creamed spinach and freshly cut, crispy pommes frites. I tried both and they were very good. The spinach wasn't overly creamed like some, just very light and perfectly seasoned. I had the gnocchi with lobster which had spinach and tomatoes in a light Parmesan cream sauce. It had several large pieces of lobster. Some pieces were large enough to cut with a knife and the lightest tender gnocci. We also had some additional sides, peas with multi-colored carrots all fresh and cooked perfectly still had some crispness and my favorite the tempura cauliflower, so crispy and delicious. I don't think I want to eat cauliflower any other way! For dessert we shared the cheesecake and it is wonderful! Light and airy but still very creamy and cheesy. Everything is large portions so we had plenty of take home boxes which made the next very special. Our waiter Allen was personable and really payed attention to all of requests taking notes along the way. He was attentive without be over-bearing. The perfect dinner. We will be back.

YZlLJ2d-ZSvG_3kglMjnZQ.text: This is the finest restaurant in Arizona!  Mark the Chef and Owner is very personable and friendly.  The food and wine selections are amazing!

0UPFCES_nsGNqmRSQzmVkQ.text: All staff was extremely friendly and kind! It was my mom's birthday and my dad and I took her here, it was their first time. Andrew was a wonderful server, extremely attentive and we enjoyed talking with him. Chef Mark was also extremely generous as he provided my mom with complimentary artichoke hearts as a starter and then a cheesecake for dessert. We had a great experience and are looking forward to our next visit. Thank you so much!!

V8h5HWPEZFj5A0gGXsKjxQ.text: My boyfriend and I went here on a date following Food Network recommendations, and we were so impressed, we decided to post a review for the very first time ! We were truly delighted by every dish we tried, from the complimentary roasted parmesan chickpeas, the candied bacon and chicken fennel sausage pizza as appetizers, to the pan roasted chicken and NY peppered strip for mains. Dessert was amazing too, a salted caramel cheesecake! On top of the excellent food, the customer service was top notch, we had two amazing waiters who were so attentative, and truly went above and beyond to make our evening a pleasurable one. By far, THE BEST restaurant we've been to so far in Phoenix!!!

ETJeTTk_2rhO4wMkWFJJ7w.text: A friend recommended this restaurant and we had a nice evening here. I had the beef carpaccio for my meal (it's pretty large) and my friends had the salmon and the ribbon pasta. Overall my friends though the meal was just ok and our server wasn't on top of things. He asked if we wanted bread but then forgot to bring it, was slow on drink refills, etc. He also didn't alert my friends who ordered the salmon that it was served on top of a ton of greens so they each ordered salads to start. He ended up bringing us a Vanilla Cheesecake on the house and it was AMAZING! Best part of the night!

r6ZrS0yL__rLi-A0gpJAdA.text: Every item our table of four ordered was an exceptional taste treat, our waiter was very helpful and accommodating as well. Freshly inventive cuisine at it's best, a great experience and fun atmosphere!

bzDEnOalGMR4XecbiczBSA.text: This place never disappoints. Started with the crudo and sashito peppers, both were great. Had the salmon for my entree. Always good. I'm not even a huge salmon fan and would totally order it,again.  Finished with the bread pudding and a shot of 20 year pappy van winkle (we got the last 2 shots and the bottle). No better way to finish a meal.  Will be back, soon hopefully.

photos.caption: Photo of Tarbell's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. They have/had pappy! We killed that bottle.

BBqKPRkq9T4sgl9CbGd0Bw.text: Heard excellent things about this place. We were seated against the back wall of tables. Could not sit on the bench seating because of wood beam under the cushion. Moved over a table a same issue. Then realized it's because of how crammed in the tables are that if you slide over the slightest amount you might as well join your neighbors table. The dining room is excessively cramped, and LOUD. I hate hearing every detail of the neighbors table! Zero privacy whatsoever. Otherwise, the ambiance is nice enough. The bar area is nice. The food was good, but I'm really getting tired of seeing restaurants serve such oversized portions. It's offensive. And and a waste of food. Just stop it! I'll come back another time and give this place a 2nd chance.

REBfOn3m2A4EOG7s3tMY3g.text: Tarbell's is one off the best restaurants in the Phoenix area. Yes, it's a little pricey but I was impressed when our waiter could tell us all the ingredients in a particular menu item when asked... and there were quite a few! I had the scotch beef and my wife had the scallops. Our friends had the trout and spaghetti. The garbanzo bean appetizer is a wonderful. The wine list is spectacular.  Our real treat was the bing cherry desert. I'm not usually a big fan of cherries but this was marvelous. Our overall experience was one of the better fine dining experiences we have had in a long time. Too bad they are not open for lunch. If you know of a better place than this for fine dining please advise

wg78XHjnRXTe9ng6ictAiQ.text: The decor is superb. It definitely has an amazing atmosphere.  However, I do feel the food is overhyped. I had the famous spaghetti and meatball (I love spaghetti), it wasn't bad, just not superb enough to leave a famous impression in my mouth. The wine in the sauce could've definitely used some more reduction.  The rock shrimp app was ok. The house made mozzarella was really the star of the day. It was silky and rich and everything anyone could hope for in a mozzarella.  My partner had the scallops. They were cooked ok, could've used a bit more of a sear, but they were flavorful. The risotto bed they were on was not so flavorful. It was a bit too al dente  and lacked seasoning. To be fair we had just had an amazing sweet corn risotto the week before made by Justin Beckett that may have ruined our risotto experience for every place else from here on out.  The vanilla cheesecake was my favorite part of the meal. It was as creamy as the cheese and was not overwhelmingly sweet.  The service was, as to be expected, very good.

beZjTkg_Fvnv4Of6fanciA.text: Excellent food. I've been to this restaurant probably five times in the past four years, and it has never disappointed. Excellent service (the waiters even helped accommodate (move) me when a lady came in with overly strong perfume -- seriously folks, go easy on the chemical smells).   The food is delicious, and they have been able and willing to meet my dietary restrictions with delicious fare.   And, although the place is great, I've never come dressed better than semi-nice and that is perfectly acceptable. Highly recommend.

gvY-K_7MttSXVmHGPN9g8A.text: Great service an even better staff very knowledgeable.  The setting was very nice along with the decor my food was good an wish I had gotten what my lady ordered but next time.  The only thing I would change is the parking lot is set up ass backwards.

xpysSiheDqj6zTZ1ZRTtcw.text: I went here for my birthday and I have to say the manager did an excellent job, they were not able to seat us for our reservation so they gave us some free appetizers when we finally sat down.   Also had a champagne toast which was so nice. Didn't receive a birthday dessert but... Loved coming here with my family. I would come back for sure!

V1T_d9KJZTkaEdkv7hSS6Q.text: The environment and service were great, but the food was way too overpriced for how it tasted. It was not that special. We had a large group of about 10 people and nobody really liked what they ordered.

photos.caption: Photo of Tarbell's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. House ribbon pasta

e_pWdoSL_2mEI6FP0SZJ2A.text: We had a nice dinner at Tarbell. Wonderful service and a nice setting.   We started with house made mozzarella and tomato with was the highlight of the night. The mozzarella was soft, creamy and very flavorful. We than had the rock shrimp ravioli.  The ravioli dough was a little heavy and the shrimp lacked flavor.  Next I had the meatball piazza and my wife had the roast chicken.  The chicken was wonderful, the skin crisp and the meat moist and burgeoning with flavor. My piazza was good but am a piazza fanatic and had a few issues with the pie.  The pie was good as were the meatballs but the sauce was a stew/barbecue gravy rather than pure tomato base. It ruined the pie for me!  The biggest issue was the price, for the quality and location it is OVERPRICED.  Appetizer were $15 to $20 and main courses averaged $30!  The piazza was $14.  Overall it gets 3 stars, I would go back but be careful least I ordered!

bIkzSrJ-HdqnvvjZPfrUxw.text: My husband and I went in celebration of his recent promotion! Food was phenomenal as was the customer service! We will definitely be returning and recommending to others. Just a tip...BEST cheesecake we've ever had!!

photos.caption: Photo of Tarbell's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Nice touch to our celebratory meal!

XMQgDIRLKGl7GryxJ6tPHw.text: Haven't been here in a really long time and I came with my mom. Service was really great but they base it on when you finish each course. I had the mussels and calamari for an app. It was really tasty. I had the bolognese which was really meaty. My mom had the spaghetti and meatballs and the meatball is about a size of a huge fist. She cleared the plate and so did I. Cool spot, kinda on the pricy side but overall very good.

4wfs0M3rPPVmmhBpj7y9Fw.text: Outstanding atmosphere, food, desserts and drinks.  Great place for dinner with that special someone.
